Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great harbor view”
Reviews.Author: Mary F
Reviews.Content: We stayed last summer, took the water taxi from Logan Airport, walked to fabulous resturants and thorougly enjoyed the all-too-short stay. I'm looking forward to a return visit. The room was large, great full window view of the harbor, and great amenities.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel!”
Reviews.Author: georgina_n
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff and a clean comfortable room. Pretty harbor location.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: random315
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a great location. Room was large and even had an extra office space. Only stayed for one night but the food delivery to the room was great and there was a large number of restaurants to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DCTraveler2786
Reviews.Content: My girfriend and I recently spent a weekend in Boston to do a little sightseeing. I know InterContinental Hotels are usually very nice, but this was my first experience. This was a very classy, sleek, hotel that was also very comfortable. Pros: - Great location for the harbor - Excellent service (let me check in early in the morning) and were very kind - New and clean, and luxurious without being overbearing or gaudy - Walk most places (however, a little far from the shopping district and the park) Cons - No shuttle service to airports Excellent room, excellent location, excellent service. Will remember when I return to the city again.

Reviews.Title: “I felt like I was at the Bellagio!”
Reviews.Author: Allison P
Reviews.Content: The InterContinental was beautiful! Park next door though, do not park at hotel, it's too expensive. We parked at the garge next door and it was 10.00 for 24 hours on the weekend, we saved 30.00! It's about a one minute walk from garage to front door of hotel. We walked to the seaport convention center from the hotel, took about 12 minutes, not bad at all, much better then having to pay to park somewhere else. At night, we took a taxi to the North End for dinner ($9.00) and then decided to walk back to the hotel after dinner becasue it seemed short, took us about 15 minutes, but it was great to walk, we felt very safe even though we were the only ones walking. The hotel itself was amazing, so clean, and the room was great, it had a huge shower and awesome tub. It also had a slidding window between the bathroom and the bedroom which was fun to keep open :) I've stayed at the Bellagio in Vegas and I think this hotel is just as nice and quieter! Only downside was the room wa shot at night and you didnt have the option of putting the AC on and cold not open a window.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Carocass1432
Reviews.Content: Looking for a 4.5 Star Hotel? The Intercontinental has.a.fantastic.atmosphere in the Heart of Boston! The personnal are very informative & helpful. The rooms are clean and done in a tasteful Mahogany. The bedding is fine linen, and the bathrooms are large spa like w/ a cream marble. Right on the Harbor, you have easy walking access to all of Boston. Definitely worth the mon$y.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: bettygirl14
Reviews.Content: Spent a weekend here recently with a group of friends for a "girls weekend". The location is perfect, walking distance to almost everything. The hotel staff is very nice and was also very helpful. The room was exceptional, and the bathroom was to die for! The tub was HUGE and there was plenty of room for all four of us to get ready at the same time. The entire hotel is spotless. Bravo to all the staff at the Intercon Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great Convention Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Akwaaba
Reviews.Content: We visited Boston for the first time During the International Boston Seafood Show in March of 2011 . Originally we chose The Omni Parker House Hotel but after entering the rooms, decided to look for a better option . Let's just say the Omni had too many negatives (tiny rooms, dingy looking and haunted!) After calling around for vacancies during one of the busiest conventions of the year ,we found a room at IC Boston (thank God). The front desk staff saw how tired and frustrated we were and decided to make our transition easy by upgrading our rooms to the club floor . Club is the way to go , if you have the cash to spare and are coming in for business / convention because of all the freebies you'll receive with club access, such as unlimited food and drinks and use of wifi in their lounge. Speaking of wifi, that would be my greatest complaint if any. Wifi in my opinion should be complimentary at every hotel, however at IC's worldwide it's often very pricey . The rooms are very spacious ,well appointed and CLEAN. The shower is separated from the bath and you even get a scale and loads of fresh fluffy towels. However ,their beds were a litIe too firm for my liking. Loved the gym and pool area. Concierge is wonderful This hotel is beautiful and may considering coming back to IC for next Year's Seafood Processing show- if I get a good deal .

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location & nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: Emptynesters09
Reviews.Content: We'll definitely be coming back to this hotel. It's within walking distance of so many restaurants and shopping making it a perfect home base. The staff are helpful and attentive. The rooms are a nice size so you don't feel cramped. Drinks at the bar are ridiculously priced, but with so many other options nearby it's not a problem. Some might not like the sliding (opaque) window between the bedroom and bathroom area, but we didn't find it to be an issue.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you could hope for in a hotel....”
Reviews.Author: Puzzleman26
Reviews.Content: The weekend of February 18th,2012 we stayed at the Intercontinental in Boston. From the minute we pulled up everything was taken care of. The parking staff took our bags and brought them to the bell hop who waited till we tended to a few details. Elizabeth at the front desk listened intently as we expressed our desires. She had everything under control. Next we stopped at the concierge desk and were assisted by Luis Branco. He couldnt do enough for us. He made dinner reservations at a restaurant for us. When we got to the restaurant we were provided with dessert on the house compliments of Luis and the hotel. To make matters even more enjoyable ...our names were printed on the menu welcoming us to the restaurant. Dinner was lovely. Our hotel room was perfect overlooking where the Boston Tea party occured. The rooms were spacious and extremely comfortable. Large bathroom. The entire staff no mater what their position, were very friendly. Always greeting us with a hello. The next morning we had invited some friends of ours for brunch. Again the the staff were wonderful and the food was terrific. All unique and delicious. I would recommend the Intercontinental to everyone ! I am only sorry I had not sent my daughter here when she had visited Boston. As for location it is just a few blocks from many of the important sites. Nice safe area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: chgilbert3
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Intercontinental in Boston on saturday night for a night out away from the children. We had an absolutely great experience from booking through checkout. The staff was extremely courteous and helpful, the room was everything we expected. We were located on the 6th floor looking out at the children's museum, a higher floor would have been even better, but we got a great rate on the room so I'm not going to complain. The location was perfect, a short walk to Fanieul Hall and the North End. I'd definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: RosieLeeM
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while visiting family in the Boston area. I had never been to Boston before and wanted to be close to the "action". We were in walking distance to many attractions. We ate in a lovely restaurant in Boston's Little Italy. We walking around for hours, enjoying the shops and the whole feel of Boston. We were able to soak up a lot of the history of Boston. The hotel itself was clean and beautifully decorated. It is located on the actual spot where the Boston Tea Party took place. In all, it was a wonderful stay, and I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service”
Reviews.Author: lindseybee
Reviews.Content: I had never stayed in an intercontinental before and now I know it won't be the last. It was extremely clean, comfortable and affordable. In a great location by the water and a short drive from the airport. It's close to good pubs and downtown shopping. We weren't even charged for checking out an hour late and they put us on a higher floor with no problem. All in all it was smooth checking in and out. Only downside was that the dinner wasn't great in the hotels restaurant and the drinks were pretty expensive, but it comes with the territory. I would recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Classy and enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: DebbiesOnTheRoad
Reviews.Content: This is a higher-end hotel on the water on the outskirts of the Boston financial district. Itâ€™s near the airport and easily reached by the Blue or Silver lines, if you donâ€™t want to take a cab. I was visiting a client in the building next door, so the location was perfect. If I were visiting Boston as a tourist, Iâ€™d probably want to stay somewhere along the Freedom Trail. Itâ€™s not far, but Boston isnâ€™t an easy town to figure out if you donâ€™t know where youâ€™re going. The staff was uniformly friendly and helpful. My king-size room had a large work area facing the window. The flat-screen TV has a good cable lineup. The bathroom is unique and has a deep bathtub plus a separate shower area, both of which have fixed and hand-held fixtures. The sink has plenty of counter space. Toiletries include shampoo, conditioner, and lotion, plus paper items like cotton balls and swabs. The fitness center is outstanding, with an array of cardio machines, free weights, and a full weight machine circuit. Business services are expensive. Internet is $14.95 a day. There is a â€œbusiness centerâ€� in the gift shop, but there are charges for using the computers. Rooms have minibars and coffee service. Your morning newspaper is the Wall Street Journal.

Reviews.Title: “In the land of classic hotels, this new modern one is a gem.”
Reviews.Author: Mikebrez
Reviews.Content: Sure there is certain charm to older, historic and classic hotels. there are plenty of them in boston, but to me there is also a hug upside to new everything. This hotel is very new, all glass and gorgeous outside and in. ** notice** at any InterContinental if you are an ambassador platinum/gold its a huge help. Yes they do treat you very well if you are at this status. Keep in mind you can buy ambassador status with points now also. Its worth it.. free night stay and your guaranteed and upgrade at this hotel the next room up is a huge difference in price so boom just made it worth it. regardless if you are a ihg group member or not the hotel is great. vast, open,spotless. rooms are creative, modern and comfortable. The views are some of the best in the city and the location to walk from is great for a lot of attractions including the freedom trail. Legal seafood just down the street a boston must. I rarely give any thing a 5 star review this deserves it. I can definitely see that ambassadors get treated better by a luke warm staff, but if you get past that easily you love your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous rooms and great location - Highly recommend!”
Reviews.Author: xena2542
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night as a getaway, the hotel is very elegant and relaxing. From the valet parking to check in/out to room service the service providers were prompt and extremely courteous. The room was beautiful and the bed was very comfortable. The finishings in the room itself and bathroom were well done and modern. A really neat feature of the room was a sliding set of panels built into the wall between the bathroom and main room that allowed you to see the flat panel TV as you got ready in the morning. There was also a separate shower and soaking tub in the bathroom. The water pressure in the shower was awesome too. The hotel is conveniently located right near the waterfront and Trade Center on Seaport Drive and it's also really easy to get to off of Route 93 and the Mass Pike.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: Linta9
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel with great waterfront location in financial district for both: business and leisure, walking distance to a multitude of attractions; such as the North End, Faneuil Hall Marketplace, Quincy, Beacon Hill and the Theatre District. It was really easy to find it, from the Logan International Airport by water taxi. The room was nice, clean and large with windows on two sides, with excellent facilities and luxurious bathroom. The bed was very comfortable. Staff was very helpful. Breakfast was delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Michele J
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for one night during Valentine's weekend last year. We live outside of Boston but wanted a romantic night away from the everyday hustle and bustle. The rooms are very modern and have beautiful bathrooms! The beds are very comfortable too! We enjoyed relaxing in the indoor pool while looking out at the snowy streets outside. This hotel is conveniently located near South Station, where you can access trains and buses. It is along the Boston Harbor which is a great area to walk around and get some dinner or drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: morevacation
Reviews.Content: Travel to Boston weekly, and I have stayed at multiple hotels to keep it interesting. The Intercontinental is on my top five list. I find the crowd here slightly younger than at the Ritz, Four Seasons, etc. which makes it a little more fun for pre or post dinner cocktails. It is a fine place for both business and pleasure. Room: all very modern, spacious and comfortable. no complaints and always enjoy my sleep. Service: while not as on point as some other high end hotels in town, always very professional. Location: perfect - can walk to all major tourist sites. easy access to South Station (walking) and 10-15 mins from airport. Facilities: gym has some free weights, but plenty of treadmills. never used the spa, but looks nice. there is a fun bar (Rum Bar) which is fairly in the evening. food is fine, but you are so close to other options leave the hotel and venture about. Overall good choice - the Ritz and Four Seasons may have the edge on accomodations (just by a bit) but I like the location and vibe of the IC better.

Reviews.Title: “The InterContinental-- Love can/will Spark In Boston on Valentines Day”
Reviews.Author: robin p
Reviews.Content: Guys: Let me help you out for this upcoming Holy of Holiest of Holiday's. Bigger than Christmas. Bigger than Birthday's. I propose to you that Valentine's Day is the Holy of Holy for your lady. I know this because my wife has told me so. And she is right...Right! Ok, so for you gentlemen looking for a great way to spice up the relationship or impress that beautiful someone the InterContinental is the place to do it!! First, the rooms are exquisitly decorated. When you walk into the rooms the warmth of the dark woods and "Film Noir" lighting speak of the pending "heat" awaiting the lucky couple sharing the room. The bed--most important here because you should be spending most of the time in it--is splendid. Filled with large crisps fluffy white pillows and white bedding it is truly falling into clouds-- you don't want to move. Now, I have stayed there with my Conejolita (that's my wife of 30 years as of this June) three or four times. Each room had the same set up with a sliding panel above the bed that when opened revealed the bathroom. But, not just the bathroom but a stylish large tub with jets and decorative hardware...it fits TWO. Now, if you plan ahead GENTLEMEN--that's a hint. If you plan ahead, get yourself some great wine(more then one!), cheese, grapes, humus, dark chocolate, fresh made bread and a bit of hard salami and put together a small basket. Now don't forget the napkins and plates. Book one night at the InterContinental and you will be a hero. Because you rescue Romance from the grips of sitcom tv and the couch! Here's the catch, to take true advantage of the InterContinental's beauty and location you need to check in around 3pm (this is normal). But to make the date truly romantic, you need to have your lady in the room by 4pm...Why? Because you are not only going to give her an afternoon of hot tub, pampering, and love making, but you are going to watch a "chickflick" with her after the fireworks and then later you are going to take her out on the town and give her the nightlife. And don't give me that "I don't dance" stuff. The InterContinental has a great bar downstairs that is super-stylish. It has a fabulous selection of excellent wines, cushy atmosphere and good music light ly playing in the background. You should stop there for a drink around 9pm. Have one, then head out the front door into the world of great dining. You only have to walk 100 yards and on the water is a plethora of great restaurants. I am not going to tell you in this review where to go--(hahah)--but will say any place around there is a great choice. That's the point...the InterContinental allows you to have maxium "Romance-ability!" So, after a great dinner, it's about 11:00pm now you walk down the street to the "Livingroom." It's a swanky club with two large bars that are arty. The place is loaded with couches and chairs over-stuffed and soooo comfy. There is music playing and lights flickering giving you that "city-night-club-I-am-out-with-the-hip-people-crowd-thing." And the funny thing is that you are!!! Now, have a martini, or something. Then order their Calamari and sit back and enjoy the view. It is a great place. Whew, now...it's 1:30am. Your lady has her hand wrapped deep in yours. You can hear, in the silence as you walk back to the InterContinental, her complete happiness and contentment. You, my good fellow, have wooed her right tonight. You get back to the room. To that amazing bed and you tumble into the fluffiness awaiting. And your lady rolls atop you all smiles and kissy and says "what do you have planned for next year?'" And you look at her, cause she must be crazy. And you say cooly. "The InterContinental of course!!" And you will, because it is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “What a treat!”
Reviews.Author: kelleigh1
Reviews.Content: We had the opportunity to spend a night here following my office holiday party. Because we had the party at the hotel, we were able to get a discounted room. The room was beautiful, with a nice view of the Rose Kennedy Greenway. Everything about the place was fantastic, from the staff/service, to the rooms and the food that we were able to enjoy - both at the party and our breakfast at Miel. We enjoyed the buffet and were pleasantly surprised at the price tag. It was certainly more than we would normally spend for breakfast, but less than I was expecting at such a beautiful and classy place in downtown Boston. I hope that we hold future office parties here and that we'll again have the opportunity to spend a night or two.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our stay”
Reviews.Author: pepoling
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night in January with my mother. We had a superb time. Every employee was extremely cordial and helpful. We booked the cheapest 2-bed room. The room was big and the beds & linens extremely comfortable. The windows were huge but overlooked an alley-way (fine since we didn't care about a view) The bathroom was wonderful - both a bathtub and a glass-enclosed shower (with a very handy shelf) It was extremely quiet both during the day and the night (in fact, even though it was a Saturday night, it seemed almost empty - very peaceful!) The gym had a lovely view and a cool locker room with electronic lockers and a steam room. The pool was also great and deserted whenever we went there. Plenty big for swimming laps. The restaurant served a delicious dinner and breakfast. The pastries with the continental breakfast were delectable and the unlimited fresh-squeezed orange juice was great. There is also a nice bar that sort of spills into the lobby - lots of comfy chairs and couches and a little fireplace; good and interesting cocktails, not ludicrously overpriced. The location is superclose to South Station and 5 min from Boston Common. I LOVED this hotel! The price (ours included breakfast) was great for a January weekend - worth a splurge if you normally stay at cheaper places.

Reviews.Title: “Top shelf”
Reviews.Author: BrooklynD
Reviews.Content: Great location for quick travel from NYC or Boston, short walk from North Station so Acela train gets you almost to the front door. Very elegant, clean, calm modern-style hotel. Very nice rooms, higher rooms have great view. Spacious bathrooms with both tub and shower. Lounge/restaurant has nice laid back but classy vibe, and good food. Room service food was good as well. Front desk was courteous and efficient. Slightly strange location for business center, in the gift shop, would have liked a bit more privacy as I worked with some non-public documents, but that's a small complaint. My only other negative would be that it was a freezing cold day, and my room was a bit chilly and seemed to have a hard time warming up, but it eventually did once I turned up the thermostat. I was on the ninth floor, and it was very windy, and I had a corner room with gorgeous floor to ceiling windows on two sides, so I think that had an impact. Loved the windows, so hard to complain! No surprises, worked perfectly for a business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Good service; a little noisy”
Reviews.Author: tabibit
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night - despite our last minute decision, when we called, the reservation agent was very efficient to make our same-day reservation. The check-in was smooth, staff very courteous and helpful. The guestroom was comfortable. I felt that insulation was not sufficient - we could hear street noise as well as the hallway noise (other doors opening and closing/people talking). Breakfast at Miel was very pleasant. One thing about valet parking - we could unload our luggage at the hotel entrance. Upon check-out, we were instructed to go down one floor to pick up our car. I do not think you call that "valet service" - we had so many luggage pieces, and the car was not ready though we called at least 30 minutes earlier. The parking is run by a separate entity, so that has something to do with it. Overall stay was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Love this Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ackelley
Reviews.Content: This was our second time staying at the Intercontinetal. This time we brought our kids 15 & 12. Had a city view room, which I loved. Got a rate that included breakfast in MIel. Kids enjoyed pool. Fitness center is huge and looks out over the street and city. Great location to waterfront and Fanuel Hall. The Rumba bar is very cozy. We have stayed at Boston Harbor Hotel and prefer to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and luxurious”
Reviews.Author: EastCoaster87
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here over Christmas and it was a great choice! The hotel is luxurious in every sense of the word. From the marble lobby to the granite bathroom, and jacuzzi-like bathtub, to the doorman, it deserves every one of its Four Diamonds. We found the service to be wonderful. The receptionist at check-in was very friendly and helpful, the doorman allowed us to park our car out front while we took our bags upstairs. And when I needed salt at 10:30pm, room service graciously had it sent up to our room within 60 seconds. The only drawback I can think of is the size of the rooms and the mini-fridge. We got a standard room which basically fit a bed, long dresser, desk and 2 night tables. There wasn't too much space (drawers) to put our stuff. We had food to put in the mini-fridge, but it was already filled with snacks that we'd have to pay for if we moved them. We managed to squeeze in 2 yogurts and a water bottle. Also we officially got a water-view room, but in actuality it's a view of the other part of the Intercontinental, and if you squeeze all the way to the left, you can catch a glimpse of some water. The gym is huge and better-equipped than any gym I've been to. We didn't actually visit the pool, but from the gym you can see it's clean and modern, and a nice size for swimming laps. The gym and pool are surrounded by glass, so you won't get much privacy. Parking: With parking $40/day, you can park at 75 State Street or Central Parking a few blocks away (4 min walk) for half the price. Overall, we'd definitely come here again, although not for a family vacation, since the rooms are too small, not enough storage space, and the financial district is not that exciting.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: DLE E
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for the first time after staying at other hotels in downtown Boston. The Intercontinental offers a great view of the harbor, a convenient walking distance location, a spacious lobby and lobby bar, and very comfortable rooms. My room rate was competitive (by Boston standards).

Reviews.Title: “Average and lacking attention to details!”
Reviews.Author: ILT186338
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for the second time - due to business reasons - and are still not convinced! Service: not friendly/helpful at all, strange/arrogant attitude towards guests Concierge: average, arrogant and really short-spoken - not very helpful at all Room: size wise ok but dark, lights are not strong enough to enlighten the room properly Bathroom: mould at the corners of the shower, shower is leaking.....always water running along the floor after taking a shower Bedroom: always dusty, lights were flickering every now and than Constantly noises from climate controls, fridge, venting and lamps. Our room was always dusty and the cleaning ladies tend to forget to refill things (tissues, cotton pads, Q-Tips, towels, toilet paper). Coffee making machine is very cheap and coffee tastes awful. Providing bottled water as a courtesy should be the least such a hotel should provide. No shower gel.....just a piece of soap! (??? Are we back in the 70's?) Shampoo, Conditioner and Body Lotion seem to be of low quality. WIFI expensive (15 USD per day excl. taxes). No free WIFI at all (not even in the lobby). A hotel of this standard should be paying more attention to details and guests should be treated welcoming and respectful! It is lacking atmosphere, cleanliness and friendliness.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay in Boston”
Reviews.Author: xtreat
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 nights during Thanksgiving week, with a Hotwire nightly rate of $149. I arrived @ 10 am and was able to check right in. Loved the room, especially the spacious bath. Bed could have been a bit less firm, but was ok. Great rum bar with very tasty appetizers, and great staff throughout. The location is superb - very close to S Station T and a short walk to Quincy Market. I didn't get a chance to sample the cont. breakfast, as it was only offered Tues-Thurs.

Reviews.Title: “Overally Disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: Alvarado07
Reviews.Content: I am a Platinum member, I all do is travel for business, which means that I am clear and understand true customer service and quality. My cousin and I choose to celebrate my birthday in Boston, but I was very surprised at the service and staff demeanor towards the guest. The rooms were great and housekeeping staff was amazing! The restaurants are overly priced and the food was not great at all. The management seemed bothered and did not care to resolve issues. I was charged a portion on my credit card of someone elseâ€™s bill, which the manager promised would remove; needless to say I am still disputing the charge. The worst part of the stay was when a waiter explained that Boston and the Intercontinental was deceiving and was not a very multiracial and diverse as it seems or promotes. He then proceeded to explain that there were not many guest of diverse backgrounds staying as guest, they were treating us like we should have been the maids. Overall, was shocked by the statement but surely agreed in the end with his comment. Highly disappointing and discouraged, it truly is a beautiful property.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Rohit K
Reviews.Content: It was terrible being there. I never had imagined that I can be there. After spending a lot on this trip I am so ashamed that I chose poorly.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: emily84London
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my boyfriend in the Summer while he was training with work. I felt like a star- the room was so luxurious and clean, open and airy (with great air con facility) as was the bathroom. It was all very clean- practically spotless. (This may be because I am from England where things are slightly older and more cramped)! The service was excellent, I walked everyday to the Boston Common and shopping area which was less than ten minutes walk. The tube stop is less than five minutes away as is South Central train station There is a great view of the river. I genuinely feel this is how stars live when they are on tour. The only downside is that I couldn't afford it- this was a company paid for trip.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Akhilk
Reviews.Content: Superb location, great service, great hotel! Very convenient for biz + leisure travel. Rooms are great and spacious. The bar in the lobby is great and food quality is good as well. Concierge is very well informed and extremely helpful. The hotel is just 15min from the airport and pretty much equi distant from wherever you want to go.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LFCT46
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location, great service, beautiful view of the river, ocean and city. Within walking distance of just about everything. Great restaurants close by.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: tyke_11
Reviews.Content: we stayed for 3 nights in Sept on our arrival the incompetant doorman failed to get all our bags from the trunk of the taxi and then allowed the taxi to leave the hotel. The bag that he left in the trunk contained our money,passports and various other items.The doormans first lie was that most things left in taxis were returned.we never got our bag back.Don't complain to management they will state that it wasn't their fault.Because of the incompetant doorman we had to fly to New York to replace our passports at our expense.You will not get an apology from the management remember it was your fault you allowed the members of his staff to get your bags from the taxi. this is one Hotel we will never say at again. The only person who went the extra mile to help us in every way possible was Mr Luis Branco the concierge he was exceptional and withuot his help i don't know how we would have coped.

Reviews.Title: “Better than Expected”
Reviews.Author: netminder_60490
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Intercontinental for a business trip. The room was beautiful. Modern with great features. Shower was exceptional. Bed very comfortable, and nice sized flat screen TV. The hotels location was great. Close to plenty of restaurants and the Freedom Trail. Staff was very helpful and courteous. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Class, Comfort, Great Views”
Reviews.Author: mollydotcom
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights for a client in the area. I am a member of the Ambassador Club even though I don't normally spend time in InterContinentals themselves, rather, the offer to join came through membership in their Priority One club, which I do rack up a lot of points with. So it came as somewhat of a surprise when perk after perk was offered to me during my stay! First off, I had booked a king bed. I get to my room, and it's a corner suite overlooking a channel and beyond to the Harbor. Absolutely gorgeous views! I had far too much space for just one person, but it was extremely comfortable, with a wonderful bed, terrific linens and a bathroom with a huge jacuzzi tub and full shower. Clean, well cared for, and well designed room that was also very quiet and private. The public spaces are very modern, and the lounge offers a nice menu and impressive list of wines, beers, and spirits. I got in quite late and needed to unwind, so I went and had a glass of wine and a club sandwich. It came with french string fries that were cooked in truffle oil and delicately spiced with salt, pepper and a bit of chive. AMAZING. The service was great and everyone very friendly and attentive. One perk that was absolutely wonderful was late checkout at 4pm! Since my flight didn't leave 'til the evening, this allowed me to invite some friends over to my suite and have a lunch, giving us enough time to visit in comfort. We ordered from room service, we all had grilled cheese and those fantastic fries, and it was just a great time. All my needs - rides, concierge service, business services - were available and nothing was left unattended. The service and style of InterContinental Hotels are generally excellent, Boston is no exception. Not typically my favorite type of hotel (I tend to prefer a less luxurious and expensive environment) but certainly would stay again for a client. While the expense was significant, the quality of services and perks received made it not unreasonable for future consideration.

Reviews.Title: “Love the rooms”
Reviews.Author: ivster
Reviews.Content: My wife and I seem to conflict on which type of hotels are our favourites. She likes classic old school and I love modern big. Well the InterContinental Boston meets my list. Great big confortable modern rooms with amazing views and all the best features. The location is close to all the tourist spots within walking distance to most. The staff look after us well.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but not great”
Reviews.Author: FairLady80
Reviews.Content: Arrived and there was a huge line for check-in. No Priority Club or Ambassador check-in either. Same issue upon departure. Upgraded to a very nice suite with a lovely view of a rooftop! It's one of those places that does certain things really well and then let's themselves down on the simple things like having no staff in the Club Lounge during the 'quiet' period (middle of day) so if you happen to go in, you will find dirty tables, nothing in the fridges etc. Not what I expect of an InterContinental branded hotel, especially given the price per night.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and great location for the city”
Reviews.Author: CasaMurguia
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel this month on a quick business trip. We arrived late on the Saturday night and check in was as simple as ever, the only issue was they (the hotel staff) put both rooms in my travel companions name which confused the billing quite a lot. The room was fine, not extremely large but as a city goes it was good, plenty of space really for one person. It was very clean and I have to say was well decorated and kept very well. The bathroom was a great size and like other reviewers I did not like the shutter separating the bathroom from the bedroom. Overall the room was very comfortable and well furnished, the TV had plenty of choice. We did dine in the bar the 1st night and had a single appetizer with two beers which cost us over $55 bucks which was expensive. The hotel is a large city hotel and lacks charter really, the staff could do better to make you feel more at home but location and comfort was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Boston!”
Reviews.Author: tracers73
Reviews.Content: I returned to Intercontinental Boston for the second time after having such a wonderful experience on my first visit. The hotel is in a great location - 2 blocks to the South Street Station, which has easy access to Logan airport, the red subway line, and Amtrak and commuter rails. 3 blocks up to Quincy Market/Faneuil Hall, and a few more blocks past that to the North End. The hotel staff has always been professional and courteous and never failed to meet my needs. Concierge staff was quick with directions and suggestions for dinner. The rooms are spacious and comfortable. The gym has a good amount of cardio equipment and weights - one of the best hotel gyms I have seen in a while. The hotel itself is just beautiful. Alot of marble and wood, fireplaces in the lobby with several different seating areas to just sit and relax. The in-lobby bar, RumBar had a nice atmosphere as well. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Boston, you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Very good if you've got some discount rate but lucking something here”
Reviews.Author: Henrypapa
Reviews.Content: Sure, this hotel has some advantages for Boston travelers. - Very close to Boston Airport (just one ride of "Silver Line") - 4-5 minutes walk from Merto (Red Line - South Station) - 10 minutes walk to Boston Common, Chinatown and some shopping/sight seeing area - Good view of river - Big, clean and comfortable room with enough amenities - Luxurious restaurants/bars at lobby level InterContinental Boston is rated as "4.5-star". From facility standpoint, they must have such items and I think this hotel reached that level. I really enjoyed the room itself. However, I didn't feel like 4.5-star from service standpoint. I don't say their service was bad. It was sufficient but still a bit far from 5-star class hotels I visited recently. I felt some distance with staff members in this hotel. (It is a bit difficult for me to explain.) If you have got some discount rate (like $200/night with tax), I say "You should get it". You will be satisfied with this hotel. You cannot get such high-class hotels with this price in Boston usually. (I believe you can find this rate if you book in advance in some discount websites.) But if you are paying it with standard rate (such as $300 or more for the normal room), you might be able to find better options in downtown area. Overall, it is not bad at all but it might better to find another place if you are looking for some special occasions in Boston hotel stay.

Reviews.Title: “A nice find”
Reviews.Author: Cheryl P
Reviews.Content: We booked via hotwire and got a great rate for a one night stay in Boston. The hotel was clean, quiet, convinient to the waterfront, north end, and pub crawling. We were able to check in early and relax in the comfortable room. I loved the jacuzzi!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great meeting venue!”
Reviews.Author: SDC372
Reviews.Content: I just hosted a meeting at the Intercontinental for 3 days and the venue was excellent. The service was outstanding - the staff truly went above and beyond to make sure our expectations were exceeded. The hotel is relatively new and within walking distance of a number of new restaurants in the Seaport District. It's also a short walk to Quincy Market (a popular tourist spot). The meeting room had floor to ceiling windows and a view of the water, which added to our experience (since we spent the majority of our time in the room). We had meals catered in the room and ate one meal at Miel (one of the restaurants onsite) and the food was delicious. We used the concierge quite a bit for reservations and the business center for some copying needs - both services were excellent. A number of us used the fitness center, which was a good size and had a great view of the greenway. I would definitely recommend it for business or leisure!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, definitely 5 stars”
Reviews.Author: SaintmarkLondon
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights on business, it's a great hotel. I travel in the US on business and sometimes do these reviews. Firstly it's close enough to most of Boston, but not to close to noise etc. Easy to get around and the silver line from the airport is a 2 min walk. I get expenses so could use any mode, but this is quicker and easy. The hotel is stunning, it should not be anything but 5 stars on tripadvisor. The bars, lobby and rooms are great. I'm in a river view, which is pretty big and a great bathroom. The gym and pool are great. The staff are all helpful, couldn't do enough. I can't rate the room highly enough. Sushi is very good, as is the bar. I would stay here again, and will.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star feel at 4 Star Pricing”
Reviews.Author: beantownchick
Reviews.Content: I LOVE this brand. Never had a bad experience. Service is always exceptional and food is always good. It's like a JW wrapped in a W rolled into a Grand Haytt. The staff is like a Ritz without the attitude and the feel is like a W without the wanna-be's in the lobby (you know the type Justine Bebe look-a-likes). The Boston Intercon has a great location, right on the water, walking distance to lots; even from South Station if you're not hauling a lot of luggage. Great for business and leisure. Meeting space is convenient and the pre-function space is wide enough that multiple groups have space.

Reviews.Title: “Superb, spacious, wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Parsely115
Reviews.Content: Really beautiful hotel right on the waterfront. Modern design (hotel built in 2006) with very spacious rooms. That was really a plus for us, because being cramped (especially travelling with a 1 year old!) is always something we're concerned about in city hotels. We had chosen this hotel, in part, due to it's proximity to the aquarium area - a short nice walk down the boardwalk. The room was gorgeous, with a lavish, large bathroom. We did pay a little extra for an ocean view. 3 restaurants in the hotel - we went to just one routinely, Miel, for breakfast and dinner. Really just superb. I can't say enough good things about this hotel. To be fair, though, it's not perfect. Firstly, it is a little pricey. And they don't currently offer free Wi-fi, which I think is a little silly. However - it was a blessing, though, to have some time away from the computers. Highly recommended - we will surely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for business meeting”
Reviews.Author: travel-from-NY-79
Reviews.Content: This hotel was good for our business meeting. Downtown area (Quincy market, Boston Uni, Mall) was very close to the hotel. So atleast we got to get out after meeting was done.

Reviews.Title: “very good but NOT a luxury experience”
Reviews.Author: emilymalbanyc
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, courteous staff. But sadly, not the type of Intercontinental experience I remember. Some examples: - Costsavings (whether for the environment or for $$ reasons -shouldn't mean that only 1 or after day 1 NO washcloth is provided, or that bedlinens don't smell fresh (better after a change was specifically requested for the next day -creepy on reflection). - Unlike other Boston 4 -5 star or boutique hotels in the same cost range, there's no morning coffee or tea ($3.00 for a small cup), and no coffemaker in the room either. Need I mention that there was no turndown service, no chocolate, no slippers! Intercontinental - look to your competition!

Reviews.Title: “A Fantastic Well Placed Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BluebellEssex
Reviews.Content: We were welcomed immediately on arrival and suitcases taken to our rooms. Prompt checking in by friendly staff in a very attractive reception area. Hotel in financial district and within easy walking distance of freedom trail and Quincy market to name a few. So very well placed - also only a short drive from airport. The room we had faced the harbour and was a lovely size, beautifully clean, and very comfortable. The bathroom had windows opening up into the room if you wished and the fittings absolutely first class - a real treat to relax in at the end of a day sightseeing. The restuarant offered an excellent breakfast choice in really lovely surroundings. We also enjoyed a fabulous meal in evening. Cannot recommend this hotel highly enough. Fabulous stay.

Reviews.Title: “Bed hard and uncomfortable”
Reviews.Author: Nikki L
Reviews.Content: If you like firm beds, this hotel is for you! But if you are like me and like a comfy bed, stay somewhere else. I was here for 3 nights and if i would have stayed longer, then I would have moved to another hotel because the bed was so hard. I was expecting more comfort for the price. Pros:Bathroom spacious, location great, gym was fabulous and free. Cons: overpriced breakfast (not very yummy) although it easy to get really good breakfast in the area, the BED.

Reviews.Title: “Intercontinental - not as great as the last time”
Reviews.Author: akaShredder
Reviews.Content: First of, I love Intercontinental hotels, which is why I was so excited to return to this one in Boston. The pros: Great gym. Seriously, I would come back just for that! Good cardio machines, overlooking downtown Boston, clean, all the best amenities. The rooms were great as usual (best part is the bathrooms, but beware if you're sharing a room, some of the bathrooms have a window connecting into the hotel room. the glass is frosted, but not entirely soundproof as it can be opened. So maybe that's a partial con). The cons: The restaurant. We usually just eat breakfast there but I was so excited to go back for their spectacular breakfast buffet. This time, for some strange reason, they did't have it at all for our 3 day weekend stay and the staff could not provide any reason as to why. We ordered a la carte instead and waited almost an hour for the food (the restaurant was empty). Not worth the money. There was also some confusion before we got to the hotel about our rooms that we booked (via Hotwire), which we emailed the hotel but did not get back any type of help from their end. We had to take matters into our hands, and book a third room. Overall, it's a really nice hotel, good location, but doesn't measure up service-wise to its four star rating. I guess for the price paid (whether through Hotwire or not) I expected less of the hassles that we had to deal with. I'm sorry Intercontinental... looks like my family will be going somewhere else next time. I'm really going to miss that gym.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed at this hotel for business - pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: KJDAustralia
Reviews.Content: Pretty good hotel, comfortable beds, good location. Housekeeping wasn't all that great at replacing items. Staff were friendly. On a conference rate it was pretty good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “A bathroom beyond compare”
Reviews.Author: Xabbo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as a family at the end of August. The check in was smooth as was the valet parking. The room was immaculate. The bathroom was outstanding, with a separate shower and bath. My husband tried the sushi spot and enjoyed it. There is a deli right near the hotel which serves an excellent breakfast. The location was great and we walked to all the attractions we were interested in. The only complaint was that the pool (in a stunningly beautiful gym area) was slightly chilly. We got an excellent rate through an Expedia mystery hotel offer.

Reviews.Title: “A very good experience”
Reviews.Author: nina827
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel as part of a large wedding party. Check in and check out very smooth Great location and service, courteous staff..Rooms and suites are well appointed and clean. Mine had a good view of the wharf. Getting to the rooms through confusing corridors can be a bit of a challenge. I was lost a couple of times. Food at the Provencale restaurant well worth a try and the bar is lively as well. The wedding function itself was well organised. Facilities for conventions and other social finctions are good. Overall a very good experience

Reviews.Title: “Excellent but business Market targeted”
Reviews.Author: AZandDZ
Reviews.Content: Aimed at business customers on expenses. But does this v well. Good food and service, nice ambiance, excellent functions facilities, great location

Reviews.Title: “The people make the difference, great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: JettSett28
Reviews.Content: I can not recommend the InterContinental Boston enough. As a solo female traveler, I always err on the safe side and asked questions to the conceirge, bell men, valet, etc. I felt they were on the look out for me and gave great recommendations on sights to see based on my limited time, as this was a work trip. The staff made the difference during my stay, very attentive and you don't find that often. The accomodations were fabulous too. I stayed in a Club Room: large room, clean and modern, comfortable workspace (I had a view of Boston Harbor), luxe bathrooms and I loved the pillows too. Room Service TIp: The best Clam Chowder in Boston, better than Legal Seafood's. Wish they would ship it upon request. The Club Lounge was so convenient for meetings and offered great breakfast and evening snacks. If you travel on business its a good investment. I had the opportunity grab a cocktail at their bar, Rumba, a great idea to do so before heading out on the town. The hotel is convenient to the airport and the new up and coming waterfront area of Boston, hip new restaurants and museums are nearby. I also got a kick out of the fact the hotel sits on the site where the Boston Tea Party was held. Its nice to stay in a place that has a connection/significance to history.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay but not great”
Reviews.Author: lillah19
Reviews.Content: This is overall a good hotel in a convenient waterfront location on the same side of Atlantic Avenue as the Boston Harbor Hotel and Marriott Long Wharf. It is close to Quincy Market /Faneuil Hall and transportation. I stayed on points so I really can't complain about the price but I know I would not be happy paying 500+ per night to stay here. I have stayed in many "high-end" hotels and been happy to pay top dollar but this isn't one. This hotel seems bland to me. The decor is modern but doesn't stand out. The staff is efficient but not particularly welcoming. I was really disappointed by the beds; they are not the most comfortable and I awoke with a backache. The sheets are another story, very soft and silky. The good news in the double room is there is no window like in the king room to the bathroom. The bathroom is definitely the best part of the room with plenty of space, good lighting, including a makeup mirror a seperate shower with good water pressure. Overall, not a terrible experience but not one I will chalk up as memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Like eating a Subway sandwich for 500.00”
Reviews.Author: educatemassachusetts
Reviews.Content: Had to haggle for a room under 700.00. No shampoo no hairdryer. I called multiple times for a toothbrush and finally got a "free" one after contacting the manager. Sterile and cold but clean.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly good base for exploring the city”
Reviews.Author: TrufflesSmith
Reviews.Content: We booked the Intercontinental as a "safe option" for the beginning of our trip and were not disappointed - it met our expectations fully and we had a very enjoyable 4 night stay. The room was a decent size with a nice big bed, the bathroom was spacious, the staff were friendly, the gym was decent, and the bar area had a good atmosphere when we went for a nightcap! We felt it was in a good location - not too far from everything but without the premium rate for being right in the centre. It's handy to South Station and there are several dining options within a 10 minute walk. Slight gripes would be: the ridiculous price of wifi and the ridiculous price for using the "business centre" to print out a confirmation, the coffee from the in-room coffee maker was horrible, the TV switched itself on at 6am and nobody knew how to make it stop (!), the sushi at 'Sushi Teq' was not very good value, and the spa was a little arbitrary. Other than these small things, it was a perfectly good base for recovering from jetlag and exploring the city.

Reviews.Title: “well placed and very comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Scottishvoyager
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel with Expedia on one of their "Secret hotels" bookings, so, for a very reasonable price, we were delighted when our hotel proved to be the Intercontinental near the Waterfront. It is well placed for downtown, the Faneiul Hall etc. Rooms are generously sized, with all amenities. Do, however, be aware of an enormously high charge for car parking and internet access. The bar/restaurant in the hotel was extremely noisy, so we opted not to eat there, therefore can't comment on food. One of the most comfortable beds we have slept in!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with Large Rooms”
Reviews.Author: JasonWright_10
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel. I've stayed in several Boston hotels over the last few years and I would rank this one at or near the top. Everything was clean and the staff was friendly. The room was larger than most hotels in Boston except for maybe the rooms at the Custom House which are all suites. The location is about a mile walk to Hanover Street which is nice if you want to burn off some pasta calories. While I didn't spend much time in the hotel other than to sleep, it seemed to have an energetic feel to it on the first floor near the restaurant. I had the impression that it is a place where business professionals may go to close out the day. The location is also convenient to Boston Logan. I would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at a great location”
Reviews.Author: Feneant
Reviews.Content: We booked a hotel for our trip via Hotwire and it ended up being the InterContinental. The price was really not all that much more than an older 3 star hotel and we didn't regret it one bit. The location is fantastic and a short walk from the waterfront and other attractions, not to mention the trolleys all have stops and ticket booths within a 5-10 minutes walk. The Quincy market and a large number of restaurants are all a short walk away so you have the option to eat whatever you want really. We had no issue checking in and the concierge was friendly and knowledgeable. The rooms are well maintained and quite large. The only downside is that ridiculous sliding door (for lack of a better word) between the bathroom right over the bed. Even closed there is no privacy if someone is using the bathroom and we both felt it was unneeded and served no real purpose- that is why I gave the room a 4 out of 5.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but a bit of a maze”
Reviews.Author: aaronwileman
Reviews.Content: Great service in the hotel and it is nice to end up in a room for a change that is not in the standard motel format. Very clean and great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: bayfront
Reviews.Content: The rooms are spacious and well appointed. The location was convenient to the airport as you can take City Water Taxi across Boston Harbor from the airport dock to the rear entrance of the hotel and avoid a taxi ride through Boston traffic. The hotel bar Rumba offers a good selection of rum cocktails and the concierge staff made some great restaurant recommendations. I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Stay”
Reviews.Author: dcdad068
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed our recent weekend here in pretty much every way. Virtually everyone we encountered was pleasant and polite. The property is impressive, immaculate, and conveniently located. Our kids enjoyed the pool, the "Greenway" parks in front of the hotel, and our suite with club-level access. The club was one of the nicer hotel clubs I've been in, with surprisingly nice wines and snacks in the evening and good breakfast offerings as well. We have stayed in many Intercontinental Hotels in recent years both in the U.S. and abroad, but this may be my new favorite.

Reviews.Title: “Very Convenient Downtown Location”
Reviews.Author: James M
Reviews.Content: I was very satisfied by my recent stay at the Intercontinental Hotel. The location is very convenient, near Boston's South Station on the Greenway. The hotel is also very clean and the staff was very friend and helpful. In particular, I found the concierge staff to be extremely helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfactory stay overall”
Reviews.Author: scyw
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located by a short walk from Boston's South Station, InterContinental Boston is what you'd expect from any InterContinental - comfortable rooms with good service. Since we booked the room under a corporate rate, it was of good value and would probably go back again only if booking under the same rate.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel with all of the bells and whistles”
Reviews.Author: mlsimp2
Reviews.Content: This was my second time to stay here and I was again impressed. The rooms have the nicest bathrooms of any non-suite I've ever stayed in. You may read the reviews from people who don't like the unique bathroom window situation (the doors close for privacy), but I really like the open feeling it creates since I was staying by myself.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BeachP
Reviews.Content: My husband and stayed here on a Saturday in September and it was lovely.... close to the North End and Qunicy Market, etc., but not the most ideal location for a Fenway trip! We were in a Deluxe King, which was on the small side, but very well appointed and very clean. The bathroom is beautiful... large tub, separate shower, open shutter concept and beautiful vanity. The bed was not very comfortable though. The hotel itself is very lovely as well... clean, modern, elegant. The gym and fitness center was great..beautiful views! The only thing that was not ideal was the valet parking can only take your car not bring it back because it's a one way street, but that's not the hotel's fault. Oveall, a nice place to stay in Boston!

Reviews.Title: “InterContinental Boston Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: Wolfie17
Reviews.Content: This has to be one of the best hotels. From the check in with Maya, Concierge Marc, and the best bartender ever at Rumba. It may be pricey but worth every penny. Check out Miel as we had a wonderful meal there also.

Reviews.Title: “Great property, location, and superlative fitness center”
Reviews.Author: Teresita_Herndon_VA
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel to be excellent in almost all regards - comfort, location, cleanliness, and friendliness. When I realized I had forgotten the charging cord for my Blackberry, the concierge charged it for me. The fitness center was particularly outstanding for a hotel facility. Only complaint - when I went to breakfast in the hotel restaurant, the staff didn't seem to offer the same level of service to me as a single female diner as the groups of businessmen around me seemed to be getting, and my breakfast was somewhat iffy in quality - eggs were hot, but toast, potatoes, and meat were cold. Waiter was indifferent - a disapointment.

Reviews.Title: “great”
Reviews.Author: russavi
Reviews.Content: great location, spacious room, great gym, extremely friendly staff, top notch concierge staff who did more than necessary to assist us in putting our stay in Boston together. I only have good things to say about the hotel and staff

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Traveling_RN_AR
Reviews.Content: This hotel has all the nice things that I have come to expect from Intercontinental. You have to check out the fitness center and spa if you are there for an extended stay. The hotel is perfectly located on the waterfront and has a number of great restaurants nearby and within walking distance. I always feel pampered here.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: dhmills
Reviews.Content: The hotel is gorgeous and the beds/showers/bathrooms/everything is awesome. Very beautifully done. However, they're starting to nickel and dime. They used to have free wireless in the lobby and a free computer you could use, now the wireless is $15 a day and the lobby computers are $6 a day, things like that. Would still recommend though.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sjriley95
Reviews.Content: All I can say is, wow! This hotel is incredible. From the moment we walked into the beautiful lobby to check in, from sleeping in our very modern room to walking around downtown Boston, we loved this stay. It helped that we stayed on the government rate, $171 a night, instead of paying their regular internet rate of $450 (ouch!). Parking is via valet and not all that convenient but they make the most of it - what do you expect, it's downtown Boston? Rooms and common areas are amazing though and I would go back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room, I would stay again on my next trip!”
Reviews.Author: ultimatemom76
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a beautiful place with water views of the river. Staff was attentive and efficient. Room was wonderful and a treat for my college daughter who spent one night there. Took advantage the tub for a soak. The only problem we had was the outlets in the bathroom did not work so hopefully housekeeping has reported it to maintenance. Would stay again next time I'm in Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable”
Reviews.Author: Shianneh
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a pleasure to stay at. There was help offered at every turn. The rooms were also very comfortable. We had a great view from our room with huge windows. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable city hotel”
Reviews.Author: Geoff W
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights before flying back to the UK. Location good - not far to walk to most places in Boston, though there is very little around the hotel itself (no restaurants/bars in immediate vicinity). Convenient for South Station too. Room was good value - nice size, good bathroom with shower and bath. Fridge in the room was small and no space to put anything of our own. We stayed on the 12th floor and used the Club - great value, excellent service from the staff there who could not be more helpful. Used the club for breakfatst which was more than adequate for us, and also had a glass of wine before going out for dinner. Overall, room was as you would expect for a 4* business style hotel. Miel - the "Provencal" brasserie downstairs - had some good review but we were very disappointed. My gazpacho soup seemed to have come straight from a tin with a bit of honey mixed in - not a provencal dish really - and the rest of the meal continued in a similar vein. The duck was too sweet and served with a bunch of rocket on the side - it didn't mix. My wife's crab cakes were unpleasant. Swimming pool a welcome facility - though can be a bit crowded in the mornings.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Value, good location if you know what you are doing”
Reviews.Author: ronneedham
Reviews.Content: So I generally stay at The Lenox when I go to Boston (and I highly recommend it). It was my 50th and I'm "ambassador" level for InterC so my wife booked a bunch of rooms to celebrate and called the GM regarding upgrades, and so on. First, I've read a few reviews that suggest it isn't a good location. Baloney. I grew up in Boston and this is right near everything if you know what to do - Fanueil Hall, North End, Waterfront, Children's Museum all within walking distance or very short cab ride. So you have that. The lobby is stunning, the RumBar is very nice. Fitness Center was outstanding. Employees were great and helpful> I did hear somebody call the front desk to complain while I was there and they were quick to put the bellman on the phone with appropriate apologies for whatever was going on - well handled. They treated us like gold, fantastic upgrade (yes, we checked in early and not all four rooms were available - but 3 were so we dropped bags and went out to enjoy. Room service was spot on - fresh and fast. Mom and youngest son went swimming on Sunday morning while I worked out and they had a great time. Got a late checkout without a hassle. Again, Lenox is in my heart but no complaints about this place - first class and a great value for what we paid (400 prepay for a suite)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: Brian M
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Intercontinental on the Labour Day weekend. The hotel is in an excellent downtown location close to the T and within a short walk of lots of excellent restaurants and pubs. The room we had was very modern and well apointed. Staff were very nice and exceptionally helpful. The concierge recommendation for lunch was spot-on! Would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: M B
Reviews.Content: The hotel facilities were upscale and contemporary. Hotel is in a great location in financial district, 10 min walk to Quincy Market. We had a late flight out on Monday evening and hotel staff extended our checkout to 2pm and held our bags until later that evening.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TingTing98
Reviews.Content: We loved the hotel. It was beautifully decorated, well maintained and ideally situated. The bathrooms are huge and contain a garden tub and a separate shower. The mattresses may be a bit firm and the pillows less than desirable as other reviewers have suggested; however, the positives greatly overcome these minor inconveniences. If we are ever in Boston again, we definitely will stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite hotel in Boston”
Reviews.Author: gacman17
Reviews.Content: Love this hotel, wish I could stay here more often. I want to take the pillows home. Always clean and comfortable. Very convenient to Amtrak, waterfront, Faneuil Hall, etc. Walking distance to ICA, North End and more. Highly recommend for a night in town, a weekend getaway or a week on business. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Thought it was nice.”
Reviews.Author: caribdreamerNh
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Priceline a month and a half ahead of time and got an incredible rate. (Almost half price when compared to the same dates on InterContinental website.) Because of that, I feel like I have no right to complain about anything at the InterContinental. It is a four star in Boston, after all. If you paid full price, then I can see how the weird window between the bedroom and bathroom, and the small room size might bother you a bit. The beds are rock hard but after telling management how horribly we slept, housekeeping put a nice cushy feather bed on the mattress for us. If you have a complaint, speak directly to a Manager. It will most likely get resolved. Also, the rooms and hotel in general are very, very clean. All of the hotel facilities and services are good. We had a massage at the Spa and it was also top notch. Very serene and relaxing. I have read many complaints that the front desk is rude and doesn't care about you, but we certainly didn't experience any of that. They treated us wonderfully. We'd stay here again, but not at full price.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay here during Irene”
Reviews.Author: Matty17r
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during tropical storm Irene and were able to make the most of the facilities that were available. The gym was fantastic and so was the pool. This is a new hotel and the room was very comfortable. The hotel is in a good location close to the waterfront and only a 10 minute walk to Quincy Market and the Aquarium. The staff were very helpful and informative and went out of the way to help us.

Reviews.Title: “New hotel, horrible sleeping experience, management didn't care.”
Reviews.Author: Lisac1523
Reviews.Content: The hotel was gorgeous and seemed fairly new. The room was visually extremely appealing. The bathroom has huge and had both a standup shower and HUGE tub. I was surprised they also offered in-room wireless for a fee rather than hardwired high speed internet. Now for the really really bad part. As my fiancÃ© and myself went to sleep we realized the bed was like sleeping on concrete. Also the pillows were undersized and flat, with little to no support or comfort. I notified hotel management and asked them is this was a common occurrence and if something could be done. All I was able to get from them was "I'm sorry." Well, I filled out the in room survey, the hot-wire.com survey and no a trip advisor survey letting everyone know your hotel is uncomfortable and all you could say was "I'm sorry." IC Boston, I'm not sorry I hope I change future customers minds from staying with you. By the way for those of you who think I am harsh on them, read more surveys this complaint seems to be repetitive about them.

Reviews.Title: “They could be trying a lot harder--many better options in Boston--not staying there again”
Reviews.Author: thaifoodfan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here three years in a row for our anniversary, got an excellent rate on Hotwire. The first year was fine. The second year there was an electrical fire in the middle of the night (on the second night of a weekend stay). A 2 a.m. evacuation led to me sleeping on the Rose Kennedy Greenway until we were moved to the Boston Harbor Hotel to sit in the ballroom there. Lots of tired and crabby people. I don't fault the InterContinental for a fire, and it was certainly safer to evacuate. The problem is how they treated the guests after this. The InterContinental originally refused to refund our 2nd night, let alone offer complimentary parking or a brunch (which would have been a gracious thing that would cost them nothing). Finally, after many persistent phone calls, we got a letter from the general manager offering us a free weekend stay in 2011. This is the last year we celebrate an anniversary there. The level of service is not what one would expect from a hotel in this class--there are several other luxury or high-end hotels in Boston and we'll try a different one next year. I imagine we will be at the Liberty, the Millennium or the Four Seasons. We won't be back to the InterContinental.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury with a water view (maybe)”
Reviews.Author: History_Jen
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night on the 7th floor facing the river, in a king size bedroom. Full bathtub, separate shower, glamour bathroom. One caveat: sliding window/pass through from headboard to bathroom. If you aren't close to your roommate you will be afterwards. No problem as we live together already, but you might need to raise the volume on your i-pod (for which ther was a cradle on the alarm clock). Interior lighting in the room is customizable and very swank. The Rumba (rum and champagne) Bar downstairs is attempting to be urban hipster friendly, but is really a hotel bar with awesome couches and descent if not speedy service. Can't speak to the restaurant because we didn't dine there, but outside seating looks nice and overlooks the river. Concierge was super useful and nice. Aside from the not unusual closing of the heavy room doors, it was a very quiet hotel. We were there on a Sunday night and it was very peaceful. Did not have time to try the pool at the spa but it looks nice.

Reviews.Title: “Posh hotel with Great Views!”
Reviews.Author: gottago33
Reviews.Content: This hotel had all the bells and whistles one could hope for in a big city! Every attention to detail is noticed as you walk thru this modern and clean property. The Jr. Suite we had was nice and large, and the soaking tub in the bathroom was very zen and comfortable. The staff was friendly and helpful at every opportunity they had to address you. The spa/fitness center is quite large and we never had to wait for anything. The location is right in the heart of downtown on the water front which = amazing views!

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient hotel”
Reviews.Author: sheetah
Reviews.Content: We stayed in that hotel for 4nights. We had 2 double rooms. the rooms were nicely decorated and the bathroom was one of the nicest I have seen in a long time. It was big and bright and featured both a tub and a shower. The staff was nice and helpful, even with my loud tribe. The hotel is very conveniently located, within walking distance of the aquarium, the faneuil market, the italiant neighbourghood, chinatown, downtown, etc. We actually didn't feel the need to use our car as we walked everywhere, or took the subway. We were vry happy woth our choice of hotel, and will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fou4u2
Reviews.Content: Stay here last week for business and the location was great five minutes from everything. My room was gorgeous and faced Atlantic Ave. Valet parking was nice but a bit expensive. I would have not parked at this property at $40 a night if it were not being picked up by my company. There is a lot just a short walk over the bridge that charge 1/2 that price. Seven eleven a short walk going towards North End not far from Dunkin Donuts. Pick up what you need there. Nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: WarwickTraveler29
Reviews.Content: Highly recommended. My wife, two boys and I stayed at the Intercontinental Boston just for a night. We have no complaints. The staff was accommodating and friendly. All special requests were received professionally and provided for us. The room was large and comfortable. There was a wall between the bath and the bedroom. The two beds were comfortable. The TV was great. Valet parking fees were understandable for Boston, but the Internet fee was high and should probably be less. We had a great 10th floor view of the city. I liked this place and I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, not outstanding”
Reviews.Author: pubprof
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to the Intercontinental just for a quick getaway. The hotel is in a great location for Waterfront, North End, Fanueil Hall and Quincy Market activities. Valet service was a little disorganized on check-in but no big deal. We arrived at 2:30 for a 3pm check-in and were told that our room wasn't ready. They took our bags and we went off for a walk. Didn't get a call until 4pm that the room was ready but we were exploring the Greenway so, again, no big deal. The room was very nice and very spacious. The bed was comfortable with nice linens and the bathroom was large with separate shower and tub. The workout facility is quite nice. The city view is fine (I booked through Expedia for a great rate and knew that I would not be getting a water view.) One weird thing about the room is that there are two opaque sliding windows that open from the tub into the sleeping area above the headboard. They did not close tightly and really did not provide any privacy from the bathroom. You could not see into the bathroom was there was no sense that you were isolated from others in the main room. Very odd. A few complaints: 1. I requested a late checkout for Sunday (1pm instead of noon). I was told that it would cost an additional $50! Complete BS! I've never been charged for a late checkout. For this reason alone I'll try another hotel next time. 2. The in-room checkout was not functioning. Annoying. 3. Valet for checkout was very disorganized. I called the number the valet gave me at check-in. It didn't work. I looked in the guest guide and it said to call the front desk. They gave me another number to call. I called that number and got voicemail. What the hell? This isn't that complicated. I brought our bags down to checkout and they told me I had to go down one floor to the garage and hand the valet my ticket. I did this and 10 minutes later I got my car. Just ridiculous.... Overall, it's a nice hotel but I don't think I'll return. There's no compelling reason to do so with all the other fine hotels in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Service”
Reviews.Author: birdman_luke
Reviews.Content: As others have pointed out, the Intercontinental Boston has terrible service. For such a nice property and global brand reputation, I expected MUCH better customer service. I'll try to explain what I think is going on after second trip. My comments are based on two trips. One in August 28, 2010 and most recently on August 12, 2011. This was a family trip. We booked two rooms. The second for my mother in-law. Our August 28, 2010 trip was cut short due to a hotel fire. Back then, the hotel did a terrible job handling the fire. My comparison / comments are based on other hotel brands I've stayed at over the years including the Ritz Carlton, Four Seasons, Fairmont, Omni, Marriott, and Hyatt. This Intercontinental Boston is a relatively new hotel. The rooms are spacious and beautiful. The hotel is about a 15-20 minute walk to Faneuil Hall marketplace and about 23-30 minute walk to the North End. This trip (Aug. 2011), we managed to check in early. I noticed the hotel did not seem busy. As with most properties, this hotel has both residential and commercial tenants. This is where I believe the problems stem with customer service. Clearly the hotel guests seemed to be second class priority. The desk clerks seemed to be very confused and unclear about hotel policies. For instance when my wife tried to take our 14 year old son to the gym, she was told by the gym supervisor than anyone under 18 was not allowed to use any of the equipment (cycles, treadmill, etc.). However,the front desk clerk said that minors (kids) could use the facility as long as they were supervised by an adult. The second day, the front desk clerk told us that under no circumstances kids under 18 could use the gym facility. When I asked them directly if this is a private gym for the resident tenants, they denied it. We paid extra to stay at the club level. But, they have VERY set times when they open up and when the food + drinks are out. They open up much later on the weekends. So, if you like to start your day early on the weekends (before 7:30 am) skip the club level amenities. In fact they were 30 minutes late opening up for us during our stay; they did not open up till 8:00 pm. They don't setup in the evening until 5:30 pm. So, even though we paid $100 extra per night, we hardly used the club level. In fact we were the only ones at the club. During this trip, a member of our party had a terrible accident walking back from the North End and we desperately needed a first aid kit at 9 pm in the evening. We could not find any open CVS of pharmacy within the 1 mile radius. None the convenient stores has even a Band-Aid. Finally we approached the hotel for assistance. It took us several attempts to get the point across to them that we needed a first aid kit. Reluctantly and 20 minutes later someone showed up with some supplies. For a property this big, I expect the staff to be more responsive to guests that may be in need of medical attention. I guess they have not learned from the August 2010 fire. Do not expect this hotel to handle any medical or other emergency. Parking sucks. Although this hotel provides parking, the rates clearly want you to park your car someplace else. The rate is $40 / night irrespective of weekends. You can find most public parking will charge between $7 - $15 for weekends. I think anything less than 7 hours is around $30 and anything over is still $40. Cleary this parking lot is for residential clients. The bottom line, this hotel property is NOT FAMILY or customer oriented. This property caters to residential guests (these are multimillion dollar condos where everyone drives around a Bentley or Ferrari). You can see the fleet of cars at the parking level.
