Don't expect this hotel to be consistent on policies. There's a lot of flip flopping on what the policies are. Club level food is OK, but the hours are very limited and inconvenient. Don't expect any help if you need any medical attention or supplies. I don't expect the hotel to have any best practices in case of a fire or emergency. And don't expect to see a manager or supervisor on weekends. In fact we never engaged by anyone above a front desk assistance. The Boston Intercontinental sets a very poor example for what customer service should not be. If you're travelling with family, kids, and for the summer, I would recommend staying at one of the more family friendly hotels that has it act together. I can tell you my wife will never stay at any Intercontinental brand every again.

Reviews.Title: “Good, not great hotel with nice location”
Reviews.Author: Anomina
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a large and busy one that feels like more of a convention hotel than one truly focused on excellence. The room was good -- clean and large enough -- although the water view was a bit uninspiring. Service was ok but had that feeling of a hotel that is a bit overextended or understaffed. Long waits at the bar for a cocktail (and not because it was that busy) and long waits at the front desk. The concierge was pleasant and helpful. Overall, this is a good property but nothing really stands out about it other than a convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but the service could use some work”
Reviews.Author: snickm
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife, mother-in-law and 16-month old son in August. The lobby is very nice and the hotel sits on the river across from the Children's Museum and also has a nice little park across the street. The rooms were nice and the bathroom was exceptional. The hotel is about 2 blocks away from the South St Station (subway) and maybe 3 or 4 blocks from the Long Wharf and NE Aquarium, so it's not bad. The service is another story, though. Upon arrival (at 4:30 in the afternoon), we were told the room wasn't ready. We were told to wait in the lobby and they would call when the room was ready. That never happened. When I went back to the front desk, I was finally given a room, but no apology. The room was on the opposite side of the hotel that I asked for and did not have the pack-and-play that I requested for my son. I was able book this hotel through Travelocity's Top Secret Hotels for $165/night for 2 nights on a weekend. All in all, the hotel may look 4 star, but don't expect 4 star service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice inside, somewhat remote”
Reviews.Author: AHCMD
Reviews.Content: As I didn't have a choice of hotel (my trip was planned and funded by someone else), I cannot speak to prices. The hotel seemed to be off the beaten path, and my taxi driver actually took me to the wrong hotel first. Once inside, the place was excellent. Good wine selection in the room fridge.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location for sightseeing...neighborhood is a ghost town on weekends.”
Reviews.Author: Hadrian6
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights to do some quick Boston touristy stuff in early August. We found the room large, well designed, and spotless. The bathroom was truly enormous (largest tub I have ever seen in a hotel). The fitness area was also large, clean, and adequately cooled for a good work out. The pool also was very nice. Expensive internet access in the room was kind of a downer, but I understand that most of the clients are business people who can simply add this charge to an expense account. The service was prompt, efficient, and courteous. When we accidentally knocked one of the beer cans off of its electronic sensor in the automated mini bar, thus incurring a charge to our room, the front desk staff corrected the charge immediately and without fuss. The area is very convenient for access to harbor front sightseeing opportunities ( a short walk) and is also a pleasant walk (on a cool evening) to the North End and Chinatown. The one warning I have is that by being located in the financial district, absolutely everything in the immediate vicinity (coffee shops, bagel shops, donut shops, etc.) is closed on Saturday and Sunday mornings, making a cheap and quick breakfast nearly impossible. I should note too that we did purchase our room through a discount online broker at a rate well below those advertised by the hotel. Nice as this hotel is, it is highly unlikely we would have stayed here otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect balance: modern comfort, quality service and friendly atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: AnotherEnglishman
Reviews.Content: A little luxury for our last weekend in Boston before moving home to England. Spacious modern room, though in retrospect a city view is probably better than the port side view we asked for. We paid out extra for club room access and that was a bargain - excellent breakfast, and wine and nibbles in the evening. Plus it was a nice place to sit and read a book on a wet afternoon. The staff are really excellent - attentive without being intrusive, polite without being obsequiesce; a really nice balance has been struck at this hotel. It's not cheap - we got a good deal for a 3 day break averaging around $300 a night (but the actual cost of Monday was over $500, which is normal for the hotel. I recently stayed in the Omni Parker House, which was a completely different experience - it's really hard to say which I prefer. Try both.

Reviews.Title: “Great location on the waterfront”
Reviews.Author: pmoor
Reviews.Content: Lovely contemporary spacious room with a great bathroom. I liked having a separate shower from the soak tub and the colors are very relaxing. Looking out my window, I had a great view of the park and all the city lights. We arrived on a hot steamy summer day and the ac in our room was not working properly. The room felt a bit sticky. Otherwise this hotel is great and being on the waterfront in Boston is lots of fun. Close to many good restaurants, but the Intercontinental has a fabulous sushi bar.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Average Service”
Reviews.Author: cau3
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a beautiful lobby, and restaurants. The rooms are very nicely appointed, yet small (felt like a NYC hotel). That said, the service was C- at best. I think they simply don't have enough staff. There were 20+ people in line to check in; no one at the front of the hotel when we arrived by car and once we finally got to the check in desk, learned that no rooms were available right now. (this was 4:00 PM - all rooms should be ready to go by this time). We waited for an hour and a half and no call, so I went to the desk and had a fit and did get a room. No apologies, just a room. Meanwhile, it was an anniversary trip, and not a singe person acknowledge this although I mentioned it when booking. If we were at the Ritz or Four Seasons, every person in the place would have acknowledge our anniversary. We went outside to the channel-front bar and it is quite nice, but the service was no better. No waitress - finally went to the bar for drinks. I think they need (a) more staff, and (b) send them to some customer service training (see Ritz training). All in all a decent stay, but we will not be back.

Reviews.Title: “Bostin' Boston!”
Reviews.Author: LittleRich
Reviews.Content: A fantastic hotel that places itself in a perfect position as a holiday-maker base for discovering the city. You do pay a fair bit for this hotel (although our stay was on Priority Points, which probably made everything feel that little bit better).....but you do get a lot in return. The rooms are spacious (especially when you swing an upgrade!), the quality is high, the in-house bar was brilliant..........couldn't fault it. Another review mentioned the gap under the sliding panel between room and bathroom.....have to agree, it is a little weird at first, but soon forget about it. The shower was large and powerful...brilliant. Hotel does have an upmarket feel to it, but the staff are still really pleasant. Also had a very good gym with a large selection of both CV and weights machines, then also free-weights and space for floor work. Good sized pool also. Boston in general was a great city - the freedom trail serves as a great way to spend a few hours walking around seeing the sites....no better way of seeing the city than by foot. Has large selection of good restaurants and bars.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff and Service!”
Reviews.Author: jwlawedding
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Intercontinental while attending a wedding in the area. The staff was extremely helpful in providing maps, arranging transportation, and assisting us with places to visit and eat locally. In addition, they assisted us with checking in online for our returning flight and printing boarding passes. The hotel has a beautiful patio and bar area along the water. In addition, the bars and restaurants inside the hotel were always busy and hoping with people. The rooms were promptly cleaned and hotel staff promptly assisted us when we needed additional towels, coffee, etc. We would HIGHLY recommend this hotel. In fact, my husband is returning in a few weeks for a boys weekend with his friends.

Reviews.Title: “Intercontinental awesome”
Reviews.Author: murdog
Reviews.Content: My 16 year old son and I stayed here for 3 nights to go to a baseball game and sightsee Boston. We loved the hotel!! It was in a good location to all of the tourist sites. Within walking distance to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Good service, Nice view.”
Reviews.Author: colombian
Reviews.Content: This is a standard InterContinental hotel. It has all the amenities you need and more. Its elegant and the decorations is awesome. I particularly liked the Sushi Tequila place as the food fusion made a lot of sense believe it or not. The room was clean a comfortable, with a Jacuzzi in the bathroom and a window right on it. I normally don't pay this much on my personal trips and I think there are options that will give you more of Boston at a lower price.

Reviews.Title: “Well be back outstanding hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jinx223
Reviews.Content: Are stay at the intercontinental Boston was outstanding there rooms were clean and nice. There club rooms are the best bet if you stay here so that you get to go to there club lounge and you get full breakfast,snacks, and nighttime drinks and dinner and for the drinks if you don't that they have what you want on the table ask them because they have everything and you can have as much as you want and you don't have to pay for them it's awesome and if you are going somewhere ask Justin the concierge he is the best concierge I think I have had at any hotel I've stayed at. He will tell you anything what the best places to go to and everything.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Rooms, Nice Location, Poor Beds & Pillows”
Reviews.Author: Tango313
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spend a night at the hotel with the plans of eating at a few nice restaurants and simply hanging out in Boston. The hotel is in a good location with the North End very easy to walk to. The hotel is nice and comes with a few restaurants with good ratings. We ate at Miel and had a great lunch. The menu is a big pricey, but if you leave off drinks, it is right on par with other hotel restaurants, but much better quality food. The lobby and rooms are very nice. You can tell a lot of planning went into making nice living spaces. The one complaint is the bed and pillows. The one thing you want at a hotel is a good night sleep, for that is really what it is for. So, it is quite disappointing when you go to lay down in this plush hotel to find yourself in a hard bed and very poor pillows. This is one of those bed and pillow combinations that create neck pains and headaches. Both my wife and I experienced the same so I think our viewpoint should be somewhat valid. For the amount of money it costs to stay here I don't know if I would return. I stay at many Holiday Inn owned hotels and I must say that the new Holiday Inn's and Express hotels, as well as Crowne Plaza hotels, far exceed the comfort of this Intercontinental.

Reviews.Title: “Best meals at a week long conference ever.”
Reviews.Author: rlasarte
Reviews.Content: Staff is amazing. All of the amenities great. I was here for a week long conference and my experience at this hotel was so good I can't wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for Business Travelers”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveler11595
Reviews.Content: Always stay here when I go to Boston for business. Great rooms, service, bars, and the gym. No complaints at all!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Helpful staff, Great/Clean Rooms!”
Reviews.Author: karabear0414
Reviews.Content: We stayed the weekend in Boston and LOVED this hotel. The rooms were modern, spacious, and very clean. It was a short walk to quincy market and lots of other things. The staff was SO friendly and helpful. They have a great bar and also a tequilla bar that was great. Over all this will be our pick for a hotel next time in Boston. It was over all amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel i love it and will go again”
Reviews.Author: LCDDubai
Reviews.Content: Very good treatment you will love it to go again and again. Try to book hotel thru their network hotels or travel agents. sometime you may get offer and discounted rates. Overall very good night life Disco bars, massage centers etc. Good bar facility depends upon your money. You may meet very good business executies, company Ceo`s etc.

Reviews.Title: “This is the place to stay”
Reviews.Author: n2travelNewYork
Reviews.Content: This was a long weekend getaway for myself, my husband and our two teenage grandchildren. Both children had been to Boston on school trips and felt they didn't have enough time to really appreciate the city, so we decided to take them back to see the things they had missed. My grandson who is 13, loved our hotel room. he even took pictures of it, telling us that when he was an adult this is how he wanted to decorate his apartment in NYC. The staff was so friendly and helpful. The room was great. The location was perfect. It was close to the RR STA, T and easy to walk to all sights. If you want a great place to stay, this is it.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty sure I was lied to”
Reviews.Author: LauraR2
Reviews.Content: I'll admit up front I made a mistake in booking and showed up a night early for our one night stay. The front desk refused me a room after going back and forth with the reservation manager 3 times and said they couldn't accomodate me. Hardly any cars in the garage and the lobby was quiet as church. I am certain that if I hadn't booked through priceline and was paying full price, I would have received a room in a minute. He wasn't even able to look me in the eye. Learned my lesson about being more careful with reservations but would definitely never go back here again.

Reviews.Title: “Georgous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: petiteg
Reviews.Content: This is a new, modern hotel in the finiancial district of dowtown Boston, within a close walk to Quincy Market. It's clean, bright and beautiful. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. Our only disappointment was that there was not free internet access and parking was $40/day. We booked on Priceline and saved a lot on cost of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Hotel”
Reviews.Author: traveldel
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located by the waterfront, a block away from the South Station Commuter Rail. It was super easy for us to get from Boston to Harvard Square Cambridge using the red line. It was not as central to sites in Boston as I would like but still walkable - a little over a mile for both Faneuil Hall & Newbury Street. The room was beautiful, nicely decorated with lots of room, floor to ceiling windows with great views. The only weird thing was that there was a big window above the headboard that opened to the bathroom. Even with the sliding window closed, there was still a one inch gap at the bottom - so that you can see into the bathroom and can hear everything going on. I was with my husband, so it didn't bother me but if I was staying there with a friend, I guess I would be self conscious using the bathroom ;) Note: Internet is not free. Parking is 40$/night

Reviews.Title: “Great location for two night stay, close walk to everything!”
Reviews.Author: keswickdoodle
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, walking distance to Ouincy Market, Freedom Trail, Harbour, and North End. The rooms are well appointed and very clean. We travelled as a family of four with two teens. Our room had two queen beds, plenty of space and a large bathroom with a walk in shower, soaking tub and vanity mirror. We booked on Hotwire and stayed for a very good rate. We ate breakfast at Panera bread. When you exit the building go left a couple of blocks. We enjoyed parking the car down stairs and walking to everything for the three days of our stay. The pool is located on the second floor, at the spa and gym area. We found it not to be too kid friendly. It's more of a lap pool than a kids on vacation pool. If you have not stayed at a four and a half star before, check this out. It was a highlight of our vacation! Be sure to do the Boston Gliders Segway tour. It's a fun way to see the city!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel In A Great City”
Reviews.Author: PacificAndyLa
Reviews.Content: First Time to Boston and we had a great time Stayed at the InterConti and it was great. Nice suite with great views and located within walking distance to everything you want to see in Boston. I would pay and do the Club Level if you can, free internet and at least you get a great breakfast before you explore this great city. Eveyone was great, a few hiccups but what do you expect. Some weird rules about their outdoor patio area and a LA attitude bar tender, but all in all a great hotel. Worth going and taking the family. Also a fantastic gym

Reviews.Title: “Deeply Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: sheeline
Reviews.Content: I joined two friends who had traveled from Australia. We stayed for one night as 3 adults and had requested, via Hotwire.com, 2 double beds. That request was not honored by IHBoston. The desk stated, when we pressed for more information, that the room was confirmed but not the number of beds. They could not accommodate us, only offering the rollaway bed. They tried to charge for the rollaway bed but my friends were insistent that we not be charged. I was very upset that my friends were upset by the hotel's obvious condescension toward us regarding our Hotwire relationship. Intercontinental Hotel Boston does NOT meet the standards of a four or five star hotel. The water pressure in the sink and shower was barely minimal, the hair dryer was old, with duct tape on it. There were no flowers in the lobby, poor lighting, unhappy staff. My father was CEO of Intercontinental Hotel Corp. for twenty years, before Pan Am had to sell the profitable subsidiary. I've been lucky to stay in a number of IHC hotels over the years. Entering IH Boston felt like stepping into the dark ages. There was no life, sparkle, dignity, elegance and in fact, it felt as though there was no manager at the wheel. I was disheartened and deeply disappointed on behalf of my traveling Aussie friends. I had gone to the hotel and prepared to toast the memory of my father who passed away 8 years ago. Instead, I felt ashamed of Intercontinental Hotel Boston, on behalf of my father and all the hard work he and his staff put into making the hotel chain the best in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Clean Hotel--Near everything!”
Reviews.Author: Kabecka
Reviews.Content: We got a deal of $150 for this room through Priceline. Pretty room, more modern, with a window (closable) from the bedroom into the bathroom. The room and bathroom were spacious. We had a great view of the city, with the Boston Fire Dept. right across from us. My sister and her husband had a harbor view, but nothing spectacular to be honest. If you have a choice, choose the city view. The concierge was very helpful with dinner choices. The lobby is pretty. There is a back "Patio" where you can eat and have drinks. It was nice along the water, but the service was sooooo incredibly slow just for drinks, kind of ridiculous in fact. Still, I recommend. Comfy bed, nice big TV, very very clean. The AC wasn't as cool as I would have liked though. Exercise room is very big and nice equipment.

Reviews.Title: “Fourth of July”
Reviews.Author: mjsimone
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location. Two blocks from South Station/Amtrak and the Children's Museum. A short walk to the Aquarium and Quincy Market. Take the train to Boston. You will not need a car.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clean...ask for a room change & did not find very accomidating”
Reviews.Author: rxtraveler_branson
Reviews.Content: Ask for a city view because I can look at water at home. I was given a room with a roof view & other rooms 50 ft. in front of me... Not much of a city view. If you like keeping your window shades drawn all the time it would be great. I would recommend you get a harbor view or find another hotel. Room staff ran out of lotion for the room. Did not return with any when asked. Beds were ok but I expected more. The facility was very attractive & the outside patio was really nice & clean. Great central location to activities in the heart of Boston. Bottom line I expected more based on other reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: love2ski1974
Reviews.Content: Lovely and spacious room with a skyline view. Bathroom was exceptional! Champagne & Rum Bar lovely and service was great. Room service was delightful in the morning. I slept so well in this hotel and service was wonderful. Thank you for a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, well-maintained, mostly positive experience”
Reviews.Author: Dreverends
Reviews.Content: Stayed with a friend recently in a room with two double beds. The beds were comfortable although not the most comfortable I've had, I wonder if the king bed is more comfortable? The bathroom is a real gem -elegant and spacious. The real downsides are more indicative of Boston that the hotel itself: expensive parking ($40 for 24-hours +tip the valet), Internet is $15 so I ended up walking over to a coffee house to use the free wifi, and a bit of a cold, faceless vide to the whole place, although some people prefer that I suppose. Overall I would recommend it for the business type, or if you can find a bit of a deal on the price (which I was able to swing).

Reviews.Title: “Justin, Danielle and Yajita Are Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: einnejjja
Reviews.Content: Justin is a fantastic concierge and very friendly. Checked in on my birthday for a weekend stay Danielle (intern) very friendly and efficient during check in. Unfortunately my room was not ready so I had to return to the front desk and Yahjita apologised and gave me a new room key within five minutes of waiting. Room needed to be de-feathered and unfortunately when I took the sheets off the bed the mattress pad was full of bodily hairs from a number of previous guests. I phoned the hotel manager on Friday at 5pm and by Sunday evening he (Tim I believe) had still not bothered to return my call regarding this complaint nor did he come to the room as I had rqquested to witness all the hairs on the mattress pad.. I was very disappointed that he did not phone me back. I did show the dirty mattress pad to the housekeeping supervisor who took it away and replaced it with a brand new one which she took out of the packaging in front of me. The king room is luxurios and furnished with dark wood accents. Shower is impressive and so is the huge tub. The individual doorbells are a sweet addition. Keurig coffee machines are available and more supplies are available by making a quick phone call. Additional amenities were brought to the room within 10 mins of any call. Hotel is a five min walk from South Station its recommended to park on top of south station for something like $8 per day instead of the $40 per day that the parking company charges. Down side is that the bellman would not let my friend park long enough for him to carry my things in and swipe his credit card to my account. The bellmen need to realise that not everyone WANTS to park for the evening, some people need to just pull up long enough to pick their friend up for dinner,drop off someone or help them inside. Lighten up guys give people a 3 min stand time that would be helpful.Summer St shopping and Chinatown are all walking distance. Did not get a chance to try Rum Ba but it sounded like people were having a lot of fun. I will visit the bar and restaurant next time I stay there. Downside the mattress pad, no call back from the General Manager and no free internet.

Reviews.Title: “Not what it used to be”
Reviews.Author: JOP1_10
Reviews.Content: I visit Boston fairly regularly and have stayed at the InterCon a few times. It opened a few times and was then THE place to stay in Boston. I have noticed that quality has slipped somewhat over the past few years. Rooms are OK. I was there a week and the turn service only took place once. A colleague of mine requested a kettle and this was supplied but she wasnt given any tea bags and shown she asked for some she was told she would have to pay for them even though coffee was provided free of charge. La Miele is pretty consistent for food quality and service. I ordered duck one night and parts of it were terribly undercooked. I was offered a replacement but I had by then finished my meal and didn't want to eat mire and no adjustment was made to my bill. The service is good there though. This hotel is busy through the summer season and has a lot of summer events organized so it is constantly very busy, which can result in frustration if the lobby is full of people drinking and you are trying to push your way through to get to the lifts. The instant service button on the phone in my room was not working. No free wi fi.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel for business travelers”
Reviews.Author: Barbara M
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with this hotel and highly recommend it for a business trip. The rooms have everything you need- lots of power sources, a good desk, iphone charger clock radio, great light and very nice views. I stayed twice within a month and had both city views and water views. Both were good but actually I liked the city view even better as the building is shaped in a U on the water side and so you don't get a front-on water view in most rooms. Bathrooms are huge with a great separate tub and all amenities. Great gym with a pool although i dipped a toe in and it felt a little cool. Overall an excellent choice!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Layover Hotel Boston Logan”
Reviews.Author: 35000ft
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Intercontinental Boston during a layover on a trip to Europe in June 2011. While there are many hotels closer to Boston Logan International Airport the intercontinental was on the Boston Waterfront and near many of Boston's best attractions. It costs $20.00 by cab to get to the hotel from the airport. ($40/ RT) Pros: Clean room. No bed bugs. Large travertine bathroom with shower and separate tub. Excellent hotel bar with fresh seafood and great food. Excellent service and ease of checkin/checkout. Location Views/Riverfront Large Lobby 24 Hour fitness facilities Cons: Room was smaller than average for the price. Expensive A/C did not get really cold but was comfortable. This was by far the most restful layover I've ever experienced and when travelling from Texas to Boston then onwards it was worth the money to get recharged in Boston enroute to Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Best bathroom ever, great service, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: BonhomieCA
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at the InterContinetal for two nights in June during a conference at the nearby convention center. Very comfortable, though compact for a king room. The bathroom was the best laid out floorplan I've ever seen. Large walkin shower, huge separate tub, with shutters opening to the bedroom letting in natural light. Short walking distance to the North End, close to the T, and right on the canal. Very convenient. Concierge helpful and kind. I have no idea how much it cost, as it was on the company, but i highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but wheres the special something?”
Reviews.Author: dizzydiz
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in numerous intercontinentals from around the world, I can say that this is a nice hotel, but doesnt measure up to some of its other hotels. Hotel is nice, room is nice, everything is nice....but thats it. And when you have seen some of the Intercontinentals of the world, you feel like they didnt do anything with this one to wow you. So good hotel, probably would stay again, but only if the price is good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pcsanity
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this location for three nights while traveling for a leisure trip to enjoy the sights of Boston. We recommend taking the water taxi from Logan if the weather is nice. Beautiful views of the city, quick connection from the terminal to the dock via bus, and then the water taxi drops you right at the dock for the Intercontinental. Check in was quick and easy. Even though they did not have our room ready when we arrived (it was 9am) they processed our check in and held our bags. They said they would call us when our room was ready but that never happened. When we checked to see if the room was ready, it was. When we got to our room, our keys did not work so back down we went. We were on an award stay, but our first room though acceptable for a standard room was right across from a construction site in the adjacent building and we did not want to be awakened early. To the credit of staff, they moved us to a very nice corner room on the top floor, overlooking the city and a bit of the water. (It was partially "accessible", but no worry. From what I understand the hotel was sold out but never felt crowded. The location was right on the waterfront, and less than a ten minute walk to Freedom Trail, main trolley stops, ferry landing, Quincy Market, Faneuil Hall, North end, etc. Being in the financial district there is a slightly limited selection of dining options directly near the hotel but endless options within minutes walk. We felt safe walking in the area. We never used a taxi during out stay as we were so close to everything. The hotel has very nice gym with quite a bit of cardio equipment, (all including TV's), a weight system, and other equipment all overlooking the city. There is an indoor pool (no hot tub) that appeared nice though it was hot and humid. (and crowded with kids...nothing wrong with kiddos, but not relaxing...but hey...we were here to see the sights, we can hang by the pool in the tropics.) They have a nicely appointed business center but it is very high dollar as with most business class hotels. They also had a PC where you could print boarding passes for free, but it never worked...but the concierge kindly printed them for us. The hotel has internet access for a fee....we did not bother using it between our smart phones and tethering plan. The rooms were nicely decorated, and comfortable. The first room we were in had the much mentioned window to the bathroom that would have let light into the room, but the second room we moved into did not have this window, it appeared in the room, but was tiled over in the bathroom. The bed was very comfortable and the curtains did an excellent job of blocking out the light. They have nice flat screen TV's with sufficient channels, and the room included a large work desk, plenty of plugs, and a lounge chair. There is a coffee/tea maker, ice bucket, and mini bar. (No room in minibar for personal items) The first room we were in also had a couch. Everything was very clean. The climate control works well and you can leave the blower motor on for white noise while the climate control is still functioning. Bathrooms are huge and well equipped with plenty of storage and counter space, lots of toiletries, etc. The bathroom has a soaker tub as well as a shower. The towels were a bit of a disappointment.....rather scratchy for this class of hotel. There was no noise from nearby rooms and only marginal noise from the city streets below. There are several dining options in the hotel but we did not partake of any of them....we were not there to eat in hotel restaurants. We did have cocktails in the bar one night...the cocktails were very good though very pricey. Service was also very good. We went down the street to Legal Seafood on subsequent nights and hung out at the bar a bit. Legal Seafood is about a 7 minute walk away. Great hotel, great service, other than the glitches on check in.. The concierge was always very helpful and housekeeping was very responsive and timely. One oddity was that they did not have any plastic laundry bags to put our dirty clothes in to travel home. We would highly recommend this hotel. We are happy having stayed here.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms and great location!”
Reviews.Author: DLK26
Reviews.Content: My husband enjoyed a stay here during Memorial Day Weekend. It was our first trip to Boston and we wanted a nice hotel with a good location in order to be able to see the city. We loved the room! It was very sleek yet comfortable. Service was fantastic all around from the bar tenders in the Tequila/Rum Bar in the main lobby to check in to the Concierge. The hotel is only a short walk to Quincy Market. We booked this hotel as an "unpublished" rate on one of the discount travel sights and got a very good deal. The hotel was worth every penny! We purchased trolley tickets through the concicerge in order to get around the city. This is a fun way to see all the sights in Boston. Be sure to take advantage of the included harbor cruise as well!

Reviews.Title: “InterContinental quality alive and kickin' in Boston”
Reviews.Author: OutofRange331
Reviews.Content: Before moving abroad, I lived for ten years in Boston. I consider the city my home. Rarely (if ever) did I get an opportunity to stay in a Boston hotel until this past January when my company held a meeting at the InterContinental in Boston on the edge of the "new" Southie. When they were building the shiny new InterContinental, it was the talk of the town. A gorgeous glass facade overlooking the water was a nice touch to add to a busy street near South Station, the main train terminal. It's a nice addition to a city that is chock full of old, but elegant, hotels. The hotel, overall, was a great stay. The bar in the lobby was a great meeting place for colleagues and friends alike. The location is fabulous - steps away from Downtown Crossing and Faneuil Hall, as well as a quick 10-15 minute drive from the airport. Rooms are nice, modern and spacious. The service is great - they even helped me secure a rental car for an afternoon having the rental car company drop the car off at the hotel while they handled the organization of it all. Meeting accomodations were good - meeting rooms were standard, food was ok. Small complaint was my room - it overlooked, well - nothing. It would have been nice to get a view of the water. But honestly, it's a small complaint in the grand scheme of things. The price was steep, but what do you expect with an InterContinental?

Reviews.Title: “Odd Room Design”
Reviews.Author: devere
Reviews.Content: Great location and many fine amenities BUT the room design is the strangest spouse and I had ever seen. The whole wall area above the bed (from the pillow area to the ceiling) was not a solid wall. It was a sliding "window" made of some sort of translucent stiff plastic. A guest in the bedroom could slide the "window" and have an unobstructed open view of all the bathroom facilities: bathtub, toilet, glass-walled shower. A guest in the bathroom could do the same and have an unobstructed view of the entire bedroom. There was no way the "window" could be locked from the either the bathroom or the bedroom. While it was not possible to see through the translucent "window" when it was closed, there was no way to obscure sound or odor. In other words, NO PRIVACY! Even people traveling with close family might like to have their bedroom/bathroom experiences private. For this reason I would hesitate to stay at the Intercontinental Boston unless traveling alone.

Reviews.Title: “It was Good... for free”
Reviews.Author: mytripsFlorida
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are originally from Boston and were up visting family. We stayed the last two nights of our trip. The hotel is an average $300+ a night hotel, I didn't think it was a five star as advertised. But we had two nights free. As for the room, the bed is comfortable, small pillows standard size, the bathroom was great, very big with good lighting. The main lobby is very big, I didn't like it..has a very cold feeling to it. We decided to have dinner one night at Rumba's the bar located in the lobby...we were very disappointed when we got there. It was packed with people just off of work...drinking. It was upsetting as guest of the hotel we could not get a seat, and had to wait in the lobby until people started to leave. Don't go between 5-7pm. The food was great though, staff not very friendly at all. As for the location, for anyone visiting Boston, it's good. You are in walking distance to everything. Good location for family vacation.... very close to Children's museum, Aquarium and Faneuil Hall. Would I stay there again..no prefer Newbury St area for shopping and dining...better hotels...Oh the other thing I'd like to mention...even though they advertise walk-in service for a chair massage...not true..you better call ahead. I was looking forward to a little massage...but it didn't happen they were booked...not enough help...didn't like that.

Reviews.Title: “Don't overpay”
Reviews.Author: BronxKevin
Reviews.Content: This is my fourth time staying at the Intercontinental Boston. The location is great, a few blocks from Quincy Market and the Seaport Convention center, a few feet from Barking Crab. The restaurants and bars downstairs are a decent option if you don't feel like going far. If you want to remain anonymous and stay in a relatively clean hotel, this is the place for you. A few things to keep in mind if you're about to pay 4 or 4.5 star prices: They will not bring your car up from the garage for you. You have to take the elevator to the lobby, walk across the lobby and take a second elevator down to the garage. You can't even call ahead for the car. This service costs $40 a night. There isn't really anyone paying attention to guests coming and going, or for that matter who goes up on the elevators. This seems like a security problem to me. I also found the pillows to be lacking. First of all, I had 2 different size pillows on my bed. Second, they were flat. No support at all. Like I had folded up a shirt and put it under my head. I may stay at the Intercontinental again, but not at the same price. They are not 4 or 4.5 star anymore.

Reviews.Title: “Second time and still 5*”
Reviews.Author: dhmills
Reviews.Content: Been here twice, both times it exceeded my expectations. This is a gorgeous hotel in a beautiful location. Rooms are big and clean and the bathrooms are amazing. This is a place you really will not want to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel, never disappoints.”
Reviews.Author: Kat1999
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the InterContinental in Boston before and again it has not let me down. It's such a beautiful hotel, the rooms are spotless, and the staff is so helpful and friendly. The location is always perfect, we spent time at Quincy Market and Fenway and both were convenient to the T-Station (South Station) right down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and great restaurant”
Reviews.Author: SueandBill86
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised by this hotel. Great location right on the water. Outdoor dining was fantastic.....felt alittle like a European city for a moment that night.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend escape”
Reviews.Author: jfhbryon
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a true weekend escape. I have stayed tree weekends in two years and love this place. The rooms are big, clean and beautifully decorated. The bathrooms are so big you could live in one. The housekeeping, room service and food are perfection. They do need to retrain the restaurant wait staff as they are a bit unorganized and unfriendly (but the food is great). Front desk and concierge are friendly and efficient. Can't wait to come back. The beds are clouds of dreams.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: DJ_Billy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a very classy establishment near South Station and China Town. The rooms are large and very modern, with nice touches such as an iPod dock. The hotel has an excellent gym and good bars/restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Awful Customer Service!!!”
Reviews.Author: johndeere43
Reviews.Content: I, too, have been in the hotel industry for 16 years and have never encountered such poor customer service from people of the "management" staff. I will NEVER recommend this hotel to anyone! Granted the hotel was nice, but without good employees to run such a great establishment, then the hotel is nothing. I stayed for 4 nights in May and I am STILL trying to resolve my issues! POOR CUSTOMER SERVICE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay was mislead over internet fees”
Reviews.Author: suejessex
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very good we upgraded to the club room, we were informed that this included free wi fi, on checking out we were charged for the internet at $14.95 per day, when we asked about this, we were told the free wi fi is only in the club lounge! with most hotel offering free wi fi to all its guests we feel this is a lot to charge and it should have been clearly pointed out as to where it was available free. Apart from this the hotel was great the location is great.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable and well-maintained”
Reviews.Author: trippyNYC
Reviews.Content: IC boston was much nicer than expected. the lobby provides a grand entrance and has beautiful flowers everywhere. we don't normally stay on this side of town so it was a welcome change to have a base in a different area. i love walking around fort point and it was really easy going out the back entrance of IC and crossing the bridge to flour bakery every morning (famous for their sticky buns and other baked goods, plus incredible sandwiches). sam's at louis (in fort point also) is a wonderful dining spot with huge window walls overlooking the harbor. many of the lobster shacks are a short walk away too. chinatown isn't far either. we had a waterview room which is more a view of the channel, so it's not sweeping views of the harbor. the gym is pretty big and the pool is nice but often full of little kids. we requested a fridge for our room which didn't come for a day or so, so we called again and were told it was $35 fee. we decided not to get it but then noticed in the mini-bar (which is electronically monitored), there's a small space for personal items--great touch and perfect for small leftovers. hotel is well-done and might be worth it to stay every time just for its proximity to a flour bakery.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: SandyBeach86
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in many properties in Boston, and you can't beat this location! It is just a block from the Boston Harbor Hotel. The Intercontinental is within walking distance to Faneuil Hall, the North End, the Aquarium, and South Station (easy subway access throughout the city!) You can also walk to the water shuttle and be in Charlestown to visit the USS Constitution in 25 minutes. Because it is in the Financial District, it is relatively quiet at night. We had a room facing Atlantic Ave (and the Boston Fire Dept, which I guess could be noisy!) and it was a nice city view. I would recommend requesting a harbor view, which I can imagine would be beautiful. We really did not use any of the amenities at the hotel, so cannot comment on the them. There is a lap pool and a small gift store for convenience. The hotel has a very contemporary look/feel to it, and the rooms were nice but not over the top. The bathrooms were quite spacious, but wished there were queen beds instead of doubles. There is a Panera across the street which was convenient for coffee/bagels in the morning. The hotel is dog friendly (for a steep fee!), with lots of grassy walking area just outside the door on the Rose Kennedy greenway. Valet parking is the only option for parking and is $40 per 24 hour period with in and out privileges. $14.95 per day for internet is annoying, but we would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Very plush elegant hotel shame about the service from some of the staff”
Reviews.Author: stewkerr
Reviews.Content: The hotel is fantastic. Well worth it's five star rating. However, some of the staff are in a word rubbish. I went to the bell desk to arrange to have our luggage collected and after explaining 3 times I thought I had got through to him. Sadly I was wrong. When they hadn't shown up at the correct time I had to call down, it then took a full 15 minutes for someone to arrive. We were then left on the curb to sort our own transport. Eventually after another 15 minutes I managed to flag down a cab. Very poor service from a five star establishment that is supposed to be the flagship brand of the group. I've mentioned before I spend over 100 nights a year in hotels. This should have been the best of them all but sadly it wasn't. When I stayed in the same branded hotel in Paris it was outstanding. I can only give this 4 stars and I hope it was just unfortunate how we were treated whilst leaving. All the other staff encountered were outstanding. The bellmen and doormen weren't.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hoops2441
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice. The rooms were spacious and very clean. Location was located within walking distance of Faneuil Hall and the North end. I would highly recommend. It does seem pretty pricey however we ended up getting a deal via priceline.com.

Reviews.Title: “The one All Intercontinentals should look into”
Reviews.Author: Carl041
Reviews.Content: Built to be an outstanding hotel. Excellent room design and ammenities. Best Intercontinental I have ever stayed and one of the best hotels in Boston for the price. Walk to Faneuill Hall and cab or walk to North End. T stations nearby. Outstanding service.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious, pricey but worth every penny”
Reviews.Author: carinita314
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for a little "end of holiday traveling" R&R and we loved it. The staff was super attentive and the hotel is gorgeous. Note, being in the financial district, lots of places were closed so food options were limited. However, it is Boston and something is always in walking distance but you don't get a lot of mom-and-pop enteries in this neighborhood. Bathroom is lovely. Wireless is wicked expensive, and they charge quite a bit to print in the business center but Panera is just down the street and has free wireless. Overall, totally recommend it but it is an IC so it is pricey; then again it is super convenient to all the banking and it is on the water. :)

Reviews.Title: “You'll like it here except the beds.”
Reviews.Author: JacksBack05101
Reviews.Content: The staff, the gym and pool, the food, all great. Very clean. Nice amenities. This is the last chain on earth who didn;t get the memo about bedding being key to a happy traveler. You'd be more comfortable sleeping in the tub. The doubles are the tiniest queen size we've ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased”
Reviews.Author: lindagaf
Reviews.Content: We booked this last minute on a third party website so got it at a rock-bottom price. We didn't know what the hotel was until we had paid, but we couldn't afford it if it were full price. We were very happy with our choice! The service was outstanding. They went out of their way to accomodate us, even though we paid a pittance of the full rate. Our room wasn't ready so they gave us a suite with a view of the water! They made up two extra beds for the kids, looked after our stuff when we checked out, marking our daughter's violin as fragile, and all the staff were helpful and polite. The room was nicely decorated, the lobby and bar were humming, and it is in a fairly central location. The concierge was very informative and gave us maps and all kinds of information about the subway and the Freedom Trail, as well as restaurant tips, etc... A great Boston choice, I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - Great Staff - Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: BeverleyT
Reviews.Content: Isn't it strange how reviews differ. I can see the reviews below saying the staff were unhelpful etc. Well, I have a very different story to tell. The staff were amazing! Got to Boston at 11am and thought we would try to check in. This was the morning after the marathon so I expected they would be too busy - but no, checked us in immediately. Front desk really helpful and it was not an issue we were early at all. The cocktails were great, the gym nice and spacious. Only thing I did find was that the pool was not quite as warm as I would have liked, but then I do like my baths very hot! The room was nice and spacious, the bathtub amazing! So huge. Got back home and realised I had left a bag of shopping in the room. I called up and housekeeping couldn't have been more helpful. They called me back to tell me they had found it, then called me back again to say they were FedEx'ing it to me in the UK at their cost. (Thank you so much Ed Woods). Honestly, I can't recommend this hotel highly enough whether you are on business or travelling with a family (I do both - very often!). Their staff are a credit to them. Perhaps the people that found them unhelpful were rude and demanding!!!

Reviews.Title: “brilliant highlight of our honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: deifer
Reviews.Content: We had a brilliant time here. The staff were brilliant and incredibly helpful. The waiter, concierge, doormen, etc were out standing. Food was fabulous. The only thing we would say is that the bar staff were a little snotty and not inclined to have any interpersonal skills. A totally different group to the rest of the staff. Thank you to everyone else for a brilliant time.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect business travel hotel”
Reviews.Author: e1977
Reviews.Content: I try to stay here everytime I'm staying in Boston. Great location right near S. Station and the Financial District. Nice big rooms, fantastic bathrooms, good fun casual bar and choice of restaurants both inside the hotel and very nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful with a lack of service.”
Reviews.Author: Patrick_Bateman
Reviews.Content: Dear all, I just wanted take the chance to tell you about my mixed feelings after my first stay at your hotel. (School notes from A-F) Check-In: "B-" The check-in could have been an "A", as we were nicely greeted at the reception and received a great suite-upgrade as well as club access. However which did not work is the chaotic situation in front of your hotels... there are always so many cars, our cab couldnt even park right in front and the bell-man was also not very attentive. Furthermore I called the day before to ensure early-check-in, which I was promised, but when I wanted to check-in, I was told our room will only be ready around noon. Room: "A-" Great room, although furniture is already a little bit aged. There is an IP-Telephone where no quick call is programmed and no numbers are on it. So how should you know how to call reception, room service etc- ? This should be fixed ! Also the "fast service" button on the other standard phone did not work ... so this was a little downturn. And it took years until somebody answered the phone. Lounge: "C-" Although the food overed in the lounge is great and it offers a stunning view, what destroys the lounge experience is the staff. Oh my god. I never experienced a so unattentive and unmotivated girl as the blonde working in your lunge. She did not take care of anything... it was horrible. The coffee was cold, the platters emptied... . When I asked her to get a knife, because there were no knifes anymore - she pulled out... right one knife ... so the next one would have again to ask ... . She was more concerned about surfing the internet instead of providing service to your guests. Check-Out: "C" Check Out was good and fast, however what is again a downturn is the chaos in front of the hotel. No cabs .. and the bell-man was not able to pull one-over ... it took ages until we got one and could depart.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Hanson05
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the InterContinental Boston during a 4 day, 3 night business trip. Upon arrival, I was thrilled, because the hotel is beautiful! I travel quite a bit, and had previously come to the realization that many well-known and allegedly high quality hotel chains have simply decreased their service & amenities and I would just have to deal with it. That is absolutely not the case with the InterContinental! It was wonderful! The entire hotel is extremely clean, has a trendy modern feel & decor, plush bedding, amazing bathrooms with huge tubs & separate glass showers, has a fantastic location right on the water, provides top quality amenities, excellent room service, etc. I have ZERO complaints. It was such a welcome change from every other hotel I have stayed at in the past year! Every single hotel staff individual I met went out of their way to make my stay more agreeable. I was attending a conference, and even at the conference, the wait staff would walk up to people who were standing in the foyer and talking and ask if more coffee was desired, or if they could get us some juice, or if they could take our dishes out of our hands (dirty), etc. The hotel supplied so much staff for the event that they literally were waiting on you constantly, and the staff all seemed genuinely pleased to be able to assist with pleasant smiles on their faces. Sounds simple, yet many hotel's do not do this anymore. The above & beyond behavior makes you feel like you are very valued as a hotel guest. I used the gym every day I was there, and it too was fantastic. 24-hour access, temperature controlled, with great machines, and a beautiful view of the little park right in front of the property and the Boston Fire Department right across the street. Plenty of towels, water with watermelon and musk melon to flavor it, newspapers, and it was all included with the room rate. No extra fee for gym use. I also had a treatment at the spa and it too was fantastic. Dined at the Sushi restaurant one evening and had some of the most wonderful sushi I have ever had in my life. It was fantastically prepared, creative, was incredibly fresh, tasted amazing, and the staff of the restaurant were extremely attentive and helpful with ordering as well. Without question, the next time I am in Boston for personal reasons on my own dime, I will look into staying at the InterContinental. Hands down, it is one of the BEST properties I have ever had the pleasure of visiting!

Reviews.Title: “Hope You Don't Have A Problem”
Reviews.Author: tednovie
Reviews.Content: During our stay in August 2010 the hotel experienced a fire which in their defence was not a predictable event. But after being evacuated for more than twelve hours from our rooms with little or no communication from the hotel ,the hotel next door offered us in to stay in their ballroom.Once we were allowed back into our rooms the following morning we were once again evacuated due to a fire. This time the duration was possibility one hour. After numerous complaints to the management the best we could recoup financially from the hotel was reimbursement for the night we were unable to use our room. They would not entertain any additional compensation for our inconvenience even though it cause us to cancel some events that we had scheduled for our visit. In closing, don't have any problems that may require assistance with from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Even with younger children its great”
Reviews.Author: stephanier76
Reviews.Content: This was my 2nd stay at the Intercontinental with hopes of another stay coming up this summer. First stay was September of 2008. I fell in love with it then and still love it now. I was excited to bring my family up to show them the luxurious rooms and great hotel. We were in town for a trip to the Museum of Science and the minute my family entered the hotel they were saying "great pick mom, way to go". My two daughters utilized the large bathtub and loved how deep it was, they thought it was the pool. Which I then took them to the pool and they loved that just as much. There isnt anything negative I could say about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: Ridgetraveler
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at many hotels in Boston over the years, I thought this was one of the best facilities and certainly at the rate on Priceline it was a great deal. Very clean rooms and common spaces. Great pool, fitness facility and steam room. The hotel staff was terriffic and really went the extra distance in terms of assisting us as one of children was ill. I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Gr”
Reviews.Author: weegietiger69
Reviews.Content: I generally avoid large corporate hotels when I can as I think they lack character and all the rooms all feel & look the same. But the InterContinental Boston was very different. The quality of the room was amazing. It was finished to a high standard, with a creative & thoughtfull layout and very clean. The bed faced the large windows and the chaise lounge in the room, meant I could relax, watch TV and enjoy room service. The bathroom had a sliding door which allowed me to luxuriate in the bath and still be able to watch TV or listen to my iPod in the iPod charging unit next to my bed (which was part of the room!). It was a struggle to leave the room! The service from room service was good but not great. I asked for a Sirloin steak, cooked medium and got a filet cooked rare. For a room service bill of $75 I expect them to get things like that right, but I was too jet lagged to complain and I think it was just a little bit of a hiccup as the room service breakfast was great, as I would expect for $26. The location is good for business, being in the heart of downtown Boston next to all the highrises and office blocks. The Spa and gym facilities are good, modern and clean, with complimentary towels and water. The bar is lovely with attentive staff that don't fuss too much over you but make sure you're taken care of - a great balance to achieve! I think great hotels make you feel that you don't have to "sweat the small stuff" and I was disapionted that they couldn't allow me to have a late checkout after staying for 4 days as I wasn't leaving until 2:30pm and had to hang out in the bar until then. This was an easy thing for them to say "yes" to but in the end made a big impact on my stay here. Its a tough call whether to say the pretty steep rates are justified but it probably only does if somebody else is picking up the tab!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and a nice (but expensive) hotel”
Reviews.Author: SlovakKiwi
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel thought one fo the travel websites with telling them where I want to stay and how much I want to pay. It was at the very last minute. I ended up paying 140 USD plus tax while the normal rate is around 400USD which was a nice deal :-) We stayed only for 2 nights. Pros: 1. Location was excellent. Right in the city centre. Close to good restaruants and attractions. 2. Very spacious, clean and well organized rooms. 3. Very close to the subway. Cons: 1. I remember Internet being too expensive...

Reviews.Title: “Great location - very trendy”
Reviews.Author: kwtech
Reviews.Content: Hotel is right on the Boston waterfront - one block from Amtrak's Boston South Station. A lot of restaurants and businesses are within walking distance. The waterfront, right outside the hotel's backdoor, is a great place for sightseeing, jogging, etc. A gave the hotel a low sleep quality rating because of the room I was in. I was on a the 4th floor just above the hotel entrance. Great view, but it was directly across the street from what has to be the busiest fire station in Boston. My advice, request a non-front facing room. In spite of the room's location, it was fantastic. I think I was given a larger room because of the inconvenience (see above). Based on room photos on the hotel's website, my room was about twice as large as the average - on complaints. My room had a soaking tub and a shower. There was a sliding window which exposed the soaking tub to the bedroom area - very nice. The hotel is very modern, but a little steril in the lobby area. The restaurant had a surprisingly somewhat limited menu. Unless you've just got off a long train ride like I did, I'd venture out for food. For seafood lovers, there is a small but stylish sushi restaurant in the hotel as well. The bar/lounge appears to be a very popular hangout. It was crowded every night I was at the hotel. The wait staff at the restaurant was friendly. Hotel checkin was quick. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel experience in 20+ years of travel!”
Reviews.Author: Vacation807
Reviews.Content: Made reservations through a a travel site with "unpublished fares". Requested a room with a king bed. Upon check in, we found our room had 2 double beds. We called down to the hotel mgr, Lexi Santiago, who told us there were no more rooms available with king beds. Finding that hard to believe because the place seemed nearly deserted, we went online to try and book a room with a king bed directly through their hotel website, which showed available rooms. When we confronted Ms. Santiago with this information, catching her in a lie, she changed her response to, "we don't have any king rooms available at the price you paid, we do have king rooms, but it will cost you an additional $100". She then went on to explain that we booked a "run of the mill" room, and she could do nothing further for us. My husband said he didn't expect a 4 star hotel to have ANY "run of the mill rooms", understanding clearly her misuse of the term "run of the house". Two hours later and several phone calls to our online travel site and the hotel's corporate customer service number to complain, we finallly heard from another hotel mgr, Greg, who came to our room with keys to accomodate us with another room with a king bed. While he was very polite and apologized for our unpleasant experience, there was no remedy for the damage done by Lexi in treating us like third rate, very unwelcomed guests not to mention hours lost dealing with unnecessary problems. We refused to spend any more of our money at the hotel, and had a quite lovely meal at Anthony's Pier Four, where we dropped $250 for a very elegant dinner where we WERE treated with respect and class. This place may have a great location and nicely equipped rooms, but with a Mgr. like Ms. Santiago, they will never be 4 star. And shame on this hotel for charging ridiculous prices for wifi and parking. We were wrongly charged for mini bar items because we moved things around to make room for our own wine we purchased (again, we were NOT going to spend any more of our money at this place) and apparently when you move items it trips off the sensors in the fridge and charges you for those items, even if you put them back and they're still there! This error was corrected upon check-out when we explained that we did not take all the items listed. Absolutely disgraceful experience. Never again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: AJDONE
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the InterContinental Boston for a long weekend. I had a great time. The concierge was great!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - My New Favorite Hotel In Boston”
Reviews.Author: pm85
Reviews.Content: Iâ€™ve stayed at almost every hotel in Boston, and the Intercontinental is my new favorite hotel for both business and family travel. If you are looking for a luxury hotel, with immaculate service, great amenities, beautiful rooms, wonderful views, and a great staff, then the IC Boston might be a great choice. The location, as other reviewers have noted, is at the edge of the financial district and it is not an ideal location for shopping. However, the North End is a fun (and scenic) 10 minute walk, South Station is a 5 minute walk, and Beacon Hill is about 10 minutes. The hotel is probably a 15 minute cab ride to Copley Square (Marriot, Hilton, Sheraton) and Newbury Street. The hotel is located on the water (a waterway, not the harbor) and is easily accessed via the water taxi from Logan. Next door, you will find the Federal Reserve, the Boston Fire Department, a bunch of the major Boston banks (State Street, Fidelity, etc..) as well as (in the vicinity): Institute of Contemporary Art (ICA), Boston World Trade Center (5 min walk), NE Aquarium (5 min walk). The staff is wonderful! Check-in was great â€“ even after booking a discounted room from a popular hotel site. I was travelling with my wife and 2 children and we were looking for a room with lots of space. After enrolling in the IC Ambassador program ($200) we were upgraded to a beautiful suite (1900 sq ft) on the 11th floor. The room was amazing, the views were great, and the extra space was nice. Standard rooms are nice â€“ and the suites are great. The pool, and work out facilities, are the nicest that I have seen in any hotel in Boston. All in all, this is the best hotel experience I have ever experienced in Boston. Some of my other favorite Boston hotels are: Nine Zero Beacon Hill, Hotel Marlowe in Cambridge, Fairmont Copley, Hilton Back Bay. Awesome hotel â€“ this will be my first choice in Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MissA321
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend the Intercontinental. The room was beautiful and very spacious. Housekeeping and room service staff were accommodating. The one word of caution would be to avoid the concierge for restaurant suggestions - they recommended a place that they were affiliated with and it was not "moderately" priced as we requested nor the type of gourmet we were looking for. The spa, however, was incredible and the massage was probably the best I have ever had! And, the lobster benedict we ordered from room service was phenomenal.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, well-appointed hotel, just not near all the action”
Reviews.Author: mwmsc610
Reviews.Content: We absolutely LOVED the hotel, but did not love that we were not in walking distance really to anything in Boston. We always took the T no matter where we went, as we were right by the silver line. The restaurant was a little pricey, so we did not try, but the hotel definitely served it purpose. Does not include free WiFi which is kind of annoying because of the price of the hotel. Also, the concierge was not very helpful either. When we asked the best way to get to the hotel from the airport, they told us to take a cab. We paid a ridiculous amount for a cab when we could've gotten to the hotel by the T. I asked the concierge to help us find the mall in Chestnut Hill- she sent us on a wild goose chase downtown Boston on Boylston Street. Turns out there is a Boylston in Boston AND in Chestnut Hill. You would think the concierge would know this. Regardless, the hotel is probably one of the nicest in Boston. I have stayed in three other hotels there and this one far surpasses in cleanliness, aesthetics, and roominess. The others were nice based on location but were MUCH smaller and generally not as nice.

Reviews.Title: “Would Not Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: touristwoman
Reviews.Content: I arrived in the late afternoon and was told they'd call when my room was ready. By mid evening no call had come, so I called the desk. The manager responded in a surprisingly rude and annoyed tone that he hadn't forgotten that I needed a room, yet it was nearing 7:00pm. Although I was polite and sensible on the phone he hung up abruptly in anger and left me having another matter regarding my stay unresolved. I had read a couple of other reviews regarding rudeness, and I shrugged it off, but in the end it really did make me feel very uncomfortable as a paying guest. The hotel was not special or nice enough to overcome the surprisingly rude treatment from the manager. The gym and pool were lovely and there was enough high quality equipment in there to get a very decent workout. The massage/spa area was a little grungy, stained lounge chairs, a few pieces of trash here and there. The massage was good, but the steam room hadn't been pre-heated and so that wasn't usable for I didn't care to wait for a long time for it to heat and steam up. Restaurant was average, bar area busy but out dated looking like most of the hotel. I saw a couple of rooms and had a suite, it was not exciting and I didn't care for the opening window behind the bed into the bathroom. Bright in the bed area at night if someone went to the bathroom with that window.

Reviews.Title: “Unsafe,unpleasant, Btter treamant at low end hotels”
Reviews.Author: crustyman
Reviews.Content: My family and I decided to stay in an Intercontinental hotel in Boston; this is the flagship of hotels for the IHG group. This was the 1st time we ever stayed at one and appearance was great. Rooms were clean simply elegant hotel. However after being in our room for a while my 1.5 year old ventured over to the window and was able to open it. The window had no locks and to boot the window was at floor level up to my knees and opened bottom swinging out. After contacting the front desk, they said their windows donâ€™tâ€™ open. The bellhop came up to move us to a room they believe no windows opened. So we packed up and needless to say it was the same issue. We wanted city side for the view and ended up in the same room. The bellhop stated that your only staying one night and put the ironing board in front of the window.2 times that night 7pm and 9pm we had a visit from housekeeping trying to clean our room, no one updated the computer sytem.In the morning I called about our meal tickets which were part of our stay, They said come on down and weâ€™ll give them to you at the front desk.Weall went down with both children and no vouchers. No one has contacted me about my horrible stay and have complained 3 times and still no response. I would avoid this particular one and stay at the Lennox or westin in Boston .Very disappointed with the way they handle and spoke to me.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly unimpressed”
Reviews.Author: 247AlwaysOnTheGo
Reviews.Content: While the hotel is obviously new, modern, and well designed, the management clearly has not put ANY effort into their guests' experience or training their staff. I arrived late at night at 11pm and was met at reception by a woman who could best be described as 'sullen'. There was no mention of having anyone helping me with my bags, either at the valet station or in the lobby. While my room was spacious and the bed comfortable, the heat was cranked up to 75 degrees -- it was nearly 2am before the room cooled down enough for me to fall asleep. Despite the fact that I hadn't requested a wake-up call or ordered breakfast room service, someone started banging down my door at 6:45am. (After a late night of travel, I had no intention of getting up before 8am before a busy day of meetings.) I assumed they had the wrong room and stayed in bed. Much knocking and door bell ringing ensued, followed by an angry phone call and a member of staff rudely telling me to open the door for room service. I told them I hadn't ordered room service, asked why they were insistent on waking me up, and they actually had the nerve to start arguing with me! As I was leaving for meetings at 9am, I mentioned this to the concierge, and while he was apologetic, made no offer to compensate for my poor night's sleep. Even a 2-star Hilton Garden Inn would have offered a free drink at the bar in apology! For a 4.5-star-wannabe hotel, a bottle of wine sent to my room would have a been appropriate at a minimum. When I returned between meetings briefly at 2pm my room had not been made-up. By 4pm, it finally had been, but with dirty towels left on the bathroom floor and garbage in the trash can -- an extremely lazy job. Forget simple niceties such as balt salts or shower gel, or even fluffy towels for that matter... Enjoy a flower in the bud vase or a chocolate on your pillow? Despite the price, it ain't happening! The newness of the furnishings can't make up for a BARE MINIMUM EFFORT when it comes service and guest experience.

Reviews.Title: “As advertised.”
Reviews.Author: cooldude22
Reviews.Content: High quality hotel for business travelers near the waterfront, federal building and close to the airport. Rooms were spacious and well done. First room I checked in had a strong disinfectant aroma to it and I asked to be moved which they did immediately and actually upgraded the room for the inconvenience. Good way to handle it. Bar and breakfast were spot on so no complaints there. If you are a light sleeper ask for a room away from the front side of the building that faces the fire station for obvious reasons.

Reviews.Title: “One of the very best..”
Reviews.Author: AndyRobo1811
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for one night only. I wish i could have stayed for longer s everything about it was 5*. We stayed in a suite with a free mini bar. The room was incredable.. The bathroom was one of the best i have ever seen in a hotel and the bed itself was very comfortable. When we were heading out into Boston we asked at desk where the best places to go out were and they couldn't have been more helpful. If i had stayed longer maybe i would have found fault but to me it was definitly a 5* stay

Reviews.Title: “What a high end hotel should be like.”
Reviews.Author: Juli Z
Reviews.Content: The InterContinental Boston is a beautiful new hotel with very spacious rooms. We had a king room on a lower floor facing the city. The view was nothing spectacular but the space made up for it. There was a window between the bathroom and bedroom. The bedroom was a large L shape, with a desk/office space in the end of the L, conveniently separated from the main room. A comfortable divan was set in the middle of the bedroom as an alternative for lounging and watching tv. The bathroom had a shower and an oversize tub. The front desk staff was not particularly friendly, maybe because we are a young couple, but we're not bothered by people assumptions. The valets were also a bit cold and not particularly helpful. The valet parking charge was close to $50/night and when we asked about alternate parking options in the neighbourhood, we got a smug 'There aren't any'. We later passed by a lot down the street that charged $20/night. The hotel is well situated within walking distance to Faneuil Hall/Quincy Market and the North End where you'll find great restaurants and boutique shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Worth Every Dime”
Reviews.Author: Lawtraveler084
Reviews.Content: This is an exceptional hotel. The prices are reasonable for the class of hotel and the bar and restaurant prices are more appropriate than one would expect at a city hotel. The oonly downside is that many of the "harbor view" rooms have limited views and the design of the hotel requires one to close the blinds because of views from other rooms. Ask for a corner king. Hotel parking isn't worth it if one is staying more than one night. However, there is a parking garage right across the street at half the price. Try the health facility. It is the best I have seen in a hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel Close to the Action, But Not Noisy”
Reviews.Author: Yipperc
Reviews.Content: This review is better late than never, but it was a fantastic introduction for my first trip to Boston. It's not in the "heart" of things, such as Copley Square, but it's location on the Waterfront and Rose Kennedy Parkway makes this a great place to stay. The staff was excellant, especially the concierge who was really knowledgable. The front desk check guy was great. The first room he gave us was actually dark and depressing. Our view was the adjacent office building, and we were so close, that I could have read the computer screen. We requested a different room, and he gave us one overlooking the harbor, it was light filled, and great. The beds are very comfortable, and the bathrooms were THE most spacious bathrooms ever. The separate shower stall from the tube was great, and if you like baths, the oversized tub was amazing! :) The downstairs restaurant was always hopping, and had a great vibe. On my second trip back to Boston, I tried to reserve a room here again. Unfortunately, the fall season must have been high season, because our original cost of $160 for a standard room, went up to $500. For $500, I would have tried to stay at a boutique hotel closer in the heart of things. Still, it's a great hotel if you don't mind walking, which is easy in Boston. And, it's close to a T station. One caveat, it should, but does not offer free wifi in the lobby. I don't understand why nice hotels can't provide free wifi...at least in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected stay - Very Pleased”
Reviews.Author: tammynnc
Reviews.Content: I had an unscheduled stop at Boston Logan and needed a hotel for the night. After flying several days in a row I was utterly exhausted and ready to find a place to lay my head down for a few hours. My airline was going to put me up at the Hilton but I decided to bite the bullet and stay at the Intercontinental on my own dime and so glad I did. This is a very nice Intercontinental with excellent customer service as normal. Even though I arrived very late my status was honored and I was upgraded to a beautiful room a gorgeous view over the water. I managed to get on an early morning flight out so didn't get to experience as much of the hotel as I would have liked but I will most certainly return at a later date to take advantage of this lovely hotel when I have the time to actually enjoy it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in an Amazing City”
Reviews.Author: TrickyTravler
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to massachusetts and it wont be my last!! The Intercontinental topped it off, an amazing Modern, Beautiful building, massive actually, happening bar scence and nice out door patio bar. Rooms are huge with unique, Nice Flat screens, Amazing Shower and Bathroom Even has a bathtub and bathrobe. This hotel was so nice, i actually didn't mind paying 8 bucks for a Heinken from the mini fridge. Free coffee maker in the room which is odd for a 5* but ill take it. Amazing Health and Beauty Products. Check in and Check Out was a breeze and a delight

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful treat”
Reviews.Author: JimXu
Reviews.Content: With Priceline you don't know what you are getting. This couldn't have worked out better. The rooms were modern and well designed. The beds were very comfy. The workout area was excellent. The breakfast and the bar were very good. I could not have enjoyed myself more. The perfect relaxing weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Service Beyond Expectation”
