Reviews.Author: Glfangel
Reviews.Content: Once again, the InterContinental Boston has exceeded our expectation. Would highly recommend this hotel. The staff was welcoming and courteous. Your staff is well trained and very accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Shame About the Price-Gauging for Ancillary Services and Tacky Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: repantz
Reviews.Content: It's a really swanky hotel with nice views and good access to financial district. But I didn't make any use of the services - from the restaurant, to the spa, to the mini bar - because I couldn't justify the overpriced rates for anything beyond accommodation, and that's with my company picking up the cost. Also the bar and Miel restaurant do not fit with the rest of the hotel - apart from being overpriced. They are unusually ugly, 'themed' environments (the restaurant is made up to look French provincial and the bar some kind of rum distillery theme, all very fake and tacky) which just don't fit with the glassy, classy feel of the rest of the hotel. And how do they justify such high prices for internet access when anyone knows it doesn't cost anything near that to provide it. Parking was also extremely expensive - $30 for 2 hours. Concierge and staff generally friendly, gym is good - but, really, they are missing a trick by charging such prohibitive prices for every ancillary service, including food.

Reviews.Title: “A very good commericial hotel in Boston”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkChina
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel with views from some rooms- not ours- of Boston Harbor. Good services, nice roome. The location in the financial area of Boston is a little out of the way for tourists.

Reviews.Title: “wow”
Reviews.Author: chefpierre62
Reviews.Content: i normally do not stay overnight in Boston as we live near by. Not feeling well and having a "must go " function, we decided to book a room. THe young lady I think it was Barbara was awesome,got me a great price and watervieew room. The room was more than waht I expected, the valet parking was great and everyone was great. We went to the Admiral's Ball where my friend was being honored Man of the year. Everything was first class, the food was outstanding and the evening a real smash. The view and location of the hotel is great. The only negative would be that you could hear people talking in the hallway. If staying in Boston, check out this place.

Reviews.Title: “Good with small problems”
Reviews.Author: JakubLondon
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is pretty good, staff friendly. I probably wouldn't pay the full price though (got it through priceline.com). The two things that bugged me were: 1) Hotel pool water is VERY cool. Almost unbearable. 2) One of the restaurants is "sushi-teq". If you like japanese food, avoid it. If you want to try japanese food, avoid it. It's not sushi, I was really disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and trendy hotel”
Reviews.Author: jlsalv
Reviews.Content: We stayed in October and enjoyed the experience. The location is good - in between financial district/South station and the North End/Government Center and with the back end of the hotel facing the Boston Harbor. Walk to South Station is 1.5 blocks - about 5 minutes. Walk to North End or Government Center would be about 15 minutes or so depending on where exactly you need to go. Otherwise- a cab ride is very short. We had our infant with us and had no problems. The rooms are very spacious. We had a king sized bed in a room facing the street. There was a small office attached (no door) with the desk and room to place the playpen we brought. The comfort of the bed and amenities was all great. The one neat feature we noticed was that you could turn off the hallway lights from the side of your bed. We didn't hear any neighbors' noise from our room but we could hear some street noise. There is a fire station across the street (there is a narrow park/walking area that runs along side the street in front of the hotel so the station is not right outside the window but rather on the other side of the park). The noise didn't bother me and wasn't overwhelming. I've staying in other hotels deeper in the city and heard more street noise from those experiences compared to this. One feature of the room I wasn't sure I liked was the window between the bathroom and the bed- as other reviewers have commented on. The bathroom itself is very big and well appointed. The tub looked really inviting. However I think I would have preferred the wall between the bathroom and bed be a solid one for more privacy without a window that opens up to the rest of the bedroom. My husband didn't seem to mind it. The bar downstairs was always busy so it looked to be a trendy and popular spot. We didn't have any of the food or drinks at the restaurants. This hotel is very nice and modern in furnishings and quite spacious for hotel room size. I'd recommend it if you want to splurge.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel and Helpful, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: monarchtravel
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel located in the marina/business district area of the city. Great location to walk along the water, and not too far from other attractions in the city as well. Beutiful large room with great bed and linens. Concierge and check-in staff were very helpful. I got a great price on Priceline, but don't know if I would have paid the price I found on their web site for the same dates for $500 a night! Wow - I wouldn't pay that for ANY hotel room!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel has really gone downhill”
Reviews.Author: spacetravler27
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Boston's InterContinental once before which is why I was happy to stay here again. But based on my recent stay I can say with certainty that this Hotel has gone downhill in just about all ways. I think it is incredibly overpriced for the dated rooms with stained throw pillows, the excessively dry air, the unaccommodating staff as they would not grant me a room with double beds despite my called in request, the fire engines roaring by all hours (have you heard of soundproofing?) and my favorite... $15 for microwaved scrambled eggs from room service! It's not the price that upsets me- its the microwaving of the eggs that is most disturbing and I KNOW the difference between pan scrambled and nuked! The room was in my name and my sister had parked in the garage and they told her they had to charge the parking to my room and would not let her pay out of pocket. I found this astonishing and not at all accommodating for a 5 star hotel! Why would you be required to pay for parking by room charge? What if a client was visiting me at the hotel for work- would I have to pay for their parking? What do people do when they park there for the spa or restaurant? And its not cheap at $40 a day. The hotel location is good. The doors to the hotel are incredibly heavy and the doormen just stand there- no hurry to open the door for you. I really doubt the guys over at the Four Seasons, albeit a favorite of mine, just watch the guests struggle with doors and luggage! I mean- seriously? 5 stars? Now, the one thing that they must change, as many other reviewers have discussed, is the sliding window behind the bed into the bathroom. Who approved that design is what I would like to know. I was staying with my sister on this last trip, and even when I stayed here with my husband, this was a very uncomfortable room amenity. Who wants to listen to people do anything from brush their teeth to other bathroom needs? The 'window' when closed still has a once inch open clearance and its right above your head! You hear EVERYTHING when someone else is in the bathroom. Need I say more? They should fill these windows in and be done with this ridiculous design as it does not aid in an enjoyable hotel stay. I'll give a shout out to the hotel bar. It has a happy hour and nightlife scene and thats a plus. I visit Boston on average twice a year and I will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Boston Birthday!”
Reviews.Author: Meleemel_10
Reviews.Content: This hotel has it all - fabulous staff and services, wonderful dining in lobby area, great rooms and good location for maximizing site seeing. Spent my birthday weekend in a wonderful room overlooking the harbor. Rooms were perfectly clean and well appointed. My only minor negative to say is just an opinion type thing - I did not like the sliding door between bedroom and bathroom. THIS was the only thing that I did not really care for though. Beyond that - this hotel was fabulous! Great tequila bar or champagne bar in lobby. Very cute restaurant that we did not eat at but we had their food via room service and it was fantastic. The staff were all very friendly and knowledgeable of the area. Very quiet rooms with fantastic views and very nice to valet parking on site!

Reviews.Title: “Classy comfort in Boston's financial district”
Reviews.Author: bamboostar
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located close to major attractions and South Station, this hotel should meet the expectations of most business and leisure travelers. Service at the front desk was courteous and formal, which is what you would expect from a business hotel. The concierge was very knowledgeable and helpful. Great Bell Desk with kind staff. The Standard Deluxe Room with King bed is spacious and well-appointed. The bed was incredibly comfortable with the softest, highest thread count sheets I've ever encountered. The bathroom was impeccably clean with a great bath tub and separate shower. Like many 4+ star hotels, there was a fee for Internet access, which in this day and age, is outrageous. We refused to pay and found WiFi elsewhere. Overall, we really enjoyed retreating to our room after a busy day. Generally, we found our room to be peaceful and quiet but were disappointed to hear the sounds from the elevator that was adjacent to our room. Next time we would ask to be further away from the elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Weekend at the InterContinental Boston”
Reviews.Author: Irishys
Reviews.Content: Hubby & I spent Columbus Day weekend in Boston with 2 nights at the Intercontinental Boston Hotel. We've been to Boston before but were not familiar with the Intercontinental so we weren't sure what to expect. Well, we were pleasantly surprised. We booked the room through Priceline.com and got an excellent rate for our stay - it almost seemed too good to be true. The hotel is located in a great spot if you want to sightsee in Boston (and have good walking shoes!). Upon exiting the hotel 3 blocks to your left is the financial district, Boston Common & the start of the "Freedom Trail". 2 blocks to your right is Quincy Market, the Harbor Cruises, Columbus Park and so many restaurants. From Quincy Market it is a short walk to "the North End" for delicious Italian food & pastries in addition to the rest of the freedom trail. The one down side of the location is that it is across the street (6 lanes and a park) from a Boston Fire House. We were able to hear the rigs pulling out the first night of our stay. It was quiet the second night. The room was large and most importantly for me...CLEAN! The bathroom was huge. The bed was so comfortable we were afforded a great night's sleep. Because we had made our reservation through priceline, we were not able to request a "king size" bed in advance...but on arrival the girl at the desk was able to give us what we wanted. We did not eat in the hotel but we did go to the bar which was lively...it was fun to just "people watch". Even though the hotel was booked - there were 6 weddings there on Saturday - it did not seem crowded at all. Boston is such a great city and there is so much to do that we'll have to return. We did walk the freedom trail and learned some new stories from US history. We took a harbor cruise (45 minutes was just enough) and saw a few sites but mostly the Boston skyline and Charlestown. Loved the North End...had a delicious dinner at Lucca's...but if you're there on a Saturday night and plan on eatting in any "recommended" restaurants...make reservations. These places are small and most had lines waiting to get in or were just turning people away. We stood on line with a bunch of other folks to get into Mike's Pastry Shop to get canoli...or...in our case...a Boston Cream Puff & brownie...delicious! My favorite thing was sitting in Columbus Park on Sunday listening to a street performer playing guitar. The weather was so beautiful and his music was so soothing it made for a very relaxing time. The one downside was the parking fee...$39.00/night!!! Since we got such a great price on the room...I could swallow that fee...but had I paid over $200 for the room and had to pay that fee as well...I would have choked. So, I would definitely return to Boston and stay at the InterContinental Boston hotel. We hated to leave.

Reviews.Title: “We had a dream wedding (fire not withstanding)”
Reviews.Author: PatrickSiska
Reviews.Content: I have read a couple of reviews on this site regarding the evening of the electrical fire on 8/20/2010. The InterContinental hosted my wedding reception that night and--since it was an evening wedding--a lot of my family and friends stayed at the InterCon. All of them, including me and my wife, were evacuated with the rest of the hotel guests around 2:30 am. Sadly, my new wife and I spent our first night together sleeping on the ballroom floor of the Boston Harbor Hotel with the rest of our families (most of us in formal wear). If anybody has a reason to be upset with the InterContinental, it's us. Interestingly enough, we aren't upset - instead, we're quite the opposite. Despite that rather unlikely inconvenience, our wedding reception was absolutely fantastic. The gentlemen with whom we worked--Paul and Ralph--for a year leading up to our wedding were fully engaged in our planning and went out of their way to make our reception elegant, unique, and fun. On their recommendation, we served our guests an amazing meal that received rave reviews by all: pepper-crusted filet mignon with green and white asparagus and potato dauphinois; as well as hoisin-glazed sesame-crusted Chilean sea bass; both of which were cooked to perfection for our 200 guests. The band, Night Shift, was recommended by Paul and seriously blew away our guests (I have been told by most that they were the best band they have ever seen). With the exception of the fire (which was obviously beyond the control of the staff of the hotel) there is not a single detail I would change about our wedding reception. The entire staff was courteous, professional, detail-oriented, and genuinely concerned about the quality of our guests' stay. In my opinion, the staff of the hotel could not have been more accomodating to my wife and me or our guests. Many of our guests have told us that it was one of the best, most beautiful, and most fun weddings they've ever been to. In the end, I have heard nothing but rave reviews of the hotel and our reception. Yes, the fire was a fiasco, as fires tend to be. It wasn't exactly the way we planned to end our wedding night, which goes without saying. But I can say with confidence that the hotel did everything they could to turn this wrong right by taking care of our overnight guests, our parents, and us. Our planners called us the next morning to make sure we were ok, apologized profusely for what happened, and assured us that they would reimburse our guests for the evening and would take care of our parents and us for all of the trouble - all of which happened to our satisfaction. I would like to think that the fire was an abberation--something not likely to happen again anytime soon--and that the quality of the service and the accomodations are the norm. If you are planning an event in Boston and would like the perfect combination of luxury and style, I HIGHLY recommend the InterContinental. We plan to go back and spend our first anniversary there. --Patrick

Reviews.Title: “Classy hotel with all the necessary amenities and super comfortable beds.”
Reviews.Author: alagardener
Reviews.Content: The rooms have a modern decor, very clean with fluffy linens and super comforable beds. A nice supply of amenities were provided in the very spacious bathroom. Located within walking distance of the harbor, it was still a brisk walk from the happening nightlife. The staff was very courteous and helpful. I left items in the safe box in the room and did not discover until we had checked out a day later. The security guard went the extra mile to locate the items and ship them to me. My stay at the Intercontinental was very pleasant with a reasonable rate.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: Bay City Rollers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Intercontinental based on the acceptance of a blind bid through Priceline. We received a price of $175 per night, which is a great price for a 4-star hotel in downtown Boston. The amenities were as you would expect for a hotel of this caliber. The rooms are great. The staff was helpful. Overall, the location isn't the best, but really isn't too bad if you are a walker. It was about a 10 minute walk to the North End and Quincy Market/Faniel Hall. In the other direction, it was about 15 minutes to Copley Square. We would have no hesitation about staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms, quiet location, friendly staff, overpriced amenities”
Reviews.Author: mrducky108
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel through priceline at a great rate. Check-in was smooth and friendly and Ryan put us in a great deluxe king corner room overlooking the park. Everything about the room was high quality â€“ from the marble bathrooms and entrance hall to the heavy wood doors. The nightstand had switches for the entrance hall lights, headboard mood lights, and also a small reading light for night time. The lounge chair at the foot of the bed was a nice touch. The room size was decent, but the bathroom was VERY roomy with a tub and separate glass shower stall. Overall a great contemporary style room. The hotel is located in a quiet area and really becomes a ghost town at night (although there is some noise from the fire station across the street). The hotel is a 10 minute walk or a short subway ride from central part of the city and parks (subway station is a block away). We loved the location because it was nice to get away from the busy city center and take a walk up the quiet waterfront. The concierge service was good with recommendations and directions. The gym was nice and clean and had a decent amount of free weights and machines â€“ definitely enough to hold over a gym rat. Cons: nickel and diming. It's almost comical what these 4* and 5* hotels get away with when they know people are paying on the company dime. $15/day for internet access? Not having free wi-fi is a real inconvenience when you are in a new city. This won't change until people start refusing to pay these outrageous prices. Like all other high-end hotels the room service and mini-bar are also comically overpriced. $30 for some bacon, eggs, toast, and coffee. The mini-bar is computerized so be careful not to remove anything or you will be charged. They only leave a very small space in the refrigerator (about the size of 4 cans of coke) for personal use â€“ definitely not enough to hold dinner leftovers. It's great using priceline to get a beautiful room for less than half of the listed price, but it certainly comes at a cost of these over-priced amenities. For a similar price you could probably stay at a 3* hotel with free internet and complimentary breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “rude front desk soured whole stay”
Reviews.Author: ScoobyandShaggy
Reviews.Content: We arrived earlier than check in on the Friday of 4th of July weekend. I wanted to let the desk know that we were in town, and store our luggage for a few hours. The person at the desk had trouble looking up my reservation and went into the back office to "check" on it for at least a half hour. I had time to use the ladies room and upon returning, they still were not back at the desk. I had to ask another person to find out what was going on. They then informed me that the reservation had been cancelled out of the system. I could not understand this since I called two days earlier and verified the reservation with the hotel directly. It was clearly a computer glitch but they gave me a hard time about rebooking even going so far as to say that the hotel was almost full due to the holiday weekend. They made me call my travel agent direct, not even offerign a phone for me to use. ( My cell phone was in the rental car) My travel agent could not understand what had gone wrong and recommended I check in as normal. I felt like I had to beg for a room - they never offered to try to do their best to rectify the situation. I finally got a room, right above the conference center where a wedding reception was held - think loud band - until 1 a.m. The room was not what I had booked - two doubles, not 1 king. All in all the service was rotten, the room was rotten and I really was made to feel that they were doing me a big favor. Nice first impression of Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cristy611
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the perfect location, check in was great we got there at 11am and were given a room right away even though check in wasn't till 3pm. Rooms were very clean, bathrooms were very spacious and clean. Everyone was super nice and helpful. We really had a wonderful experience at this hotel. I would definitely recommend it to anyone visiting Boston, if i ever visit Boston again i will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice experience”
Reviews.Author: NYCandworld
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this Hotel labor day weekend. Our experience was great. The room on the top floor was very nice. The setup of the bathroom with the passthrough to the sleep area is a bit stranger, but it was ok. The bed was very comfortable. The public areas are very nice. Service was good - though the hotel did seem short staffed at time and could have used more bellhops and another person at the front desk. Overall - a very nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “What can I say!!!”
Reviews.Author: michbren
Reviews.Content: Our three night stay at the IC Boston was perfect from start to finish! The hotel is in a great, convenient location. Our 11th floor room was beautiful with a spectacular water view. Housekeeping did an outstanding job twice a day!! The staff was always friendly and accomodating. We had a early return flight and asked at the bell desk the day before about cab availability early in the morning. He said he would take care of it and sure enough when we came down at 5am our cab was waiting. The Rumba bar was fun with lots of people. We had breakfast at Miel two mornings and it was very enjoyable with many choices. My only criticism was Miel for dinner. The service was rather poor and the food mediocre. It is obvious others feel the same way as it was a Saturday night and very few tables were occupied. Intercontinental Hotels are one of our favorites and we have very high expectations. IC Boston exceeded them. Thank you everyone at IC Boston for such a memorable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel - never again..”
Reviews.Author: Popehead
Reviews.Content: What an over-rated hotel! Paid extra for a Seaview room, got an Office block view instead! They wouldnt budge when I questioned them. The 3 nights we stayed there, the staff gave us the feeling that they didnt want to be there and totally disinterested in our stay. The boarded on the rude... The bar area is full on Boston wanabees and the staff seem to favour the locals than the paying room customers. Rooms are very overpriced, bar is overpriced. The even charge you $7 to print a boarding pass for a flight. The customer is always wrong in the Boston Intercontinental... Well this customer aint never going back...

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay !”
Reviews.Author: kir1970
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic stay at the Intercontinental , our room was huge with fabulous floor to ceiling windows & plenty of space . Its a short walk to the subway we went to the JFK library & also used the subway to get back to the airport - it was $2 each. You can get on the trolley bus there as well its on their route , the tours are good value & ideal to hop on & off . We loved the whale watching tour - the 3 hour one - get wrapped up it can be a bit breezy. We walked to Quincy Market everyday , nice atmosphere to browse around . Ladies go to Coach , Danielle & her staff are lovely and more than helpful !

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend deal”
Reviews.Author: calliehope
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean and upscale, but not overly so. The room layout is a little weird, with a window from the bed wall to the bathroom, but we knew that in advance. The location was perfect for access to the T, the aquarium, and Quincy Market. The financial district is a little empty on the weekends, so there wasn't a lot of activity, but with the deal we got it was worth it! Only negative was that there is no in-room coffee maker!

Reviews.Title: “Overall, excellent...”
Reviews.Author: sakigemcam
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference.. The location is terrific, scenery wise - one side on the water, the other on the new Rose Kennedy Greenway. Rooms are beautiful, clean, bathrooms are oh-so-luxurious. VERY quiet - I never heard anything from surrounding rooms or hallway, and the hotel was sold out. A few blocks away, you have the smarmy shopping of Downtown Crossing, and in another direction, the touristy shopping at Fanieul Hall. A few T stops away is the best shopping in the Back Bay. Immediately surrounding the hotel is nothing, really, other than offices, but Downtown Crossing is indeed just a short walk. Across the waterway is the Children's Museum, making it convenient for visitors to that attraction, and the Tea Party boat is nearby as well. Water taxi service comes right to the hotel. I would gripe about the valet parking - you arrive in valet style, they take your car from you - but then to retrieve your car you have to schlep your luggage to a different level and stand in a stuffy smelly garage to retrieve it yourself. I found this a)confusing b)not worth the 37$ for valet parking - at least bring me my car! Also if you log into wifi in your room (14.95/day) it is not the same log in or fee as if you want to access it from public spaces in the hotel. Our conference had no conference code for free wifi, so if we needed to do email and such it was only available in the room. On site sushi restaurant was okay - limited menu and distracting lighting at night. Outside seating area is just beautiful - take advantage of it if you can. The gym was excellent as well, and underpopulated when I was there. I hate indoor pools but this one was so lovely I wish I had brought my swimwear! Service staff and conference food were excellent as well.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, reception staff very indifferent”
Reviews.Author: ColumnsCoventGarden
Reviews.Content: Great location, fabulous room/view, spotless, my big concern was that we had flown in from London, arrived at the hotel at 4.00pm having been travelling for 15 hours to be told that our room was not ready, so could we come back in 45 minutes, which we did. On our return we were again told that our room would not be ready for a further 45 minutes, that would be around 6.00pm US time. We were tired, a little fed up etc. but all the reception said was that the people in our designated room had booked a late check out!! amazing!, when they eventually found us a similar room, (although I will never know how similar as we had booked a suite), they made no attempt to apologise for the inconvenience caused.

Reviews.Title: “We are already planning our return trip to Boston and will definitely stay at the Intercontinental again!”
Reviews.Author: MrsSDG
Reviews.Content: The Intercontinental helped make our week in Boston even more enjoyable. It is conveniently located close to South Station if you want to take advantage of the city's fantastic public transportation system. Or, it's an easy walk to many of the popular destinations around town. The rooms are beautifully decorated and very comfortable. The staff couldn't have been nicer or more helpful. As two females traveling alone, safety is always an issue for us, we felt safe and secure at all times in and around the hotel. We are already planning our return trip to Boston and will definitely stay at the Intercontinental again!

Reviews.Title: “Still no word.....”
Reviews.Author: norollie
Reviews.Content: My family and I were staying at the hotel for three nights. We had three rooms when the electrical fire occured on the 20th August 2010. We were awoken at 2 am and vacated the building. The next seven and a half hours were aweful. After an hour and a half we were herded into the ballroom of the Harbour Hotel where there was nowhere to sit or sleep. We finally were allowed back into the Intercontinental at 9.30am! We received no information from a single member of Intercontinental staff the entire night! Even a fellow guest at the hotel who worked at the Intercontinental in Montreal was 'appalled' by the level of customer service from the company. In response to the posts of the hotel management on trip advisor, it is all words and no action. The Boston Intercontinental Hotel management wrote on Trip advisor that 'In addition to comping the room and tax for each reservation for that night, we are in the process of personally calling each guest whose room reservation was affected by the evacuation. ' Well I paid for three rooms that were affected that night and I have not had a single call from the hotel, I am still waiting eagerly. Considering they were not willing to compensate me for the room when I checked out, it will be interesting to see if they will now, after all the negative news coverage they have had in the aweful handling of this situation. I hope they have reviewed their plans for handling emergencies and have more senior managers on duty. Moreover I see the management claims their staff was busy cooperating with the Boston Fire Department hence why they did not speak to guests but even the Fire Dept and Police Dept had the good sense to keep guests informed and looked after. Thumbs up to the emergency services. Two thumbs down for Intercontinental!

Reviews.Title: “Unique Building in a great location”
Reviews.Author: liz160764
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights in the IC and thought it was perfectly located for a short stay in the city. Its 2 minutes from South Station and under 10 minutes to Long Wharf. The building is amazing! The windows were being cleaned when we arrived and looked like lots of 'spidermen' were doing a great job. The bed was extra comfy, a blissful nights' sleep! The air con was especially welcoming a it was 94 degrees and humid. There were fabulous Chris Williams bronze sculptures situated in and around the hotel. All in all a great hotel in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary, Clean, City Hotel”
Reviews.Author: StickerShock
Reviews.Content: There was very little not to like about the InterContinental Hotel in Boston. It's an imposing new glass structure on the border of the seaport and business districts. It has an entrance on the busy Atlantic Avenue just a few shirt blocks away from South Station, and in partial view of the harbor and channel. The rear entrance is directly on the channel, with beautiful views of the water, federal court house, and children's museum. On the rear patio, there are relaxing places to sit with music and a outdoor bar. The hotel's interior design is contemporary and bright, not stuffy or gawdy. The registration desk could've used a third person, but the line still moved quickly. Bell hops were very helpful. We valed-parked the car at the hotel entrance. To retrieve the car, it was necessary to take a separate elevator to the underground garage and office, which was a little strange, but not that inconvenient. Parking was expensive, but not terrible compared to city hotels. The hotel common spaces were extremely clean and comfortable, as were the banquet areas. Hotel staff, including security guards, managers, bell hops, and room service attendants were all very pleasant. The rooms were a decent size. We had a view of the building under construction next door, as well as a sliver of the channel and Atlantic Avenue. In a nice twist, the bathroom is about as big as the rest of the room. There is a full glass shower, as well as a tub. Very spacious. One interesting feature is a window between the bathroom and the rest of the room. It can be slid closed, but light can shine through at night if someone is in the bathroom. Not a big deal. the room had a huge flat screen tv, plenty of drawers and closet space, a desk, and several chairs. It was a very comfortable, beautiful room. The mattress was not as comfy as I would've expected, but the pillows were nice. I think the best elements of this hotel are its proximity to South Station, the business district, and Quincy Market/North End; its contemporary design and appeal; and its cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ew321
Reviews.Content: Booked this through Priceline -- got a great rate. Excellent hotel -- clean and beautifully decorated. Was thrilled with our stay. Parking is $40 a day. One bad thing was you had to pay for internet service. Concierge staff were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: SavvyMacPac
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Intercontinental in Boston. My children really enjoyed being able to take the water taxi straight to the hotel dock and being able to go swimming everyday at the indoor pool. We ended up staying at the Fairmont Battery Wharf (another great hotel in Boston) for couple of days during our trip to Boston. Between the two hotels, we could definitely stay at the Intercontinental over the Fairmont Battery Wharf.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place.”
Reviews.Author: StunningKT
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Intercontinental several times and with the exception of few minor incidences our stay has always been very pleasant. The rooms are nice and especially for families with small kids, it is good to ask for a room with a fire station view. The kids really love it. The bar on the courtyard is nice for some drinks (depending on the heat) whatever time of the day and the restaurant is not bad and has nice children's menu also. The health club and pool are really nice and clean. I have had one bad experience at the healthclub, however. During one of our stay, my wife was told our kids (3 and 5 year-old boys) could not shower after the pool in the ladies locker room. They all ended up coming up in the elevator in their wet bathing suits. I even called the health club supervisor, but this is apparently the policy at this hotel. I do not get it and it put a bit of bad spin on our most recent stay. Otherwise, we have been happy with this hotel everytime.

Reviews.Title: “Intercontinental Boston Fails Emergency Preparedness”
Reviews.Author: anna685
Reviews.Content: If hotel preparedness is important when you book a hotel, Intercontinental Boston flunked anyone's test on August 21, 2010. An electrical fire releasing toxic fumes led to emergency evacuation at 2:00am. From 2:00 to 4:30am, 800-1000 Intercontinental guests stood outside, many barefoot in bathrobes. The hotel was surrounded by Boston firefighters and police. At 4:30am, guests were sent to Boston Harbor Hotel, where its courteous 3rd shift staff provided sheets, bottled water and breakfast. Intercontinental Boston staff were completely absent from the scene until 9:20am, 7 1/2 hours after the fire. Shame on Intercontinental Boston! Bravo for humanitarianism to the Boston Harbor Hotel and its 3rd shift staff!!!

Reviews.Title: “Still waiting to see how Hotel Management responds”
Reviews.Author: SBScott
Reviews.Content: Myself, my wife and 2 small children were staying at the Intercontinental Boston on the night of the fire evacuation (Friday night 8/20). We were awakened by alarms and evacuated at 2 a.m. After spending about 1 1/2 hours in front of the hotel, we got word that there was and electrical fire and it would be some time before we would get back into the hotel. Acting quickly, we were one of the "lucky" ones...for $300, we got one of the few rooms left at the nearby Boston Harbor Hotel. My wife, daughter and son slept in one bed (only single bed rooms were left) while I slept on the floor. Many of the other displaced guests slept on the floor of the Boston Harbor Hotel Ballrooom. I have read that the Intercontinental is offering to comp its guests for the Firday night charges. I am anxious to see how management addresses the $300 I ended up paying to stay somewhere other than on the grass in front of the hotel or on the floor of the Boston Harbor Hotel Ballroom with 500 or so other people. Hoping to see outstanding and sensible customer service .

Reviews.Title: “Good location but not great”
Reviews.Author: kcarrow
Reviews.Content: Although it sits on the Harbor, it is still about a 10 minute walk to the aquarium, Long Wharf, and Quincy Market, and subway. This hotel is best suited for business travelers who need to be in this area. If you are a tourist, I would recommend the Marriott Long Wharf in Boston as it is right in the middle of many attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms”
Reviews.Author: mlsimp2
Reviews.Content: Some of the other reviews mention not liking the unique feel of the room with the sliding door into the bathroom. I liked it because it makes the room seem larger. I only stayed for one night but I thought the room was one of the best I've stayed in. We had a dinner in the private dining room that was outstanding. Overall it was a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place with great service”
Reviews.Author: Markar1948
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here about 6 times. We live 2 hours away by car and love to take long weekends to enjoying Boston. In fact we joined the Ambassador Club for $150 to receive a room upgrade and 4PM checkout each stay (Other benefits also) . This is the sort of place where you like stay around the room, and enjoy a drink while looking out the window at the outside. The health club spa is ok, a bit limited for equipment but the basic stuff is fine. The spa has a great Steam room that they don't charge extra to use. The staff is outstanding and really want you to be pleased. Much better restaurants in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Unusable, and they don't care.”
Reviews.Author: Not_so_hip
Reviews.Content: There was a fire at 2AM, all guests evacuated and told to try to get a room somewhere else. We did by about 5AM. Have no idea when it opened up again, but it wasn't that soon because they were starting to evacuate people from the residence at 5. Set our alarm to called back at 10:15AM - still groggy to find out what to do next. Asked if we could have any extra time to collect our stuff because we wanted to sleep and we were some distance away. We asked if they could at least comp parking when we come to pick up our stuff (after we had to pay for a taxi and our lodging elsewhere, in addition to the night we paid for at IC) They said no. No guests will be receiving any complimentary anything. OK, bad stuff happens. But character shows in how they deal with it. They dealt with it by saying Ha ha ha, we get your money and you get nothing and now have to spend more money, sucker. So, 1-star for the service, obviously. 1-star for the value-obviously. 1-star for the room (a room you can't sleep in has no quality), and 1 star for sleep quality.

Reviews.Title: “Not trying as hard as they should ne”
Reviews.Author: kmh2301
Reviews.Content: This is one of the more expensive hotels in Boston and I'm not sure why they feel they should be able to fetch these rates. We called a few times and requested early check in because of reservations we needed to make that afternoon. Well not only did we not have early check in, we also did not have "on time" check in. We waited more than an hour for the room to be prepared. The room was fine, but nothing spectacular, I know some of the rooms have great views, ours was of a construction site. We also didn't have nearly enough outlets to do what we needed and the beds were rather small. Certainly better suited for solo sleepers. Parking is $39 and "valet only" so you can't park your own car, or have access to it later without getting your key from someone. My favorite part of this experience was watching the valet attendant buff scrapes out of a very expensive Mercedes that he had OBVIOSLY caused. Bet they never mentioned that upon collecting the $39. Overall there are better options in Boston, I'll be choosing one of those next time around.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel”
Reviews.Author: bigbadbruins
Reviews.Content: I have nothing bad to say about this place. Evertything was great. Got a good rate on Hotwire. We got there early, the room wasn't ready. They took our bags and called us 90 minutes later to let us know the room was now ready. I have to agree with some of the earlier comments, the sliding window between the bathroom and the bed is a little weird. The room was very comfortable and quiet... no problem with outside noise. the staff was very helpful. the pool area and gym were nice. with a great view... the parking was a little pricey (39$), but I stayed a couple of times at the Boston Harbor Hotel and the parking there is a lot more expensive. if you don't want to pay that much to park, just leave your car at the wellington station parking (5.50/day) and take the T to your hotel... I wouldn't pay 400$ a night for the Intercontinental, but I don't think I would pay that much for any hotel in boston. so if you get a good rate, don't hesitate, this place is great !!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: JL5
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Intercontinental for one night in August during a business trip. The staff was extremely helpful and attentive and the rooms were clean and spacious. The hotel is in a good location, especially if you are there for business in the financial district. It is a little far from tourist spots such as Newbury Street and the public gardens. However, the hotel is directly on the water and the new greenway in Boston. The rooms are a little pricey though. I had breakfast at Miel. The food was not great (I had an omelette) but the outside patio is beautiful. Also, I ordered room service one night and the food was suprisingly good. I would recommend this hotel to a friend and would return if in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury!”
Reviews.Author: lovelyladykin
Reviews.Content: We wanted a nice place to stay while in Boston for our anniversary. The plan was to spend Saturday in the city, then take the fast ferry over to Provincetown on Sunday. The Intercontinental was absolutely perfect. From the moment we stepped through the door, I could tell we had made the right choice. The rooms were absolutely the best appointed I have ever seen. There was even an umbrella in the closet should a visitor encounter inclement weather. The place was sparkling clean, although you do need to request housekeeping. We were just there for one day, so we did not miss this. I rather liked that there was not the steady stream of housekeeping people shuffling through the hallways. There was a quietness about the place I found soothing. Proximity to the waterfront was a key factor in our selection, and it is perfect for those wishing to visit the Acquarium, Childrens Museum, or board a ferry. All in all, worth the price!

Reviews.Title: “Love it!”
Reviews.Author: PTcruiser816
Reviews.Content: This hotel was amazing. We paid extra for a room with a view and it was 100% worth it. Our room was huge with a great bathroom and bed. The staff was super friendly and the hotel bar had a pretty good crowd. The hotel is perfect if you want to spend some quality time in the north end and is near to several T stops. We would love to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: radikalle
Reviews.Content: We checked in early (10 oÂ´clock) and visited Boston. In the evening we were at the Hotel bar (great bar!) and we used the comfortable spa zone. If it would not be so expensive we would come back. Rooms are very clean and the bathroom is very nice. In sum it is a very lovely and elegant Hotel and if the company is paying the room it is definitely a really good choice. You can take from near the hotel the T to explore Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Traveling-Roo
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Hotwire and got an excellent price! I was in a corner room with windows on two sides and had a city view. The bed was extremely comfortable and the bathroom was quite large with a shower stall AND tub. I got room service for breakfast one morning and they showed up on time when I requested it and were very courteous. It was a little on the pricey side for breakfast but anyone could assume that since it was the InterContinental! I went to the SPA for a pedicure and had great service. The mani/pedi room was located close to the fitness center and I could hear people working out, which is not ideal but I didn't find it too disturbing or disrupting. The location of this hotel is excellent! I was within walking distance of several historic sights and there were great food choices all around. I asked the concierge for a dinner recommendation based on what I was in the mood for and he sent me to exactly what I was looking for - very knowledgable staff! Overall, I could not have been any happier with my stay!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay, good hotel and good location”
Reviews.Author: allan38
Reviews.Content: We had a great 4 days in Boston. Nice, modern hotel with good facilities. We enjoyed the pool/gym most days. The hotel bars/restaurants are good but charge city hotel prices. There are loads of Starbucks/Cosi at hand for breakfast. The restaurants the hotel recommends on their freebie map are good also. The room (2 double beds) was well presented and was a good size. Location wise you are close to most things: Fanueil Hall/Quincy Market, Long Wharf, Aquarium etc. The subway is 5 mins walk. Overall, no real complaint and I would stay here again. Got a great rate on Hotwire too. A few minor niggles: The room wasn't ready when we checked-in at 2pm. We were told they would call us when ready but they didn't. No problem as we were already enjoying the Boston sights. At check-in we requested a roll-away bed but were told we couldn't have more than 2 beds in the room due to MA fire regulations. When we asked again later (once the room was available) we were told no problem and the bed was delivered immediately. No free wifi access, not even in the lobby

Reviews.Title: “Great business hotel....one of the nicest city hotel rooms I've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: CruelFox
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel. It's sylish and classy. The bedroom I stayed in was huge. The bathroom was great. My company paid for me to stay here, and therefore I cannot comment on price. But the breakfast was very expensive. Good location for the business district, and for places like Fanueil Hall and the various pubs and clubs in that area. Try and get a room facing the harbour though, as the noise from the fire engines on the other side of the hotel may keep you awake during the night.

Reviews.Title: “Intercontinental Boston - They need a new staff and room designer”
Reviews.Author: dgreekva
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot, for my job and vacations. This is the first time I've been motivated enough to write a review. Since I know hotel chains don't put much stock in occasional writers, I also posted this on Hotels.com. You should read on, you owe it to yourself. The hotel is new, looks nice for a modern style hotel. Very pretty lobby, nicely decorated common area and restaurants. Too bad the hotel staff didn't know they were in customer service. I paid extra for a "Harbor View" and got a tar paper rooftop view. When I tried to call the front desk a switchboard answered. I asked for the front desk, was told sure, just a minute and then I had to listen to a conversation about an iPod, people's choice in music, etc. I finally interrupted the conversation and asked again about speaking to the front desk. A quick transfer and I was talking to the Spa services. Nice... They transferred me to the front desk (the number wasn't in the room or on the phone to call direct to the front desk like most hotels do). A very rude front desk person explained that just past the roof was the water so technically I had a water view room, so no, there wasn't any other rooms available, I had what I was supposed to have! The room itself was terrible. It was designed with an opening in the wall, between the bathroom and the bedroom, right above the headboard of the bed. The opening had sliding panels with opaque panels, and it didn't completely close off the space. The opening was in direct alignment with the room outside wall windows. I guess someone wanted to be able to watch the roof while seated in the bathroom. The bed was worse than sleeping on granite, and all we could do was think back one week to being at the Fairmont on Battery Wharf. They were fantastic, great customer service. I'll be posting that review on this web site too. As for the Intercontinental, well, I'll be telling my corporate travel about them and everyone I know not to consider this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy Hotel in a Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: JohnnyM_Canada
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful new luxury hotel in an excellent location in downtown Boston. Room was very large and modern, with an elegant and spacious bathroom. Bed was very comfortable and furniture was all very high-end. Service was wonderful and extremely courteous, however we found some of the concierges' recommendations to be somewhat biased towards select restaurants. In fact, some of our own finds turned out to be much better than the hotel's suggestions (we discovered Flour Bakery for breakfast/lunch and had an amazing dining experience at Toro one night). The hotel's own restaurants and bars were very lively and quite good, both in terms of the food quality and the bar scene. This hotel's location was very central and ideal for walking around and discovering the city, and it acted as an excellent base to start our day. Would absolutely stay here again for our next visit to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice five star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wattaworld
Reviews.Content: Got a great rate on Hotwire of $185 a night in this five star beauty. Impressive staff from doormen to receptionist and they gave us great tips on where to go and what to see in Boston. Rooms were very nice, view was also good and the beds were very comfortable, affording a good night's sleep. Boston was lovely and it was good seeing places as varied as Paul Revere's haunts through to the Cheers Bar near Boston Common. Boston is historic and wonderful and needs time to see it properly.

Reviews.Title: “Nicest in the Bean”
Reviews.Author: Redsox1988
Reviews.Content: Beautiful Lobby, EXCELLENT Young man at the desk (Ryan?) seemed to always be there weather it was Noon, Midnight or in the Middle, excellent rep for your company and shows what true hospitality is. Nice modern rooms but the best part the unique spa inspired bathroom, Free Globe on the weekend and nice waterfront dining will be back for sure, only this to be aware of as with all high end hotel you have to pay for wireless.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, Large and elegant room”
Reviews.Author: GMSB
Reviews.Content: I had a great experience -- no problems with booking/reservation, noise. The bedroom was extremely large with all possible amenities. Very elegant as I have found the Intercontinental to be also in other locations I've been to.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly good”
Reviews.Author: auvoir
Reviews.Content: Arrived on the 4th of July. Found the room to be exceptionally large and the bathroom very spacious. Liked the separate tub and shower and the big vanity top. A weird fan in the bathroom runs constantly and sounds like a small hive of bees. The desk informed us that all the rooms had that. Housekeeping is not consistant. One day there will be no washclothes, the next there's a stack of them. Same with the small bottles of shampoo, etc. Conceriege desk not always as well informed as they should be, but all the staff is well trained and very friendly. The main thing going for the hotel is the wonderful room. Location is fine, too. A rather short walk to Faniel Hall and very close to the South Station for longer jaunts.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but needs fine tuning”
Reviews.Author: SwissAir100
Reviews.Content: Overall, this was a nice hotel...Modern features, nice bathroom, great lobby area, nice waterfront walk at back, with access to water taxi ramp. It is within walking distance to Quincy Market, Harbour area, and North End (& even Back Bay) Main issue we had : Booked 2 rooms, with a request for early check in (knowing that they can not guarantee of course). We checked in @ 1 pm, and thankfully, one of the rooms (deluxe city view) was available. However, the man who checked us in said he DOES NOT know when our 2nd rm would be ready (waterfront), but we gave him our phone no. I also did remind him that 3 pm is their listed & official "Check In" time, to which he did not respond. By 3:45 pm, we still had not heard from the front desk, & made inquiries at the front desk. By this time, the man from earlier was no longer at the front desk, and the woman we spoke to told us that our room would be ready "soon". So we decided to hang around and wait. By 4:30 pm, still no call, & inquired again. This time, they said the room was ready, but "had to be given a final check through"...FINALLY, at 4:45 pm, we got our room. The main problem we had here was that considering we checked in @ 1 pm, they would put their housekeeping on notice that the customer is already here, and ensure extra effort was given to make sure that our room would be ready by the official 3 pm time (or at least close to it) We felt that had we not been proactive & still exercised some degree of patience, we would not have gotten a call for our rooms until maybe even 6 pm !...We felt this was unacceptable for a luxury hotel, and greater steps should have been taken by front desk & housekeeping to ensure that their customers do not experience any unnecessary delays. Otherwise, don't advertise your check-in time as 3 pm ! For an InterContinental, we expect more. (On our last night, we & other guests on our floor were awoken @ 1:30 am, by a constant barrage of knocking, yelling & loud noises from the room next door who decided to throw a party. After 30 mins., we & others decided to call the hotel. It was so loud that the operator could hear the yelling on the phone, & some guests down the hall had to physically ask them to quiet down - to which one of the older guests simply responded, "Well...we just had a wedding ..." (Jeeez...) Security was up in their room within a few minutes, which we appreciated. However, these moronic guests did not disperse for another 40 mins or so. There must have been @ 30-40 people there at one time. We felt that security should have ensured that ALL these guests dispersed immediately, but left after giving them the warning to stop. These events left us with a not so favorable experience.)

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: pezza40
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Intercontinental Boston with our 13 month old son. We had a very large king size room which was more than big enough to fit in the travel cot and still have room to walk around in. Nicely furnished with flat screen TV and lots of cable channels. The hotel is very conveniently located on the harbour near the aquarium and within walking distance to Quincy Market and a 3 min walk from South Station. The gym and pool facilities were very nice, the pool was a little cold but my 13 month old didn't seem to mind this. The spa looked nice but we didn't get the opputunity to have any treatments. There are a couple of restaurants in the hotel but it was pricey, as you expect with a big chain hotel. Breakfast was nice and highchairs provided, but v pricey. I would recommend the small diner just across the street (straight across from the hotel on the street next to the left of the fire station) which did a great breakfast for a fraction of the price - the firemen and local businessmen all used it! Although no highchairs and counter service only. We booked the hotel through Hotwire and got a very good deal on the price - worth a look.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: mada90
Reviews.Content: My friends and I arrived on a friday night and paid for valet parking (39.00) and when we got into the lobby our luggage was left unattended. We were told we had a " city view" when we opened the curtain; we were facing a brick wall! The beds were hard as rocks! When we were checking out we had to take carry our own luggage down to the garage and wait for our car. Definitely not worth the $150.00 plus a night.

Reviews.Title: “Will return”
Reviews.Author: FNFanatic
Reviews.Content: I was very apprehensive about this hotel due to the reviews on Trip Advisor. I booked it on a whim through Hotwire (nonrefundable, nonexchangeable, non-everything) because the hotel we had our eye on (Seaport) was fully booked. It just so happened that after I booked the Intercontinental, the Lenox (#1 on Trip Advisor) knocked their prices down to the same as we had paid. I was extremely disappointed, but there was nothing to be done and our trip was more about us than the hotel we were to stay in. That being said - this hotel was wonderful. Check-in was a breeze...we arrived at around noon and knew we wouldn't get our room right away, but the front desk staff was kind enough to get the paperwork over with so we could just grab the keys when we came back from the Quincy Market (she also took down my cell number in case the room was ready ahead of time). They kept our bags in a secure room in the front lobby while we went to have lunch. We went to Quincy, had lunch, did some shopping and came back to a lovely room awaiting our arrival. We grabbed the keys, and went upstairs to settle in. We had just enough time to take a look around the room before our bags were delivered up to us. Here is one issue I had: they called the room a "waterview". It was not a waterview, and I knew from earlier reviews that their idea of a waterview was not concurrent with the customers' idea. However, we did not pay extra for a waterview and were not expecting it. We did not bother to order extra towels, as there were three already in the room each morning. I loved the Keurig coffee machine as I have the same one at home and I ended up needing a coffee 2-3 times during our stay to keep from tiring too much. Every feature of our room was lovely. The concierge was extremely helpful in directing us where to shop for my boyfriend's new shoes, and also where to go for dinner at night. If you're looking for a bar, i wouldn't recommend the one in the hotel as it's extremely expensive. After our two ordinary drinks (no premium liquor requested) turned out to be $30USD, we decided to search out a bar a couple blocks away. However, we know that hotel restaurants and bars are always pricier for their convenience than other places and there was a big crowd of people there (I assumed the business crowd after work in the area) around happy hour. The back area of the hotel was very nice and right on the water. We had drinks there both nights and enjoyed an incredible, panoramic view of the harbour. Checking out was just as easy - we had no extra charges to our room, so we were out hassle-free. The only other issue I had with this hotel was the extra charge for internet service. I brought my netbook with me knowing that the charge for internet was $15 per night, but I thought there would be places around the hotel where I could get WiFi. This wasn't that easy to find. The only times I was able to get free internet was in Harvard Square at the Starbucks and at the Museum of Science. We only had to check the internet for a few minutes once a day, so I was not about to pay $15 for those 5 minutes of internet use. Please provide free internet access in the future, as this is considered common by most customers staying at 4 to 5-star hotels. I would also like to say that there was nothing wrong with the location. There were ample fabulous restaurants in the area and shopping quite close as well. We felt no need to take the subway to any of these places and enjoyed the walks to and from. The area was very safe and not at all noisy at night, and we enjoyed the breeze from the harbour. TRY THE BARKING CRAB ACROSS THE BRIDGE. And Flour Bakery (Bobby Flay recommended for the Sticky Buns in "The Best Thing I Ever Ate") for breakfast - also just across the bridge. Overall, a beautiful stay and would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, excellent, excellent”
Reviews.Author: InaF
Reviews.Content: I was more than pleased to stay at this hotel and I cannot deny the fact that one of the reasons was the room itself. I was accommodated in a suite, which was above any expectations. The suite contained one living room, bedroom, two bathrooms, two hall, dinning area, two wardrobes, amazing waterfront views. I have seen airplanes smaller than this suite and I am still amazed of my luck. The room was spotless and so was the rest of the hotel. I did spend a lot of time in the indoor swimming pool, watching people exercising on the trade mills. I received freshly fruits and water every day, coffee and tea facilities were in the room, mini bar drinks were free and on arrival, free drinks in the bar and a bottle of wine and a cake in the suite. I have to say that my jetlag disappeared within seconds after entering the room.

Reviews.Title: “But the restaurant”
Reviews.Author: jasoncamille
Reviews.Content: I stayed there a couple days at this hotel, great building, nice location, you can see the job that the housekeeping department is doing, great with the room maintenance, you feel great with that kind of services. All was good until we went to the restaurant, the FRENCH menu, is not that great, our waiter was good but the management team or supervisors don't act so friendly, who are they ? do they own the place ? or is a chain of restaurants running the operations ? I did not find the answer but this place should have a better restaurant or a better management team. I will be back but I will no eat there. Thnaks

Reviews.Title: “Overall very good place”
Reviews.Author: alexshulman
Reviews.Content: Just returned from weekend in Boston. Overall IC is great hotel, very cool looking modern in and out. Very clean, superb spa and pool area. We were in room 801 DIRECT waterfront view pretty nice.Excellent shower, bathroom with upscale toiletries. Pretty good sushi/tequila bar in the lobby. Very nice parking underneath hotel/40 USD per 24/. Major minus typical inpersonal huge hotel with very busy lobby. Not worth 500 USD per night but we received non refundable promotion for about 250 USD which is a great price for this level of hotel. Overall solid 4 stars. Alex

Reviews.Title: “Lovely room, helpful concierge, awful business center”
Reviews.Author: KristinaR007
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 5 nights for a conference. The rate was good. As other reviewers have noted, the hotel is in the financial district and you've got to walk a few blocks for water, snacks, etc. The room was really lovely and large Room service was speedy (with one exception), but pricey. Concierge was very helpful with directions and recommendations. The only time I didn't get good advice is when I needed to do the last-day-must-buy-souvenirs spree. Bellmen didn't seem prepared to handle the hundreds of us attending the same conference who all took cabs most of the time. Ended up hailing my own. This would have been a 4-star rating except for the business center, which was awful. It shares space with the gift shop. The woman I dealt with was far more interested in texting her pals and admiring her nails than helping me. Bizarrely, there is only ONE fax line for incoming faxes so it took the folks back in the office many tries to get a fax through. Unfortunately for me, the fax I needed the most was mislabeled by the business center so I got it 2 days late. I would stay here again for leisure, but definitely NOT for business.

Reviews.Title: “5 star room, good access to "T",”
Reviews.Author: GeorgiaGary
Reviews.Content: Went as part of a 3 couples Boston tour. We'd never been to Boston and wanted to be in the Back Bay area, but couldn't get the deal we wanted for that popular area, even through Priceline. So we "settled" for the Intercontinental via Hotwire. The hotel is relatively new compared to most hotels in Boston, a result of the Big Dig that was completed several years ago. The hotel is plush, our room was modern and spacious and the king bed comfortable. The bathroom was roomy with a separate shower stall. We were treated fine at check-in, even though we booked our rooms through Hotwire. They attempted to put all 3 rooms near each other, ended up with 2 on the 11th floor and 1 on the 12th (top) floor, all facing the street. Noise was not a serious problem, even though the fire dept is across the street. Ok, the sliding glass between the bedroom and bathroom is not a good idea....even when shut, it lets light through in the middle of the night, and sounds through anytime. But it wasn't a deal buster, just a bit odd. Location: We took the water taxi ($10 each) from the airport right to the back of the hotel. The hotel is only 2 blocks / 5 minute walk from the South "T" Station. We all purchased 7 day T passes for $15 each, which we made good use of in our daily tourist adventures. Though if you're enegetic, you can walk to Faneuil Hall or Littel Italy. We walked home from Little Italy one evening, probably about 1 mile. What I'd recommend for tourists: -We did the Duck Tour on our first day. Lots of fun, the guide was hilarious. -"Freedom Trail Foundation" guided tour...departs from Boston Commons. This was my personal highlight of the trip. Cost was cheap ($13 adult). Our guide dressed in period costume, called himself "Nathaniel ???", was in character the entire 90+ minute walking trip, had a booming period speaking voice & great personality, and told stories that brought history to life. We enjoyed it so much, that we took his optional 90 minute tour departing from Faneuil Hall after a quick lunch break.... $7 for those that alreay paid the original $13. Note, you don't see the entire Freedom Trail on the guided tour. FOOD: -Scali's (147 Pearl St) - Right across the street. Authentic local place, good cheap breakfast, very popular with locals heading to work. -Tavern on the Water - On the Charlestown pier near the USS Constitution. Had lunch there. Good clam chowder. - Traittoria il Panino (11 Parmenter St) - There are unlimited Italian restaurants in the North End / Little Italy section. This unassuming restaurant was recommended by a local, and was wonderful. All 6 of us agreed this was our best meal in Boston. -Green Dragon Tavern (11 Marshall St) - Historic pub, good beer, had a great guitarist playing on Tuesday night.

Reviews.Title: “One star for service, three for the room, overall a solid 2.”
Reviews.Author: TravelMonkey29
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the IC Boston for two nights a Friday and Saturday. Overall the hotel is really quite nice, but the service stunk up the joint. I donâ€™t know the last time I felt that poorly treated by any hotel and they really need to get over themselves. I actually moved hotels for the rest of my stay up here. Service: The service was awful. The doormen were rude and unhelpful, I ended up hauling a roller bag, garment bag, laptop, and handbag up to my room alone with no luggage rack. Nobody ever helped me with the door either. I was so irritated by this. The desk was rude every time I called down. Seriously rude, acting like I was putting them out. Even when I called to order room service they acted like I needed them to move mountains. Also the wifi is pricey, something like $15 a day. It really seems like a rip off. Overall, with the number of great hotels in Boston, based on service alone, Iâ€™ll probably avoid this hotel in the future. Room: I had a Deluxe King Room with a waterview (#1007). View from the room was not that great. If I craned my neck the right way, I could see some water I think. Mostly I looked into the other wing of the hotel or down on a roof. All in all not much of an upgrade, but I guess it was quieter than a street view right? The room was very nice and well appointed, albeit on the smaller side. The arrangement of furniture was a bit awkward and the desk looked out the window which I am sure is ok and geared towards the business person who might be sitting there more. The bathroom was enormous, a little bit of a waste of space, but it was nice. The toiletries at this hotel are just ok. Towels and linens were very very soft and the bed was quite comfy. The lighting was well set up and convenient. The room had a safe, iron, mini-bar, and hair dryer. Food: I did order room service. It came to the room a little cold and was just ok. It was overpriced for what I got and I canâ€™t recommend it. On top of an 18% gratuity there is a $5 service charge. I have traveled and do travel quite a bit and usually donâ€™t see that anymore. It was another way I felt nickel and dimed here. There are a variety of bars and restaurants in and around the hotel though so you do have some options.

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located for business”
Reviews.Author: Albiani
Reviews.Content: Situated on the waterfront - near the financial district this is probably a better hotel for business travelers than leisure travel. For those familiar w/ the Intercontinental brand - you will find that this property maintains the same high quality standards. The property is luxurious with well appointed rooms and all the ammenities you would expect. This hotel is less than a 5-minute walk to Post Office Square and closest to the business district in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Solid choice for business traveller”
Reviews.Author: wellswells74
Reviews.Content: fine for pleasure also. Pros: Good size, clean rooms Near north End and Fanueil Hall Try to get water side of hotel, city side is fine (not loud), but water side views better Get a 6% rebate on the stay here http://www.mrrebates.com?refid=424037 Cons: if you want to be near high end shopping at Newbury then other hotels are better

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: haneymom
Reviews.Content: When I booked this room on a website at a great rate I was pretty excited. Upon check in there was some confusion in finding the reservation, but it all got worked out. When we got up to the room we found it to be very nice. My sister had brought her daughter with her so we needed a roll away. When we called the front desk we were told that the room was too small to accommodate our request. This could have ruined our trip! However, it was suggested that we upgrade to another room for a small fee. This was amazing! We were very comfy in the giant two room suite with a view of the water from the two huge windows in the bedroom. A plate of fresh fruit and a bottle of water were delivered to the room, and our vacation got off to a proper start. Thanks so much staff at the front desk, especially Alexandra, well done! Great drinks in the bar, central location, good housekeeping staff.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Letdown”
Reviews.Author: makitasuki
Reviews.Content: As we pulled up to the gleaming glass of the Intercontinental of Boston we were in awe. But that mood changed when the valet informed us of the $39 parking per day (drive up two block to post office square and it's $9 a day.) Once we got into our room we got a beautiful view of the roof, you would think checking in at 12pm would have given us a chance at a nice view. The swinging window from the bath is nice but a little akward at times with other people. The bed is the most uncomfortable bed we have ever slept in during a hotel stay, the pillows, well they should be brought out to the roof to be lit on fire as they are worse than the beds. We arrived Friday and never recieved room cleaning until Sun evening, so we had ran out of towels, wash cloths, cups, etc. Don't worry though you have a mini fridge, to bad it's stocked full of $5 snickers bars and $12 8oz bottles of grey goose not even allowing room to put stuff into the fridge due to this being fridge being computerized so don't even try to take anything out of it because you'll be charged. To top it all off we had to listen to a live band from a wedding reception until 1am on a Sunday night, great way to sleep when your trying to catch an early Monday morning flight. We've stayed at hotels one third the price and blow this one out of the water, it needs dumped into the Boston Harbor like the tea land it sits on as soon as possible to put it out of it's misery.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel in Walking Distance to many Boston attractions”
Reviews.Author: donnot
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a weekend in April, 2010 with my husband and for a weekend in May, 2009 with my sister and s-i-l for a "girls" weekend. Had a great time both times. Walking distance to Faneuil Hall and the North End, and South Station for the T to get all around the city. Beautiful, big, clean rooms and bathrooms; comfortable, fluffy beds; nice views; friendly and helpful staff; bar in lobby has a good vibe. Breakfast good but expensive in the restaurant. Pool nice, but a little cold; nice steam room; my sister says the massage was great. Booked on Hotwire both times (I think it's the only 4 1/2 star hotel with a pool in this area of Boston) and got a great rate for a first class hotel. Will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, expensive ammenities, not ideal location”
Reviews.Author: travelincritic
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice and we have no complaints regarding our room, the service or the hotel in general. It has a nice work out facility and a couple restaurants/ bars. The hotel is in the business/ financial district and even the Starbucks and Duncan Donuts are not open in the evening or weekends as it's just not busy there. Given that hotel food was terribly expensive, it made forging for food a little less convenient where there are otherwise restaurants, cafes, etc on every corner. In the future we would stay in a different area of town. Everything was certainly walkable from here, but only if you enjoy exercise. 15+ min walk to downtown crossing, 20+ to chinatown, 40 + to copley, 20+ to the north end. 5-10 to a T station, which is convenient. Also, room was sometimes too warm and temp could not be adapted to the level we would have liked.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice. Near South Station "T".”
Reviews.Author: Nick007FSU
Reviews.Content: I would recommend the "IC" Boston to anyone traveling for business, pleasure or both. Stayed three nights. The nicest thing about the hotel were the bathrooms and the outside overlooking the water.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: eam0132
Reviews.Content: 5 star hotel all the way. Great room, nice lounge, sushi bar. Great view of the river and walking distance to Faneuil Hall. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular”
Reviews.Author: ajimsojka
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. One of the best stays I have ever had in a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms and great location”
Reviews.Author: mark_mclaughlin
Reviews.Content: Rooms are a good size with a pleasantly different layout to most of the stock hotel rooms I've been in - including other InterContinentals - so you don't even feel all that hard done by even when the room has the less than glamourous view of the construction site next door. Service on check-in and check out was quick and always in a chirpy and genuinely friendly manner. Breakfast at the "Miel" Brasserie was Ã  la carte on the day I was there, and if you can get over the fact that a Provence themed restaurant feels thoroughly peculiar on a wet and windy day in the middle of a city, you'll be fine. If, as with my trip, your travel involves the Amtrak or Acela Express, the hotel is a few short minutes away from the South Station terminal - my primary reason for choosing here. Equally, it's only a matter of steps towards the New England Aquarium, Fanueil Hall and the rest of the financial district. Great experience all round, and bettered by the fact that the internet connection was superb as well, with enough bandwidth available to hold a decent quality Skype video call back home.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for accessing the T, Very odd bathroom setup”
Reviews.Author: valereee
Reviews.Content: I tagged along on a business trip of my husband's and chose the Intercontinental for its location, which is 2 blocks from South Station. This gave us easy access to pretty much the entire city via the T. The hotel is fine; very upscale, though our room (and I assume all rooms) had a sliding window between the bath and the bedroom that was extremely not soundproof. I've been married twenty years, but I'm still not quite ready for that much intimacy. It would be awkward to have anyone up to your room for a drink because of this. I literally did not hear ONE PEEP from anyone in nearby rooms; for soundproof walls, the HI gets a big thumbs up from me.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Let down with Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: bigmarklasVegas
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a 1 night stop over stay, The Hotel it self is good and comfortable, and have no complaints with that, Staff were good and helpful, when for asked for anything , but What we find disapointing is for this quality Hotel, We had to ask for more Towels, ( Only 1 set in Room ), The Quality of the Towels was poor, ( More like a 2 star Hotel) Soap and gels again poor, it 5 Star Hotels you do expect a full size bar of Soap !, We did not get the Fruit or Water, you get as Ambassor Members , There was no offer from Bell Boys to take our bags when we arrived, TV Movies had problems working although these are not major issues, when you pay big bucks to stay ou do expect the full Service, As with any top end Hotel, you must expect to pay top dollar for Internet, Parking, Minibar etc, which I dont mind as long you get top dollar service for it, which we did not on this stay .

Reviews.Title: “Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: dd237
Reviews.Content: Very helpful staff for planning your trip around Boston and the New England states. Very clean and near some great eating. Close to the Red line...very handy.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: BostonFans
Reviews.Content: First of all, I ended up at this hotel by booking through Hotwire. I just needed a decent room in the FInancial District since I was traveling to Boston for work for a few days. I originally booked for two days and then found out I had to go to Boston one day earlier than expected. I called the hotel to see if I could extend my stay by one day. Well, I was transferred three times before I got someone who could help me.
