She then told me that there's no way they could match the Hotwire rate but she could gladly give me a room (for twice the price) but it would have to be a room with 2 double beds since they don't give King beds to Hotwire customers and I might have to change rooms anyway because she could not guarantee anything I did through Hotwire. Definitely got the sense that I was being looked down upon because how I booked my room...hey it's not my fault your company chooses to sell rooms through Hotwire...nobody's forcing you to!! Anyway, I told her no thanks and I took a chance and booked another night on Hotwire and fortunately I got the same hotel again. When I arrived, everything was much better than I expected based on my phone conversation with the hotel. The valet guys were very efficient and brought us right over to the elevators. At the front desk, I told the guy that I actually had two reservations for three nights. He said "no problem", offered me a King room without me even asking, and said he would connect the two reservations so I wouldn't have to check out after the first day and I could keep the same room for all 3 nights. Very pleasant and very helpful. Nice surprise compared to the woman I talked to on the phone. The room was basic but very nice. Everything was clean, neat, fairly spacious, comfortable bed, and nice bathroom. I wish we had that bed and bathroom in my house! The concierge was also very helpful in how to get around and suggesting places for dinner. On the morning of checkout, I wanted to place my luggage in the car but then still leave it there while attending the last day of my conference. The bellhop called down to valet to have the car brought out so I could pack our stuff...I just asked for access to the car but he said they would bring it up for me. Then they re-parked it for me. Yes, it's $39 per day, but you'll pay that most places for 24-hour parking in Boston. Plus, you get a full 24-hour period for that price which isn't so with other garages. One peeve...should provide free wi-fi in this day and age in a hotel in the financial district for the prices they would charge if not booked on a discount site. Overall a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: jfhbryon
Reviews.Content: I was going to travel to NYC for my birthday last week before the blizzard. Last minute I decided to change to a couple day stay-cation. The hotel is beautiful and only a couple years old and located right on the waterfront. The service throughout the hotel was friendly and helpful. The rooms are beautifully laid out, bathroom and tub is huge, bed is comfortable and the lighting was perfect. There is a cool hotel bar, a couple good restaurants and even room service food was good. The hotel is quiet on weekends, and a few days here and I had forgotten that I had not left town. There was even free wifi!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: TysTravels
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel to stay at during my layover from Dublin to Phoenix. After spending 5 weeks backpacking through the UK it was wonderful to stay in a clean and comfortable room. I had a view of the harbor and I was able to take a water taxi from the airport directly to the InterContinental's own boat dock. The convenience was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: patsfan1
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night with my mom and 15 year old daughter for my daughter's birthday. The room was very nice with modern furnishings. We especially liked the built in light in the headboard. Had a large desk looking out the window to the water. Beautiful view. Had a large flat screen tv. The bathroom had a large tub and glass shower. All of the amenities were nice too, including sewing kit, umbrella, hair dryer and all of the rest of the amenities you would expect from an upscale hotel. You could walk to Quincy Market, but because of the snow the door man gladly got us a cab whenever we needed. Drinks in the Rum Champagne bar in the lobby were delicious, and the bar's ambience was nice too. Splurged on room service for breakfast. Came very quickly. Pastries, coffee and smoothie were delicious. The hotel was quiet and lovely. The staff was extra helpful and friendly. The bed linens were very nice too. The hotel's location is great, close to aquarium, waterfront and Quincy Market. Be aware though, they do not offer any self parking. They do offer valet parking, but it is around $39. Would definitely reccommend!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel for Couples”
Reviews.Author: annonRI
Reviews.Content: I went to this hotel with my girlfriend for a nice Boston getaway. The place is beautiful. The rooms are well thought out having most things you need (even an ipod alarm clock dock and a hdtv). The tub is large and comfortable and the glass shower is a nice touch. There is a sliding panel that opens up to give you a view of the bathroom from the bed, which is really cool for a couple, but would be really awkward for a family. They provide lots of nice things that are outside the norm (like an umbrella, sewing kit in the room, etc...) There are also some negatives that I have to report. The dinner foods are overly sweet and just seem sub-par. There are lots of good places in the area to eat. I'd suggest checking them out. It's a 10 minute walk to china town or Quincy Market in either direction. Take advantage of it. :-) That said, the breakfast is extremely tasty (albeit extremely expensive) Don't be surprised to get a 40 dollar bill for breakfast. ouch. Mine wound up being free, because it showed up to my room 45 minutes late. Avoid the fridge in the room or ordering drinks from room service ($5 can of soda in the fridge) $5 for 10 ounce glass of soda from room service. The gift store on the first floor has 20 ounce sodas for 2.25, so if you must buy a drink at the hotel, it's worth going down there.... Internet isn't included. Costs almost 15 bucks a night extra. Parking is 39 per 24 hour period. (5 minutes from South Station. The commuter train is a good option) There is construction going on at the building next door and I had a view of the construction site from my room. Don't be surprised by this.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent business hotel in Boston.”
Reviews.Author: ostramundo
Reviews.Content: Modern, clean, spacious. Good location, but not especially close to the nightlife action of the Back Bay or South End, though Boston is small so taking cabs is easy/affordable. This is my #1 chain hotel choice when staying in Boston. Better value than Ritz/Four Seasons with better finishes, etc, because it is newer. Good staff. The Priority Club membership is worthwhile if staying here a lot as there is late checkout and upgrades, plus the staff is a bit friendlier. Bar and restaurants very good. Super close to airport and major train station, making travel very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service, Noisy and Nickel and Dimed...”
Reviews.Author: ALADoc
Reviews.Content: Arrived and was not assisted with luggage out of cab, instead struggled to get into the lobby with 2 people in tow. Our room was a good size and hotel is in good location, about 1 block from South Station Subway. Paper-thin walls could hear conversations, phone calls, TVs, cleaning crews and the 5am wake up calls that our neighbor requested. Was never asked if we were satisfied with our stay. I think for the cost of our room a free wifi signal would not have been unreasonable. Just disappointing for the price and expectation from what I thought would be a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Markus729
Reviews.Content: Concierge service was extremely helpful, rooms were spacious and the health club was open 24/7. Very centrally and conveniently located to most everything.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place!”
Reviews.Author: Mandarine84
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice, clean and modern. I got a room with a view of the city and it was beautiful. The service was good, although it could have been better. I didn't like their room service options because they were super expensive so I asked the concierge for menus of places I could order from. The concierge gave me a couple of menus, but not that many. Also, they do not have a proper business center like other hotels do. They have a hotel store and in the actual store they have 2 computers with a printer. I needed to print a bunch of things and they charged me for each page. After paying $400 per night I don't think that it is necessary to be charged for printing each page. Also there is no privacy, so if you want to access the computers the store clerks can see what you are typing. As an additional information, they are also charging $15 for wireless.

Reviews.Title: “Very new, modern. Try the truffle fries!”
Reviews.Author: Dothereo
Reviews.Content: I got this hotel on hotwire, so I did not actively choose it, I just ended up with it based on the great price/star rating ratio. I don't know what list price is on the rooms, but I got in for about 180 and it was totally worth it. Great room. Super bathtub! The healthclub was completely empty when I went, but we swam in the pool anyways. I don't know what "list" price is on the rooms, but it really is a great place to be. Location wise: it's on the water, near the financial zone. Not in a particularly cute part of boston, but certainly efficient enough and easy to get everywhere you want to go. I stayed on a saturday and there were at least 3 different wedding "cliques" operating in the busy bar in the lobby. If you don't like that kind of noise or crowd in the lobby, avoid this place in spring/summer on a weekend! The restaurant in the lobby seemed to be open all night and provided us with some of the best late night munchies I've ever had: A big basket of truffle-oil french fries! I've since tried to get them other places and even make them myself but they come up short to that memory. Order them! You won't be sorry! All in all, this hotel seems like a cross between a boutique hotel crossed with a hilton. If you get a good rate, you definitely won't be sorry! And even if you don't stay there, but you find yourself nearby in the middle of the night... try those truffle friels!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the gym”
Reviews.Author: richardwkirk
Reviews.Content: I had a great stay in this hotel. Although I can see that this hotel may be expensive I was lucky enough to get a late deal on priceline making it very affordable. The staff were extremely helpful and made me feel very welcome at the hotel. In terms of location, the hotel is very close to South Station for access to the "T". This was also very useful for me as I arrived in the city by bus to South Station and will also be good for those arriving by train. It is possible to walk to a lot of places on interest in under 10 minutes from the hotel however if I went again I would make more use of the T as it was very easy to access. I probably did too much walking but this was more by choice that necessity. The best thing about the hotel was the gym. The facilities were great! I especially liked the iced water that had a different kind of fruit in it each day to add taste. The only downside for the gym was that there was no direct access to the pool from the changing rooms. This wasn't a huge problem though.

Reviews.Title: “All A Hotel Should Be, Except Inexpensive”
Reviews.Author: Puggie2
Reviews.Content: The room was large clean, and comfortable. The bath was huge. The staff was competent and friendly. The location was great. Only drawback was the restaurant, but everyone knows not to eat at hotel restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Arewereallythere
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Intercontinental in Boston as part of our honeymoon before venturing up to Bar Harbor, ME. The check in staff were one of the best I've come across on my travels over the last few years - always a smile, nothing was a problem. I must also say that all the staff were excellent and a credit to the Intercontinental Group from the doormen to Alison the Concierge. We had split our honeymoon with one night in Boston with a few days up North then coming back for a couple of nights on our return trip. The first night we were lucky enough to have a waterfront/building view (suite) the second part we had a double room overlooking the Boston Fire Station. Both views great! It had a great gym/pool/bar (good Guinness) and an excellent atmosphere which in my humble opinion you sometimes don't get in the larger hotel chains. Can't wait to come back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Stay”
Reviews.Author: jenniegirlm
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here and found the room to be very clean. The sushi bar downstairs was great as well as the cafe. Close to the New England Aquarium, Fanueil Hall, Children's Museum, and Little Italy. Overall a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, very good service”
Reviews.Author: supergirl_sf
Reviews.Content: I spent last weekend at the Intercontinental. By booking a last minute getaway, I got a great rate. They were kind enough to let me check in several hours early, even though I had not requested to do so in advance. The first room they put me in was nice enough, if unexceptional (I don't know why I still expect chain hotels, even nice ones, to be otherwise). Although my view was a construction site, I was not particularly bothered, as I didn't expect workers to be there at night or on Sunday. The room had a great bathroom, very clean with a big, deep tub. There was also a sturdy umbrella in the closet, a nice touch which turned out to be a necessary accessory the first day there. All was well until I was going to go to sleep that evening, and realized that a previous guest had thrown up on either the bed or one of the pillows. I moved to the other bed in the room and was able to sleep, but it was again the first thing I smelled when I got up in the morning. Before heading out that day, I asked at the desk if I could be moved and left a cell phone number. Within a couple of hours I received a very gracious and apologetic message from one of the managers. She moved me to one of the waterfront rooms on a higher floor, which was quite bright and spacious, and of course had a gorgeous view! Things occasionally are wrong with hotel stays no matter what the cost or reputation of the establishment, of course, but the difference between average and poor hotels and good ones is this kind of prompt and courteous response to rectify any issues. The Intercontinental did a great job on this. Other than that, the location is fine -- it is a couple of minutes walk to Downtown Crossing or the Common, or you can check out the nice new parkway that resulted from the Big Dig, starting right outside the hotel's door. The waterfront is pretty, and the hotel has a pleasant seating area arranged with tables, chairs and umbrellas so you can eat outdoors and enjoy the water view. I didn't visit any of the restaurants, or the spa (appointments do fill up, so don't wait til the last second!) although it looked quite nice. Overall, I'd say avoid room 522, and you should probably have a pretty good experience here!

Reviews.Title: “Good but ...”
Reviews.Author: dsor
Reviews.Content: This is a pretty good luxury hotel. Everything seems to work, the rooms are nice, the employeees are attentive, the bar and public areas are welcoming and upscale.The waterfront location is good - for some. Our room had a view of the building alongside, which was uninspiring. Being in Boston, it is possible to get to most places you want to go in a few minutes. There is just one area this hotel lets itself down. Why on earth do they feel the need to charge $15 per day for internet access? The smallest hotels, bars and restaurants see free Wifi as a standard part of their offering these days but the Boston Intercontinental charges $15. What's that all about?

Reviews.Title: “Very cool fun hotel.”
Reviews.Author: HarryDiggs
Reviews.Content: I came here for my birthday this year and I was really happy with the choice to stay at the Intercontinental. The place looks awesome! Very well decorated. The room was awesome too except for that the bathroom was really weird. There was a window above the bed that didn't lock or anything and it slid open to the bathroom. Awkward. But other than that it was great! There is a cool bar downstairs, a place to get sushi and then a restaurant. Couldn't be better! I had an awesome time and I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Upscale but without the individual touches”
Reviews.Author: Panda_and_Flossy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights in September 2009 as part a New England Tour. The hotel is classy from the moment you step inside. The lobby is very tasteful as are the rooms with the only negative being a sliding glass partition between the room/bathroom which opens up to create a seemingly larger living area (and allows you to watch the TV from the bathroom!!!). Although this sounds a nice touch it can actually become less private when using the WC (even though the doors are shut). We really liked the harbour location however it is a 10 minute walk from the Quincey Market area and considerably further from the Newbury Street shopping area. One other slight disappointment was that the hotel advertised a Champagne Bar which we intented try only to find out that this room was not open to the general public and only available for private parties. Compared with other Intercontinental Hotels it lacked other special touches such as the lack of bathrobes, toiletries were not a premium brand and were not replaced after first use and no turn down service. One other thing to note is that no recognition is made of Priority Club Platinum members - they only recognise ambassador status (which they try and sell you for $150 on check in) It may sound like we had a few complaints but this is only because of the high standard we are used to from the Intercontinental Brand but overall this is still a good hotel and should we visit Boston again we would certainly consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, bad location”
Reviews.Author: bjsclan5
Reviews.Content: Hubby and I went to Boston to attend a jazz fest and just to get away from it all (if you know what I Mean!) location of this hotel was quite a distance from most points of interest so we rented a car instead of high taxi rates. Beautiful hotel, most of the service was great, did have a problem with the bar staff, which was resolved by bar manager. Suggested positive patron interaction program to alleviate this in the future. Food was expensive and not up to par for cost. Best things about hotel; bathroom impeccable with a great soaking tub and walk-in shower, toiletries not used as left behind a negative smell. The outside harbour area was perfect. We took our late night brandy there every evening and it proved to be very romantic!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, but expensive beyond value”
Reviews.Author: NJWorldTraveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights in early October. Room was complementary through Priority Club program is why we selected it. Very nice, high quality appointments, plush and comfortable. We travel worldwide and can obtain same level at significantly less than their going rate. Boston, however, is very expensive across the board. Hotel is in financial district. Location places it a good walk/cab ride to sites, restaurants, etc. South Station is 5 min. walk with convenient subway to Fenway, Kennedy Library and airport. ( Bargain $2 fare each way). Suggest saving $$ at less expensive hotel and enjoy the many fine restaurants in the North End with your savings.

Reviews.Title: “Great modern hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: LancashireCGr
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 great nights at the end of September. The hotel is right at the heart of the waterside district and is an ideal location for exploring central Boston. Jump on the Trolley to get your bearings and then you can walk to most places. Great room and very helpful and friendly staff. Food good if a little pricey. Bathroom opened out to bedroom, a nice feature if you want to talk to your partner while having a bath but little soundproofing if you want individual privacy. We had a great time and would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful modern hotel in Boston”
Reviews.Author: JamieEighteen
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights in late September / early October. Arrived from Logan Airport by Water taxi, $10 per person so cheaper than a regular taxi unless there are 3 people or more. A very pleasant bellman immediately came to give me a hand with the luggage. Check in was quick and easy and was allocated a nice spacious room on the sixth floor. This room overlooked Atlantic Ave rather than the waterfront but was quite nice nonetheless. I certainly wouldn't have paid an extra $30 a night for the water view. Room was nicely decorated with comfortable beds and and a large bathroom with both bath and walk in shower. Nice flat screen tv with plenty of channels and good high speed internet ($40 for a week) help you to keep in touch. Nice bar in the hotel lobby which was always busy despite high prices. Didn't eat in Miel (hotels restaurant) as I prefer simpler fare but the Concierge and Doormen were always quick with good suggestions. Housekeeping were excellent and responded well to any requests. Location was fine for me, only a block or so from South Station, with a maximum ten minute walk to Faneuil Hall and the market etc and the same to the aquarium. Overall a very good stay in a nice hotel. Good service levels and great amenitiesput this at the top end of Boston's hotels. Only downside for some is that it is very highly priced (as are most Boston hotels) but I am told that you can quite often get it cheaply on Hotwire!

Reviews.Title: “Superb example of city centre hotel that captures history”
Reviews.Author: Rob S
Reviews.Content: Really solid hotel this one. Great open space in the lobby area. My room was excellent and the whole hotel encapsulated the history that Boston has. Really enjoyed my stay. Great restaurant on site. Superb breakfast. The bathroom opened out into my guest room and made for a whole new room. The bed was very comfortable. I will be back, one day!

Reviews.Title: “Property stolen from rooms”
Reviews.Author: kteneyck
Reviews.Content: I was here working on a movie for 3 months. Of the approx. 10 people in my immediate office, 3 of them had stuff stolen from their rooms. The hotel claimed they were not responsible and did nothing. Stay at your own risk.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay, Made my stay in Boston even better”
Reviews.Author: lollie-22
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Intercontinental in Boston for a week with my Boyfriend and I had a fantastic time I couldn't fault anything! The room was amazing, all staff extremely helpful and it was really close to everything !! Quincy Market & Fanueil Hall just a short walk away as was Downtown Boston. Anything further away you just had to hop on the T South Station was just a short walk. As has been said extras are pricey but that's expected with this kind of Hotel, found a great diner close by 'South Street Diner' looks a bit nasty but in fact was brilliant breakfast was really tasty and very cheap would definitely recommend it. Altogether had a fantastic time while in Boston and would recommend the Intercontinental Boston to everyone thinking about it !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Just too out of the way”
Reviews.Author: mcogley
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel twice. The first visit was more enjoyable than the second. The rooms are clean and spacious, although during the second stay our room was somewhat noisy. Noise from the hallways and neighboring rooms was louder than what you would expect from a luxury hotel. There is a term in plumbing sometimes referred to as "air hammer". When a toilet refills after being flushed, there is a loud bang in the water pipe after the supply valve closes. We were frequently awakened by this noise whenever someone flushed a toilet in any of the the rooms near ours. There are no coffee makers in the rooms. A pot of coffee from room service costs ten bucks. If you want to print your airline boarding pass in the business center it will cost you nine dollars. There are no restaurants nearby other than the two restaurants in the hotel. We ate at one of the restaurants the evening we arrived. Two entrees, two diet sodas and tip added up to seventy-five dollars. I'm really not as cheap as it might seem but it's just that every little thing is going to cost you. I won't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best Weekends of My Life at the Intercontinental Boston”
Reviews.Author: Lytton42
Reviews.Content: Even though I live in Massachusetts, I stayed at the Intercontinental Boston because I was in town for a concert at the House of Blues. From the moment I arrived, everything was perfect. The staff were hospitable and helpful throughout, and the room was very nicely appointed with a view east across Fort Point Channel. Room service was excellent as were drinks in Rumba. One of the things that I appreciated at checkout was that the person at the counter went over each item in my bill to make sure that all charges were accurate. The only sour note occurred as I was leaving: if you take advantage of valet parking at the front of the hotel at check-in, you have to pick up the car next door in the garage. There's an elevator from the area behind the lobby, though it's somewhat tough to find. I had called ahead and the car was ready, but it seems that the valets didn't think my Sentra was worth any attention. So I got the keys from a man behind a window, loaded up the luggage myself and drove out. No tip for them. Within the hotel itself all amenties, from bed to bath to TV, couldn't have been better.

Reviews.Title: “OUTSTANDING”
Reviews.Author: hawkdog
Reviews.Content: Everything was oustanding. The room was beautiful. The Service was extraordinary. The bar in the lobby was fantastic and attracted a great non hotel crowd. I travel quite a bit on business and pleasure and very much rank this place highly. Only negative is the price but you do indeed get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel- would recommend”
Reviews.Author: 39tacbob
Reviews.Content: The decor in the rooms are fabulous and the rooms are decent size. My boyfriend felt there was a lack of privacy for the bathroom because there was a sliding door that looked into the bedroom which didnt keep out noise or light if the other person was sleeping. The hotel is walking distance to everything......freedom trail, boston commons, beacon hill, quincy market. etc... We felt there were not many restaurants close by that were open in the evenings or weekends. If you just want a quick bite or its late night your choices near the hotel are slim due to the fact that its located in the financial business district. Its a walk to the areas where there are lots of restaurants. The hotel does have two restaurants but typical of hotels they are overpriced and so-s0. There is a Starbucks, Duncin Donuts and Brueggers Bagels two blocks away but they were closed on the weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, but certain things are keeping me from staying again.”
Reviews.Author: parmtony
Reviews.Content: The hotel was fine. Very beautiful inside and our room was comfortable. Extras were a bit expensive. After leaving the valet parking in the morning, we noticed a tobacco smell... and today found a used cigarette shoved underneath our floor mat. Extremely disrespectful. We won't be returning to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms - only very expensive dining options in hotel/few options outside hotel that are nearby”
Reviews.Author: RR2008
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel - nice bathrooms! Dining in the hotel was very expensive - and there were very few options available within a short walking distance - especially for breakfast - no coffee/tea service in the room. Asked for a nice view and received a room facing a building under construction. Nice open patio area facing the water - nice conference facilities. Extremely noisey bar area in lobby - the sound was very loud coming out of the elevators into the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Big on luxury image but not family friendly”
Reviews.Author: teachermom61
Reviews.Content: We booked on priceline so it was a good value for 4 star hotel. This is a good destination if you're on a corporate outing with an expense account, but it is not a family friendly hotel. Big on luxury image but short on hospitality. The website says ALL rooms have either harbor or city skyline view, but we were given a room with a construction site view, literally so close to our window that we could not open our curtains during the day. I asked for a different room and was told it would be an additional $50 so we stayed put. Parking is $40 per day and eating in this hotel is extremely expensive. We are realistic and willing to spend more than usual when traveling but prices for extras at this hotel are over the top. There is no complimentary anything! A morning cup of coffee was $2 from a cart in the lobby. Bathrooms had bare minimum (shampoo, conditioner, soap) . As far as the rooms themselves, they are very clean and comfortable. Overall I was not impressed with this hotel but if money is no object and you are looking for a clean room and a good city location it is a fine choice.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: Brad_Almy
Reviews.Content: I spent a week at the Intercontinental during late August. Rooms were beautiful, beds were very comfortable and the room service was great (although expensive, as to be expected). As I was travelling on business, I really appreciated how great the iron was, as it pressed by business shirts very well. This might seem like a stupid comment, but often travelling on business, you find yourself in a hotel with a crap iron and a suitcase full of wrinkled shirts. Rooms were quiet, couldn't ask for more. Ask for a room above level 5, so that you have a view of something other than the roof of the lobby! Good location if you are coming into boston on train, as is less than 5 minutes walk from south station....15 minute walk to the Fanuiel hall area. Gym is pretty good, and pool is good to cool down after a work out.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern room, friendly service, great pool and gym, pricey extras.”
Reviews.Author: cbdbcbdb
Reviews.Content: This Intercontinental offers what you would expect from a downtown luxury hotel. We prepaid a booking on Hotwire for 3 nights and aside from the pricey parking and internet the hotel was very nice. The view of the park was great, and my kids liked it when the fire trucks came out of the station. The room was very clean and modern, and quiet. The bathroom is roomy the separate tub and shower is a nice feature. We requested additional towels (there were only two in the room) and they arrived quickly. The staff was professional. Finally, the pool was very nice, as was the gym with state-of-the-art equipment. My only recommendation for the hotel is that it would be nice to have in-room coffee makers instead of paying $10/pot for room service coffee or running down the road to Starbucks, Panera or Dunkin Donuts. We would recommend this hotel, particularly for the hotwire rate we found.

Reviews.Title: “Reservation was Not Honored and Staff was condescending”
Reviews.Author: Johnfromny1
Reviews.Content: This was my third and last visit to the Intercontinental Boston. I was there for business. My previous experiences were OK but this latest one has caused me to decide to never stay at the hotel again. I booked my travel through my employer's contracted travel agent. Upon check-in I was notified by the front desk clerk that the hotel would not honor my reservation which included a free breakfast. I stated that it had always been included in my rate in the past and that I had it in writing. I was told someone would contact me in my room. A half hour later a woman phones me and says that she needs a copy of my reservation. She comes to my room to retrieve a copy of my reservation confirmation. She later calls to say that they would not honor the reservation and that I need to speak to my travel agent. So I call the travel agent. They state that it is included in the rate and that they spoke to a hotel representative who informed them to tell me to return to the front desk and the matter would be corrected. Now I know this is only a free breakfast but at this point I was getting annoyed at the lack of customer friendly service and that I was being treated like I was trying to obtain something by fraud. I speak to the front desk manager. He tells me that my travel agent lied on the phone and that he would not honor my printed reservation. He continued in a very nasty and condescending tone. I asked for the manager and he stated that she was not available and that she would call me at 9AM the next morning. The next day the manager never calls. I ask to speak to her and she says that she spoke to the front desk manager the night before about the issue, even though he told me she was unavailable. The funny thing is in the near future I will be in Boston for long periods of time and the Intercontinental has lost my business forever. Other thoughts: A very busy fire house is right across the street and the sirens can be annoying at times. The hotel charges for everything. No free coffee in the room and "Lobby Coffee" is available for free during a very small window. in the early morning. Internet service is also expensive compared to other hotels I have stayed at. The rooms and very nice and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel- and I am 'picky'!”
Reviews.Author: owenturney
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights with wife and daughter. Good, friendly check-in. We were booked as 'run of the house' and were given a Delux room at the front of the hotel, 8th floor. Lovely modern room, nice size bathroom, great view at front of hotel. (no tea/coffee). Hotel is very modern in a large, sleak sky scraper- stunning to look at and 5 mins walk from harbour restaurants and city centre. Breakfast was very good, service good throughout. There was some noise from construction next door on entry to the hotel and the breakfast area, but it was not troubling. The bar area near the lobby also got lively and noisy, but again no bother to us. All in all a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely Valentine's Day at the InterContinental Boston”
Reviews.Author: BostonGirl85
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for Valentine's day with my boyfriend during Feb. 2009. The rate was relatively expensive, but a good value for a luxurious 5-star hotel in beautiful Boston, MA on a Saturday night. We easily checked into the hotel and received a beautiful corner room with a city view. The room was stylish, sexy, spacious and immaculately clean. It had an extremely comfy bed with a lounge/couch at the foot of the bed, desk, other seating, and a mini bar with a tiny section available for your own food/drink (not too much fits in it, but they do offer a bucket and ice machine so we could put our champagne in there instead). The bed has a window above it with small sliding doors that can be opened to look from the bathroom into the bedroom. This little design feature lets you watch the flatscreen TV from the bathroom and if you're really enjoying the change of scenery from the bedroom they even provide a phone to use next to the toilet. I guess it's just one of those "extras" you get with the 5th star! My favorite part of the HUGE bathroom though was the separate walk-in shower and bath. Though I didn't try the bath, it looked nice, and the shower had sufficient water pressure. The shower doors are clear though, so if you had the sliding window doors open to watch your favorite game or show on TV you may be a little exposed to the rest of the room. On that note, I agree that this hotel would only really suit couples or solo business travelers (although I'm not sure how rooms with 2 beds are set up!) The room was quiet and the location felt safe. We used the indoor pool which was cool because the glass roof allowed for a nice view of city buildings. The hotel isn't in the heart of Boston - it is closer to the waterfront which is nice, but not extremely convenient to other parts of the city if you're a tourist, i.e. Fenway Park, theater district etc. Faneuil Hall was walkable but it was a pretty far walk and we took a cab back at night. I didn't use the T but I think the closest stop is South Station. We're not Boston tourists and we were only there for one night so we braved the freezing cold to walk to Joe's American Bar and Grill on the waterfront and then to Faneuil from there. We stopped in at RumBa before heading up to our room, but didn't stay for long since we were tired. The atmosphere seemed nice and I would probably go back to the bar another time even if not staying as a hotel guest. We had a line for check-out that moved relatively fast and left the beautiful hotel only wishing we could have stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Staff unfriendly/unwelcoming b/c online booking.”
Reviews.Author: CandidMom
Reviews.Content: First time in Boston...booked a good rate on Hotwire $119/night. given a room with the view of tall building under construction. Room was clean and very nice. Asked if upgrade was avialable...Told it would cost $50 to change view, same type of room. No other upgrade possible sinceI I "booked online thru Hotwire" . Front desk person was unfriendly. Seemed offended I booked thru Hotwire. Not given enough towels on second night...called to ask for more...took a long time....called to ask again, told by front desk agent that he was busy and had not had a chance to put in out towel request., towels eventually delivered. Concierge was friendly and helpful with advice and booking for Duck Tours.

Reviews.Title: “Wow from Halifax NS”
Reviews.Author: HalifaxNovies
Reviews.Content: We had not been to Boston for some time, and were blown away by all the changes. The Intercontinental exceeded our expectations, right from the check in. Chris was able to get us a room on the tenth floor , overlooking the city, which was just fine. The room was very spacious, with a huge bathroom boasting a stand up shower and soaker tub .All amenities were first rate, including the gym and pool, dining areas, etc. It was within walking distance of the Nâ‚¬w England Aquarium, The Constitution, Quincy Market, and great shopping and resturants. We walked to TD garden for a tour, caught the subway to Fenway for their tour, walked the waterfront, and had a super time. I have been reading trip advisor reviews for years, and the intercontinentaly was the catalyst for me to be a contributor

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: smvermont
Reviews.Content: I wanted to revisit Boston after a long absence and the area of the city where this hotel is located is unrecognizable. Due to the Big Dig and locating the Expressway underground, this area is beautiful, accessible and active. It is very easy to walk around and get to Quincy Market and the North End, and the waterfront is lively. The hotel was full of people, some of them were very loud in the halls until after 2 AM, which I found very inconsiderate, but not the hotel's fault. I had gotten a rate from Hotwire and was offered a better room at a higher price, which I refused. The room I had was right off of the elevators, which was somewhat noisy. The room was pleasant and the bathroom was wonderful----glass enclosed shower and a huge, deep tub. I was surprised that there was no bubblebath for the tub, as it is clearly for soaking. I had parked outside of the city and took the subway in, and the South Station stop is only two blocks away which was great.

Reviews.Title: “Prepaid Reservation was not Honored”
Reviews.Author: BigGlasses09
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because it was supposed to be nice, and it's pretty close to the airport. Flying with my wife and kids from the west coast, we wanted an easy end to the long day of travel. This seemed ideal. Plush, close to the airport. We had a pre-paid reservation. We appeared at the front desk, exhausted. "We have had a problem with our computers today. We don't have a room for you." "What?" "We did find you a room about a 40 minute drive from here." Much handwaving about computers. (I suspect they got a lot of last-minute people. So they looked at my reservation, saw that I had gotten a good deal, and decided to roll the dice and sell the room to someone who they could charge more.) An hour later, they had made the arrangements, supposedly. "Go to the Holiday Inn Select, we'll fax them and let them know you are coming." We showed up at the Holiday Inn Select in some nasty little suburb way north of downtown Boston. No fax. Fortunately, I had asked for a copy of the note they were going to send. So we checked in, and finally got to bed, 1:30am, with my two small kids. Thanks, Intercontinental Boston! They promised to have the general manager send me a note of apology and an offer to let us stay for free in one of their suites sometime in the future. I haven't heard a peep from them. Thanks, Intercontinental Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay in Boston”
Reviews.Author: sthelena
Reviews.Content: Recommended. The room was large and very comfortable. Great location, on the dockside close to main downtown, Little Italy and Quincy's Market. Also right next to to access to interstate/Mass Tpike. Because it's a 5 star hotel, extras are expensive, but we got a good rate for a room with two double beds.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish Waterfront Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hotelwise16
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed a great stay. Both the room and its bathroom were large and well-appointed. Just a short walk from live entertainment at Rowes Wharf. While the front-desk staff could be warmer, they were efficient, professional and ultimately helpful. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel on the Waterfront”
Reviews.Author: Cap93
Reviews.Content: Only two years old, but the staff acts as if it were brand new. It does feel brand new, too. Rooms were spacious. Bathtub is enormous. You can open shutters and watch TV from the tub. Evening cocktails by the wharf was a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “I would like to stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Roanke_VAMac
Reviews.Content: Hello I had a great time here! I'm orginally from Boston I come back and visit about three times a year. I do recomend this hotel. My doughter and I arrived before my husband in the pooring rain, ICH, was happy to help, they stored my bags and called me when my room was available at 1:00 (thanks for the early check in we were soaked). The rooms were outstanding and the bathroom worked well for kids tub and shower. The pool was nice too! We choose not to rent a car untill we checked out and headed to the suburbs. Everything was easy to walk to espeically with kids. In fact we my daughter and I walked to the aquarium. The bars and resturants were great down below. My husband filight was delayed and did not arrive unitl 1;00 am so when he arrived to the hotel, he found comfort in finding a spot at the bar for bit of unwinding. I had nice time and enjoyed the hotel, my husband liked it too. However, he gripped when we checked out and had to pay 14.00 for internet service. I've seen people nit pick on these sites, I do wish there was a FREE coffee bar somewhere, it would of helped jumped start my morining! Boston's cost of living is higher than in the south from where we are residing so small expences are double for us. I hope to comeback one day its truly and amazing place!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, if you don't have to pay for it.”
Reviews.Author: hikingmaniac
Reviews.Content: We were there for one night, as one of our children had day surgery the next morning. The check in clerk ignored me for two minutes, not even acknowledging my presence. A bit cold at first and then she warmed up a little. The room was on the 12th floor overlooking the Rose Kennedy Greenway. It was a fantastic view, and the room was very comfortable. A short walk up to Quincy Market on the Greenway which was beautiful. The concierge seemed very friendly and helpful, and the hotel bellmen were very helpful when we needed their assistance after checkout the next day. This is a high priced, comfortable, nice hotel. We had a free night, because of two stays at other holiday inn express properties.

Reviews.Title: “Just Enjoy!!”
Reviews.Author: Tazmaniac
Reviews.Content: Just got back from States. Started our holiday in Boston at ICH and really enjoyed it. The recetionist was a bit brusque when he checked us in; I used my Priority points for our stay and as I am a platinum member am entitled to ask for an upgrade. Very sharp response "No". Concierge team were brilliant, nothing too much trouble for them; pointing us in the right direction etc. Other reviewers have complained, saying ICH too far from the restaurants and bars. Get over yourself, Boston is the walking city and what is wrong with walking a couple of blocks back to the hotel after a lovely meal down near the aquarium. Just Enjoy Boston, ICH and the surrounding areas.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice...expected a little more”
Reviews.Author: hellogoodbye_7
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a business trip with a conference at this hotel. This was my first trip to Boston. The Intercontinental Boston is very nice. What struck me the most was the cleanliness. It is a newer hotel so it still has a nice, clean feel to it. For some reason I expected more from the lobby, restaurant offerings, common areas especially for the price paid for the room. The rooms are nice, with nice sized bathrooms with tub and shower. The work out gym was nice and very adequate. There is a nice place to sit outside at the water's edge. It is close to the South "T' station, but otherwise in a poor location. It is a fairly long walk to a convenience store for bottled water etc.. and most of the action in Boston is elsewhere. Although Boston is a walking city, I still like to be able to get somewhere quickly for a late night snack. Front desk service was fair. There was a language barrier at times. I finally gave up trying to get my Priority points added to my stay. The concierge desk was very helpful. I would probably stay here again, but would likely look for a hotel a little less expensive and in an area with more to see and do.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hardware, atrocious service experience”
Reviews.Author: calibear314
Reviews.Content: Pros: * Brand new hotel, very nice finishes in traditional IHG style Cons * Poor reception and service attitude is really terrible * No on-site self-parking, has to be done via valet * OK location but a bit out of the way from the action Stayed here for a one-night stay recently and had a mixed experience. First off, the hotel appears very new and has a great finish to what you would expect from a new Interncontinental hotel. Finishes were nice and really a nice room. My main problem with this hotel is the awful service. My assistant made an incorrect booking for my one-night stay (she booked me to arrive the previous night). She used hotwire to book and we got a very decent rate for the stay. So when I arrived at the hotel, the front desk staff said I didn't have a room for that current night for a stay. Realizing my own staff's mistake, I inquired about just booking a room for the current evening. After 10 minutes of waiting at the front desk, the front desk informed me I would be charged rack rate to stay in the current evening. I asked the front desk if I could get a rate discount similar to hotwire and the front desk worker said, "You can try to book it on hotwire at our business center." I inquired if I had to pay to use their business center and the front desk worker said, "Yes." I informed the front desk worker that I'm about to book another night's room at his hotel and I didn't have any computer access. Once again, I asked him if i could just borrow a computer in their business center to book a room at his hotel. Asked the concierge and he also stated, "you'll have to pay a fee to use our computer's in the business center!" Here is my huge beef with this IHG Boston: the service is terrible. I've already paid 1 unused hotel night due to my error. I'm fine with this. I asked to see if IHG could allow me to book another night if they could just allow me to use a computer for THREE MINUTES just to book it on hotwire. Their response both times were in the negative tone. What I don't appreciate is the cold, inflexible nature with which this hotel is run. No sense of hospitality or soft-skills to work with different problems. I didn't appreciate being Nickel-And-Dimed (even if it was at the company's expense) and I would never recommend staying at this place. Spoke to the concierge and he as not responsive or accommodating at all either. Stay at either the Hyatt Regency or the Zero Hotel next time. Never recommending this one ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Good when you pay the hotwire rate.”
Reviews.Author: FamilyTravelerRI
Reviews.Content: We were able to get this hotel through hotwire for a good rate. I would never stay here at the standard booking price but that is just me. The location is great for the Children's Museam and Aquarium and someday if it ever reopens, the Boston Tea Party. Keep in mind when you book that there is an additional $40 parking charge per night. Positives: Easy access from south of boston or the south station T. If you go 10 minutes north, you will find life at Fanuel Hall. Negatives: It is in the financial district, which is dead on the weekends. There aren't even convience stores operating past 5pm. Crazy quiet. Like a scene from the end of the world. The breakfast buffet is around $25 each. We just purchased some sides and got out the door for $65 for breakfast. Yes, granola, bagels and yogurt and we are not talking room service. The primary reason for a hotel is sleep but the pillows are the type that once you put your head on them they go as flat as the sheets. Some love soft pillows. Its a negative for me.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, new, and popular 5-star hotel ; close proximity to historical attractions”
Reviews.Author: Jacobs-Family
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this property for a fun-filled week in Mass. visiting some friends. We chose this hotel based on location and price -- we got a deal on hotwire -- The downtown location is on the wharf and the sea aquarium is two blocks away. Fanueil Hall and markets are also 3-4 blocks away and that area had a lot of places to eat and catch a drink while sightseeing. We felt very safe at night walking around downtown to get back to the hotel. There are tons of Irish bars ideally located near the hotel as well. The hotel staff at check in was very accomodating and informative about the area. We arrived early at 1pm and -- Linh at the front desk -- helped get us squared away in a room on the spot. The room was modern and spacious. Large bedroom area with chase lounge and arm chair. We had a king bed that was super comfy with soft linens and lots of feather pillows. (Firm pillows are by request) Seperate desk with several outlets so you can charge up your computer and smart phone all in one. The bathroom was very large with seperate soaking tub and shower stall that had two shower heads! Great water pressure too which is hard to find at a large hotel. Cleaning staff was efficient; we stepped out for lunch and within an half hour our room was clean and spotless. We had room service one night and it was fast, within 10-15 min. of ordering. We got the chicken fingers so I cant tell you about the fine dining! The downstairs bar, Rumba, was packed both Friday and Saturday night ; looked like a popular spot. It is a champagne bar with an extensive selection. It is pricey though and drinks run about $10 a pop -- but it was a nice place to go for a night cap. There is also a commercial lobster shipping company the next block over from the hotel. Go out the hotel and to the right and you can see it on the corner -- James Hook and Company. We ate there several times for a quick lobster roll. It was very good and interesting to look inside the shop to see all the ranges of lobster sizes -- 1 pound all the way up to monster lobsters with claws as big as your head. All in all we enjoyed the InterContinental and its offerings very much. Not if, but when we visit Boston again we would stay at this property. I would definitley recommend to my best friends and family for a great, luxurious stay.

Reviews.Title: “Reward night stay...”
Reviews.Author: snoopydoo
Reviews.Content: So I have to admit- I wouldn't pay $400 a night to saty at any hotel, anywhere. And that was the going rate for our room the night we stayed at the Intercontinental Boston. But I had a reward night for any Holiday Inn brand hotel, and we had a seminar in Boston. (BTW- I live about 30 minutes from the hotel, with no traffic). We took the T in (the commuter rail is in our town) which was $12 each, one way. (parking at th ehotel would have been $39). The hotel is less than 10 minutes (walking) from South Station. Checked in around 5pm, no problems. The room was quite nice, pretty much just like the website described it. The view was the Boston Fire Station, which isn't a bad view, and was really nice to look at in the dark (everything lit up). We walked toward Fanuel Hall, and ended up having dinner at Jose McIntyres. (we bypassed the hotel restaurant- I'm sure they would excellent, but they were pricey). Spent the evening walking around Fanuel Hall, then back to the hotel. The bed was very comfortable- I believe the pillows and comforter were down. There was a shower stall and a soaking tub. Nice soaps,shampoos, etc. Check out was quick and easy. It was a very nice hotel for a free stay, pretty much what I expected. I can honestly say I probably will never pay thier rates to stay there, but I would recommend it to anyone who would pay those prices (because I assume that's the kind of hotel they would like).

Reviews.Title: “5 stars hotel that make you sleep on the floor! Nightmare in Boston!”
Reviews.Author: mylbou
Reviews.Content: 4 friends book this hotel for a nice Gateway to Boston... Oh surprise, they gave us a 1 king bed room! We try to argue over the front desk, Hotel was overbooked during 4th july week-end and they ABSOLUTELY didnt' try to accomodate us. 2 of us had to sleep on the floor! What kind of hotel is that!!! They gently gave us ONE extra pillow and a paper-thick sheet, and that's it!! Rude employee at the front desk explain us they don't garantee the number of beds, that it is a "special request" and that they are not responsible about that. Never never again! Pass the word around so nobody gets foul again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel; slightly dim staff”
Reviews.Author: Lit-traveler
Reviews.Content: This gorgeous new property has benefited from--and takes real advantage of--the exciting revitalization of Boston's waterfront. Even if you don't have a view of the Harbor, you'll overlook the skyline and the handsome, garden-lined boulevard that replaced the old Central Artery (now just a dreary memory). You have only to walk out the back door to take a stroll along the water or enjoy drinks on the hotel's elegant patio, which is very lively in the evening. Our room was spacious and beautifully appointed, with one of the most comfortable beds in memory, enough kinds of lighting to set any mood, a huge bathroom with separate bath and shower, a comfortable workspace, and even good art. A real treat was taking a "water taxi" from the hotel's own dock straight to Logan Airport--on call and only $10. Unlike some other correspondents, I wouldn't call the staff of this beautiful hotel rude--just disinclined to use their heads. It took not one but three front desk clerks to find a very important envelope that I knew had already been delivered ("It's not my fault!" one smilingly insisted after Clerk #3 finally found it in an unkempt pile of mail). Some but not all of my drycleaning was promptly returned; I had to call for the rest. My other "ding" is for needless charges. What other hotel on earth charges $1.50 to print out an airline boarding pass? But overall, the Intercontinental is a grand effort.

Reviews.Title: “Great location Great city Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: dudede
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed at the Intercontinental for three evenings. The concierge staff was perfection. Our room overlooked the Boston Fire Dpt. Thought things might get a bit crazy and loud in the evening with sirens and things but had no trouble sleeping. We were on the 9th floor in a large corner room. Perfect. We needed extra towels. One phone call and staff was at our door within minutes. Expected to pay at least $40 a night to park in downtown Boston. Had bikes on back and car top carrier for next leg to Martha's Vineyard. Safe and secure. Public transportation was a breeze. Detroit could learn a thing or two. (Wish we had such a great system....) So much to do in immediate area. Walked Freedom Trail from beginning to end with concierge provided materials. Fenway Park for a game on the 3rd. The guys LOVED it. Fireworks on the 4th. Made reservations on a boat and viewed from Boston Harbor. Quincy Market so close and never a dull moment there. Never did make it to the pool or the exercise room. Both looked great. Too much to do in the city and came "home" long enough to sleep and then start all over!

Reviews.Title: “Rude and Snotty Staff!!”
Reviews.Author: ghastly007
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 2 weeks on business and I do travel for a living, so believe me when I tell you there staff was rude and snotty! The front desk and concierge acted like they were the guests and that you were bothering them when ever you asked them something. In one instance I was at the front desk just standing there texting a colleague when the front desk girl came by and said in a snotty tone, "may I help you with something", obviousoly I was texting someone and should not have looked like I was in need of any help!, so I said " is there a problem with me standing here texting someone?" and she pointed to seats accross from the desk and said " there are seats over there", so I said back again, so I cannot stand here and text someone?, and she said once more in a snotty tone and pointed " there are seats overthere". Whatever, this hotel for the amount of money it cost, forget it! Down the street is the Marriot Waterfront, I should have stayed there, they would never treat anyone like that. Signed, One pissed and insulted business traveler!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, elegant and spacious”
Reviews.Author: suz320
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights over 4th of July weekend. The hotel was full, but we still got a great rate on hotwire. My sister and nephew met me for the weekend and we enjoyed swimming in the pool and sitting in the steam room each morning before getting on our way to walking around the city. What a great city to be in for the 4th! The hotel was a block from the subway which goes everywhere and very close to the harbor and Fanuiel Hall. Perfect location! The desk staff were very friendly, the room was in excellent condition and the amenities and toiletries are wonderful. The bar was happening, but the music was a little overdone and the bar service I found wasn't great, but aside from that, I loved it and I will go back. Looking forward to it!

Reviews.Title: “beautiful and classy, but not stuffy”
Reviews.Author: capecodMass
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 4th of July weekend, wonderful hotel! Got a good internet, non refundable rate. Yes, bar and breakfast were a bit pricey, but that is Boston and we just enjoyed oursleves and did not worry! What a place, excellent service, beautiful room. RumBar was great, breakfast was very good. We ate at Cafe Fiore in the N End and Ruth Chris'-both excellent. Had lunch at Barking Crab and Florentine Cafe, drinks at all the various places on the waterfront. Great time! We will stay here again~

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, many added expenses”
Reviews.Author: CDandRW
Reviews.Content: No problems at check in, we were given a room on the 12th floor overlooking the city. The room was very nice, and clean. The bathroom was large, with a separate shower and tub. There is a "window" above the tub, which was frosted glass that could be open or shut. During the night if you used the restroom and turned on the light it lit up the entire room because it was all glass. Cons- The room rates can be very pricey, and you have a lot of choice in Boston. We had a great rate, so this was not an issue, but not sure I would be willing to pay $250+/night. Parking is $39/night with in/out privileges. This is fairly common in the city. There was an open air parking lot over the bridge for $1/hour, but was not as secure and a 10 minute walk, just not worth it for us. The hotel is a bit out of the way, we enjoy walking so this was not an issue for us. The standard hotel guide was not in the room, so no info regarding the fitness center, business center, ... When I asked about it I was told "we can tell you all the information regarding the property" and began to ramble. Personally I would prefer a written guide to look up what I need. I wanted to print a single page; the minimum cost to get online in the business office was $6.00 and $1.50 a page. I was told the concierge would print boarding passes. Pros- Clean attractive property with nice rooms. Beds were comfortable; pillows were way to small and soft for my liking. The bar downstairs was very nice and fairly busy. This may be because there were some of the most reasonable drink prices I have ever encountered at a hotel. A beer and mix drank ran about $9 a round, we paid $10-14 almost everywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Top-notch accommodations, but don't upgrade to "harbor view"”
Reviews.Author: panzergirl
Reviews.Content: I took my husband to Boston for a surprise birthday getaway, and we truly enjoyed our stay, with a few exceptions. Pros: The "standard" room was beautiful, new, and unique, with modern decor and and a very comfy bed. We got a kick out of the shutters above the bed that opened into the bathroom. The bathroom was exquisite with a deep soaking tub and separate shower. I bought the "breakfast" package, which was a good value. Breakfast was delicious, and the service was great. The main restaurant was never crowded, and there was an outside terrace on which we could dine. We found the concierge very friendly and helpful as well, since we had never been to Beantown before, and needed some guidance. Cons: The front desk personnel was snooty, fake, and didn't seem to care one bit that this was a special weekend for us. We stayed at the Williard Intercontinental in DC for my birthday a few months prior, and upon check-in we found a birthday note from the management with a delicious little birthday cake. I expected the same level of service at the Boston IC, and even after making it very clear to the staff that I wanted something special like that prepared, my request was ignored. At check-in, I inquired about a water view room, and was told that it would be an extra $40 per night for the upgrade. I accepted the upgrade, but was thoroughly disappointed with the "water view". You see, the hotel is constructed in 3 sections. The 2 outer sections are condos. They rise higher, are built out further than the middle section, which is the hotel section. Therefore, when we looked out our window, most of the view was of the side walls of the two outer towers, with a little glimpse of the channel, which was just plain ugly. Not worth $80. We stayed in the room, but if we could go back in time, we would have just downgraded back to a regular room. The location is good, but not ideal for this hotel, as there are plenty of nice hotels closer to the "action" of the harbor, South Side, and markets. But, Boston is a walking city, and I wouldn't say that it was "inconveniently located". All in all, if you like really nice, luxurious hotel rooms, like we do, then this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Intercontinental Boston-a good choice!”
Reviews.Author: Vacationqueen84
Reviews.Content: Pros; Spacious rooms, very cozy, beds/pillows were comfy and had a wonderful bathroom with seperate shower and tub. Lots of marble and granite. Staff were mostly friendly and helpful and the location was really great; only 10 minutes to Quincy Market and another few minutes to the North End. Cons; I wonder why they don't have 2 robes in the room, as most of the time there is more than one person staying. Also, there was no coffee machine. I know you can ask but it is always a hassle! We were also disappointed with the Breakfast buffet. My husband was really looking forward to bacon and they had run out. Several people, including my husband compained but there was no effort to replenish it. As previous posts have said, the charges here are pretty high so you expect good service. However, despite a few hiccoughs, we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel but can not wait until nearby construction is finished”
Reviews.Author: jpod1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Intercontinental on a Thursday and Friday evening. We had also booked our room for a Wednesday night stay. Unfortunately due to travel circumstances we were unable to check in to the hotel until Thursday. When I had found out that we would not be checking in on time I called the hotel to inform them that we would be late. I did not want them to cancel our reservation if we were late. We had booked our room through Hotwire. The lady that I spoke with kept insisting that we could not get a refund for the missed evening. What is weird is that I never asked. I knew the hotwire policy and just wanted to make sure my room wasn't given away. Anyways, when we finally arrived on Thursday there were no rooms available. Our reservation was there but no rooms. I guess they gave away our room when we didn't show up even though I called. We could not check in to our room until after 3pm. So basically we had to forfeit the entire day because we were a few hours late. It was very annoying. Eventually when we were given a room we were given one that looked at a building being constructed. No big deal, I wasn't there to enjoy the view I was there to sleep and play. Well that night when I got back to my room at 11:15pm to sleep there was construction pounding that continued throughout the entire night. At midnight I called the front desk and they stated that I could have my room switched in the morning that guaranteed to be away from the noise. They did offer to move us then but the room that we would move to would be only slightly less noisy. I was so not in the mood to pack up everything at midnight to only have a slight improvement that was not guaranteed to remove the noise. The next day we had to pack up by noon and leave our bags in the room. So we weren't allowed to hang out in the room from 12-3pm. When we returned at 4:30pm they had moved our bags to a new room that was away from the construction. That night I slept awesome! Pros-Beautiful hotel, nice finishes, beautiful lobby, tasty room service menu, nice location, awesome water pressure in some of the rooms. Cons-Poor customer service relating to our late check in but still paying for the room, construction noise

Reviews.Title: “Nice Waterfront Location, But Endless Extra Charges Could Sink a Battleship”
Reviews.Author: riprussell
Reviews.Content: The location is good; on the water, roughly on the site of the Boston Tea Party, and about a ten minute walk from Quincy Market. The hotel is newer, with a cavernous (echoing) lobby and bar (The RumBa) with sound levels reminscent of a train station. The rooms are modern and comfortable. There is NO in-room coffee offered. Swimming pool is indoor lap pool. Be aware, also; the extra charges are staggering. Parking $39/night. Once you check-out and then go get your car from the garage, it's an additional $20.00. Internet is a whopping $14.95/night. Use of clunky public computers is $6 per fifteen minutes. Printouts are $1.50 per page. Charges for receiving packages in the "business center" start at $9.00, and go up to over $60.00! If you bump or examine anything in the ensuite minibar, sensors will automatically bill your room for the items. As nice as the property is, dealing with all of these extra charges becomes a real hassle for the unaware guest, or even the well-heeled traveler. But hey, you do get a chocolate on your pillow. Sometimes.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding in Every Way”
Reviews.Author: TurtleCreekTraveller
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in numerous business hotels in Boston and the Intercontinental is my favorite. The rooms are beautifully maintained, of a good size, and extremely comfortable. As you can tell from the pics, the design language is contemporary yet elegant, and the bathrooms are generously sized, with high-quality Floris toiletries. Location is great for the financial district and also quite accessible to the main tourist areas, especially if you are using the "T", which has stations quite close to the hotel. I was very impressed with the service, especially since I was staying on a deeply discounted Hotwire rate. The entire staff was efficient and courteous, with the desk clerk even making the effort to acknowledge me while waiting for the person in front of me to complete their transaction. I asked for the best room possible given the discounted rate I paid and was given a corner room on a high floor, and I always find that graciousness to be a sign of a well-managed property.

Reviews.Title: “very satisfied”
Reviews.Author: Human44
Reviews.Content: A high quality stay on all fronts. Excellent location, service, and room attributes. The most expensive continental breakfast I've ever ordered from room service was quite tasty, but no more satisfying than the buns and coffee obtained from Au Bon Pain at South Station (three blocks away) for one-fifth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience with bad service”
Reviews.Author: JumpingJeebus
Reviews.Content: We experienced so many problems with this hotel it became a running gag. The beds were too small; they never gave us more than two towels despite requests for more. One day our room was never cleaned after several requests to have it done. The staff insisted it was our fault for leaving the do not disturb sign on, even though the sign clearly requested to have the room cleaned. They accidentally checked us out a day early and we had to stand in line twice to get that fixed. Each staff member acted confused and clearly disagreed about how to handle each problem we experienced. At the restaurant, it was the hostess's first day on the job and she couldn't answer any of our questions about the restaurant. I guess the only positives were the location and a nice looking bathroom. The price was tolerable only because we had a bargain rate. We won't be staying there again in any case.

Reviews.Title: “Nice central location to downtown. Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: rbarna1
Reviews.Content: Rooms are outstanding. Very modern layout with great furnishings and bathroom. Three bar/restaurants....all cool (if not expensive).

Reviews.Title: “Comfy bed, great staff and nice bathroom”
Reviews.Author: Polarbear14
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel through priceline ($113/night) for a late spring weekend to see a concert and visit with friends. The bed was extremely comfortable, the room was well outfitted althrough a bizarre "window" of sliding panels separated the bedroom and bathroom. Lobby and restaurant staff were very friendly and helpful. On the harbor side of the hotel there is a great patio area for sitting to enjoy a coffee or cocktail. The pool in the spa is nice, if a little on the small side for swimming laps. This part of the Financial District is a little dead on the weekends, so aside from the restaurants in the hotel, a walk or T ride is necessary to grab a drink or bite to eat. All in all a great stay and would be thrilled to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location.....and that's about it.”
Reviews.Author: Following24
Reviews.Content: Location, Location, Location is everything in the financial district in Boston. I have to admit, for location it doesn't get much better than this hotel. Seated right on Atlantic Avenue and the Boston Harbor for it's backyard , there's not too many places that are better. You can walk everywhere for this hotel. The Freedom Trail, Hanover Street, and everywhere else that you would want to see without killing yourself. The hotel is expensive and rooms are average, but if your wanting to walk Boston's historic distric, this is a great place to stay. No coffee maker in the rooms - you have to go downstairs to get a cup. Bathrooms are nice, flat screen t.v's, and the beds are decent.

Reviews.Title: “Walking Distance to Freedom Trail”
Reviews.Author: MomTravelsWithBoys
Reviews.Content: We drove from VA and went up to see the NCAA Lacrosse Championships at Gillette Stadium. Got the Hotwire room on the 4th Fl, across the street from the fire station, so sometimes you'll hear the sirens in the middle of the night. Room was clean, fine for us since we were never in the hotel except to sleep. Valet parking was $40 for 24 hours so be prepared to pay. Gillette was about 25 miles away and you have to go on a main thoroughfare so if it's rush hour, make time to go there. Freedom Trail is within waling distance, be prepared to walk alot, or take a taxi back from Bunker Hill back to hotel. It's also down the street from the Children's Museum. Hotel is pricey but clean and modern so if you just want a posh stay at a cheap price go to Hotwire or Priceline.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are good, bathrooms are amazing”
Reviews.Author: tripreviewer4
Reviews.Content: I went down to Boston for a Bachlorette party and we booked two rooms at this hotel with hotwire.com. The hotel is very easy to find. Right along the Harbor on Atlantic Avenue. 2 minutes from South Station and 10 minutes from Down Town Crossing station. Staff was friendly and check in was quick. Our room was on the 7th floor, corner room, right across from the fire station. We had a room with two queen beds which were sooo comfortable and soft. The bathrooms were the best part.... separate tub and shower. The tub is a huge soaker tub. Everything was very nice, new and clean. The location was central to everything. Fanuiel hall was a short walk and even shorter cab ride away. Check out time was a little earlier, would have been nicer if it was later.

Reviews.Title: “Not a business traveler friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: sivarttom
Reviews.Content: I had previously stayed at this hotel in March of 2009; it was a clean, modern, and an exceptional service establishment. Upon my return home from that initial stay I even sent an email complimenting the front desk service to the manager. After that satisfying stay I was more than glad to book a room for an upcoming business trip. I travel over 150 nights a year and never have I had an issue or a problem with my preferred travel partner Marriott, but decided to stay at the Intercontinental after my last visit. The morning of my trip my client called and canceled my meeting, this was not a problem as this occasionally happens. So I immediately contacted the airline and the rental car company to cancel my travel arrangements, both did so without any questions. Then I contacted the Intercontinental, they then told me that they have a strict 24-hour cancelation policy and that there was nothing they could do. I spoke to the reservation manager and the front desk manager and both told me there was nothing they could do. I then immediately contacted the IHG customer support line and they tried very hard to provide some resolution but the hotel would not budge for them. All of this being said in todayâ€™s tough economic times I am sure that very few leisure travelers will pay the rather high prices they charge, so I assume that 90 percent of their customers during the week are business travelers. So please be fully aware that this hotel would rather keep my one night stay than refund it to keep a frequent traveler's business. Good luck with any dealings with this most unaccommodating organization.

Reviews.Title: “Good sized room”
Reviews.Author: BugletMa.
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Intercontinental both times using Hotwire or Priceline.I still think it was a bit pricey for the month of March, approx. $248 plus taxes. We were however very pleased with the size of the room and they were able to accommodate us with two beds. The North End really isn,t that far of a walk for people that have no walking problems and there are plenty of restaurants in the North End.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: srussel
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Hotwire, and loved it. I didn't mind that they charged for internet as we travel with a laptop and a broadband card, and our own small coffeepot: most high end hotels don't provide a coffeepot. I loved the details in the hotel: the doorbell for the room, the 'do not disturb' that was controlled inside the room [ever stayed somewhere that a kid put their sign on your room for kicks???} and just the lovely decor. We had a corner room with a great view; I didn't feel as though they discriminated against us because of getting the room on Hotwire; and the room was huge. I've stayed in places where the whole room was smaller than the Intercontinental's bathroom! We didn't eat in the hotel restaurants but they looked great. The short walk to the T was a great feature, as we don't keep a rental car when visiting Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: b_slippery
Reviews.Content: I stayed here two years ago in july and it was an incredible time! The location is great, tons of restaurants and shopping all within great walking distance. The rooms are great with flat screen tv's and comfortable beds, the bathrooms are beautiful along with the decore. The restaurant is incredible considering the chef is Two-star Michelin Chef Jacques Chibois. (presentation and flavour of food was stunning) In my mind this is a 5 star hote with the best service i have ever experienced in a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy hotel on the waterfront”
Reviews.Author: tennis0228
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel using Priceline. A negative of Priceline is that you cannot indicate how many beds so I contacted the hotel directly and spoke with a reservation agent who noted the request for two beds but could not guarantee it. With supervisor's approval, we were given an upgraded room as there were no rooms available in the price range booked. The room which overlooked the waterfront was spacious with trendy furniture and was immaculate. As we checked in after 10pm, dining options was limited to sushi which was not appealing at that time of night so we ordered Room Service which was quite pricey but we had really no choice. A charge of $6 to use the computer in the Business Center. The hotel is located in the financial district with the "T" being two blocks is convenient.
