We looked into the offices of the next building. (see picture). The location was great. We were only a couple of blocks from the childrenâ€™s museum (highly recommended) and the Aquarium. The Boston Common, where we rode the swan boats, Fanueil Hall, and the Freedom Trail are also all within walking distance. In addition the South Station, with train and bus connections and a reasonable food court if needed, is only a couple of blocks away. The Convention Center is about a 15-20 min walk or a $7-9 cab ride. We walked to all the restaurants as well. Barking Crab was very good and fun. Legal Sea Foods is near the Aquarium. OK, but a local chain, so that was to be expected. Ate a couple of times at the Flour Bakery & CafÃ©, which is a couple of blocks behind the Childrenâ€™s Museum. We saw it on the Food Network and it ended up being great for breakfast and lunch â€“ excellent food, reasonable prices for a simple meal. There were three problems we came across at the hotel. All had to do with service. The first thing was that the service was slow at times. My husband grabbed dinner at the restaurant and the service was very slow. We also met someone in the lobby outside of the bar for a drink and the waitress failed to acknowledge us on several trips even though others were helped. Probably because we had a child with us, but that doesnâ€™t mean we didnâ€™t need a drink. The second problem was with one particular doorman, if you can call him that. Many times we would come through with a stroller, bags, etc. and he wouldnâ€™t open the door for us. Sometimes he would say â€œhi,â€� but he would never offer assistance. Third, the concierge was very nice, but, when we asked for a child friendly recommendation for a simple restaurant the first night we were in (in need of a simple and quick meal where a potentially fussy child would not be an issue), we were sent to a higher end restaurant that looked very nice (and not child appropriate) with $40 entrees â€“ this made no sense.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for business meetings”
Reviews.Author: ewrpex87
Reviews.Content: Really good location for those coming in from South Station. A short three block walk. The hotel is relatively new and it shows in the rooms. I thought my room on the city side was a bit dark, but I wasn't in it except to sleep and change. Front desk was pretty attentive. Line started forming and they slid a couple of extra employees over to help out. Typical business hotel in terms of breakfast. I ordered the Quatro Sampler which was at least a decent amount of food for the $24 price. I've paid more for less at other business hotels. They do need add some kind of express coffee service area as on way day I just wanted a quick cup before heading out. I needed to walk a few blocks out of my way to get a cup to go. I used a corporate discount which was a great deal for my company.

Reviews.Title: “Great for business”
Reviews.Author: KMKC08
Reviews.Content: The Intercontinental provides modern rooms in a great location. If you can stay here at a corporate/reduced rate, I highly recommend you try it. The rooms are very large with huge bathrooms. My suite had a large whirlpool tub, flat screen TV, and a great view of the water. I also recommend the restaurant - it's a bit pricey but the fresh seafood dishes are worth every dollar on your corporate card. It is also easy to get to from the train station.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious bathrooms”
Reviews.Author: rushrider
Reviews.Content: The hotel is absolutely beautiful and the rooms were luxurious. The bathrooms were amazing. I've never seen a hotel room like this before! The biggest drawback was the noise. I thought maybe I was just a bit unlucky but in speaking with my colleagues, it seems they all had rooms like mine where there is a connecting room next door. The problem is that the rooms connect in the tile hallway. You can hear everything going on in the next room (and I do mean *everything*). If I had a room without the 'adult activities' going on next door, the stay would have been perfect. I would have been horrified if my child was with me.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Property - Icy Service”
Reviews.Author: stattlich
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent four nights at the Intercontinental as part of a week long stay in Boston. This was our first stay at the IC. The facilities are fantastic. Tasteful, modern decor, artfully decorated lobby and public spaces, as well as a nice patio on the harbour. We had a harbour view corner-room, which was worth the upgrade. The room was very spacious, well decorated, had a 37" flat screen and gorgeous views. The service on the other hand was comically Icy at the front desk [maybe that's why it's called the I.C. :) ]. In fact ,overall, the service does not match the class of the facilities. This could be Boston's #1 Hotel if they could offer Ritz level service. I would not hold out for that ! Although, I was happy that when I had a pizza delivered, the IC had security escort the delivery person to my door. The hotel is a few blocks from the Silver Line which is a quick bus-ride from the airport. Unless you have a significant amount of luggage, this is a far more efficient way to get to the hotel than a limo, car or taxi. The Silver Line has a dedicated 'subway' that is free from the normal, heavy Boston city traffic. If you secure a discounted rate, I would recommend this hotel enthusiastically, especially for a family vacation or if your only priority is the real-estate. If you desire the 'full' experience, or seek a get-away holiday for two, skip the Intercontinental.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible...I should file a lawsuit!!”
Reviews.Author: 200NitesAYear
Reviews.Content: I was extremely disappointed with my hotel room. The lobby and location were good. The hotel has 2 on-site restaurants. One of the restaurants is a sushi bar (if you like sushi). I love sushi. The food was good but the service was poor. The front desk host talked to me like I was there to clean the floors. I was dressed down and maybe I just looked simple minded. I finally had to end the conversation before he dumbed it down any further. That was the beginning of a horrible stay. A rude experience with the front desk can ruin any trip. In this case, that's what happened. I also wasn't impressed with my room. Let me preface these comments by saying that I'm a member of this hotel's frequent quest program. I stay at their sister properties all the time. However, this property was just not up to par. The hotel itself (being clean, spacious, excellent location, concierge etc) are all there. However, I called the front desk and asked if long distance calls were free. I was told they were $1/min. I later discovered that I'd been given the wrong info regarding the long distance rates. The rude service and misinformation given by the front desk absolutely made me hate this place. I was glad to leave and will not return. I should have left a complaint with the manager. I should invest in a PR campaign to embarass them and bring attention to their crass attitudes!! I may post a video on youtube that re-creates my bad experience with them. If you're a minority, you may not enjoy this "good 'ol boy" establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Intercontinental Boston for the Weekend”
Reviews.Author: KeepItLight
Reviews.Content: I booked a stay at the Intercontinental Boston for a Saturday night the first weekend in May. Upon arrival, I was pleased to hear that I could check in early, especially since I had arrived in Boston very early on a red-eye from the West Coast. The check-in process was smooth, quick, and uneventful. I quickly went up to my room which was spacious and very comfortable. The view wasn't spectacular (a construction site), but I wasn't bothered since: 1) I booked the room at a VERY good price; 2) it was the weekend, so there was no construction going on; and 3) I didn't come to Boston to stare out of my hotel window. Overall, I found the staff to be patient and attentive. They were more than happy to accommodate any requests/questions. I did not have a chance to enjoy any of the restaurants located within the hotel, but if I can book a room at the Intercontinental Boston for the price I obtained the first time I will definitely be there again...soon!

Reviews.Title: “Modern and upscale but lacking in some areas”
Reviews.Author: lilzeppelin
Reviews.Content: Room was large, with a modern design, spacious layout, great lighting, and flat-panel TV. The bathroom had a tub and a separate shower. There was no view, our window faced another building, we could hear delivery trucks in the morning, and loud bangs of the doors by the service people. On the first night there was no turn-down service (it was Sunday), on the second day room service did not leave enough toiletries (they said they ran out of them). The biggest disadvantage was the lack of in-room tea/coffee maker. Front-desk informed us that they are available to rent for 30$ per stay, and the reason for their absence was that the hotel was trying to position itself as a luxury brand on par with Ritz-Carlton and Four Seasons. A note about the gym - it is pretty spacious and has good equipment. There is also a small pool. Location is good with a short walking distance to South Water station, and 15 min walk to Tremont Street. A number of coffee shops, including Peet's and Starbucks are in the adjacent business district, and there is a good seafood restaurant across the bridge from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: Globe24/7
Reviews.Content: We booked via Hotwire ($150/night) for a long weekend which was great value given what that the hotel requested when contacted directly. The rooms are a good size, clean and have a large and well equipped bathrooms. The service is generally good and the hotel has a spa area with pool and gym. The whole design is very "corporate" and lacks any warmth but the hotel does make for a good base from which to explore. The location is not quite city centre but Boston is small and it is only a short cab ride anywhere or the T station is a 3 minute walk from the hotel. The only complaint would be the awful bar area. The decoration is more TGI Fridays than that of a 5 star hotel and the ambience is almost non-existant. We only had one drink here and that was enough for the whole trip.

Reviews.Title: “Good property - poor service”
Reviews.Author: TheBeholder
Reviews.Content: The property is new and nice - rooms are large and well decorated, bathroom design is excellent. Beds and linen are sub-par. The service is, in my opinion, poor. The ability to deal with customers' requests with finesse leaving the customer satisfied distinguishes a high-class property from a run-of-the-mill tourist hotel. I felt that Intercontinental lacked the finesse whatsoever. Judge yourself - the front desk wasn't able to fulfill our (advance) request for a queen or king bed room; the front desk manager told us that if we booked the room directly (I booked the room through Expedia) then they would honour the requested room preference. Regardless the relationship between the hotel and Expedia (I'll follow up with Expedia if I have time), we arrived at 9am, get into the room at 3pm, and the front desk made no effort to accommodate our preferences. I called the room service and asked if they could lend me scissors - they said that they didn't have any scissors. I was speechless. The morning newspaper advertised on the hotel website never arrived. My conclusion - if you're lucky and don't need any assistance, Intercontinental is an OK place to stay (provided that you can get a good deal). Don't expect 4-5 star service and if you pay, for one reason or another, full price for the room then you'll be better off elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “careful with room you book”
Reviews.Author: dowr
Reviews.Content: MY huband and myself and 2 children stayed her for 4 nights, unfortunately our roomj was diredtly facing intgo an office at the side of the building,; there was very little daylight getting through even if the curtains were pulled. We had to be careful gettiing dressed etc as the office staff were directly liiking into our room and us at them vica versa. it was a most uncomfortable situation, make sure to book a harbour view room in this hotel.I thought our 4 night stay would never end, we asked on a few occassions for another room, but were told there was nothing available as the hotel was heavily booked with conferences. We would have gladly paid extra money for another room. The side of the building we were staying in was directly facing office staff who I must assume are very uncomfortable with the situation also.if the curtains are partially opened watching people getting dressed, lying in bed, what a ridiculous situation and pay hundreds of dollars per night, certainly not in my opinion 4/5 star accommodation standard. My children would forget and keep opening the curtains, an awkard situation really.

Reviews.Title: “What a Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Capezio7
Reviews.Content: The rooms at the Intercontinental are nothing short of luxurious. We stayed on the 12th floor in a corner king deluxe suite and the room was amazing. The soaking tub and tiled shower were beautiful. The plasma TV and comfortable bedding was also very nice. We were very impressed with the room service. The food was great, and they actually brought a small table into our room so that we had our own private dining table right there in our room. There were only a few drawbacks for us. The hotel does not include a continental breakfast with the price of the room and there were no coffee makers in the rooms. Also, the hotel is directly across the street from the fire department and one of the nights that we stayed it seemed like there were emergencies (i.e. sirens) at least 4 times throughout the night. FYI: The cost of wireless internet when we stayed was $6.95 for an hour, $14.95 for 24 hours, and $40 per week. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Place but Lacks Top-Notch Service”
Reviews.Author: Jess_T
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I went to stay a couple of nights to check things out because we were looking at their function room to get married. The hotel was just built in 2006, and it's a great location - right on the harbor, next to South Station and the New England Aquarium, and close to the North End and Fanueil Hall/Quincy Market. We were upgraded to the suite for one night, which was beautiful. Views of the water and the city - floor to ceiling windows in the bedroom and the living room. Nice, new plasma t.v.'s in the bedroom and living room. The main bathroom was great with tub, nice shower, L'Occitane products, bathrobes for both, etc. The second night we stayed in a "regular room," and that was a scaled-down version of the suite. Vey nice with tub in the bathroom, nice plasma, etc. BUT...What I have to say about this hotel is that they are MAJORLY LACKING in customer service! Our waiter at the restaurant was very strange, he barely knew how to deal with "vegetarians." He was all confused becuase the menu was set that night because we were part of teh Valentine's day package. He didn't know how to get around it, and was a little flustered by the whole thing. The people answering the phones there are not very professional. They don't do the "Hi Mr./Mrs. so and so, this is so in so, how may I help you?" It was just basically a "hello". And, it was evident that most of the people did not take pride in their job or even care. There was a kind of attitude and unprofessionalism that we got from several different people that answered the phone. 2 out of the 3 times we called to get coffee, they forgot to bring both milk adn cream, which we explicitly asked for. The room service food was pretty good quality, but a bit expensive (though standard and comperable to a Marriott). I had two treatments at the spa - a 1 hr massage and a wrap/hydrotherapy treatment. The massage was average (I'm a regular to massages, and I usually get them when I stay at hotels with spas). But, it was nothing to write home about. The wrap/hydroptherapy was done but an extremely nice & very good at what she did. She was great in applying the treatment cream that went under the wrap. However, I was not warned that the cream was going to make my body feel like I was in a ICE BATH!! I was FREEZING while sitting there under the wrap. All I could think about was please, get me outta here. I couldn't relax, and it seemed like it took forever for her to come back, unwrap me, and for me to get in the tub. Even after I sat in the tub for a couple of minutes, I could not get the chill out. I think it was called the "deluxe wrap/hydrotherapy treatment," adn I definitely would suggest NOT getting it. This was the first time (I have done at least 5 or 6 wraps) that I was so uncomfortable while in a wrap. The last thing I would say about the spa is that the showers are good, the stream room is pretty nice, but I would have liked to have the waiting area be gender segregated. Although, it was nice to see my fiance in there, but I think you would be more comfortable sitting with all women in your robe. The lighting, music and atmosphere was very nice and peaceful. In short, I would not stay there again (or have my wedding there) becuase I don't think they provide the level of customer service I expect out of a mid to high-end hotel. I feel like they put a lot of money into building a beautiful hotel and getting the atmosphere right, but they have completely abandoned paying for and/or managing quality people to provide the serivce, care and expertise that you deserve when staying in this type of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Luxe, Just Take The T”
Reviews.Author: BizTravelDC
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Intercontinental from March 26 â€“ 28, 2008 for business. The directions on the confirmation form for the website left out an important note to continue straight when you get off Interstate 93. Net result, a 15 minute delay in getting to the hotel. The title of my post indicates that I am not a fan of driving in Boston. One wrong turn and you will suffer the consequences of an extremely long delay. Be forewarned, if you do not need a car, take the T. I went to school in Massachusetts, am from New York City, live in DC and am therefore familiar with big city driving. That said, the single direction roadways and lack of street signs in Boston can result in a high degree of frustration. In any event, got to the hotel, left the car for valet service and went into the hotel. Check in was quick and pleasant. The rooms are extremely high end. Big plasma TV, nice business lay out for the desk and comfortable bedding. The bathrooms, as other posts have pointed out, is large and chock full of amenities such as a soaking tub, glassed in shower, and plenty of room around the sink. Good turn down service as well. The bar was high end, and known for its rum selection. Nice touch, but a little pricey. Mojitos were $14. The only negative was the valet parking. I read other reviews that indicated that having to go down to the garage to drive your car out was a pain. I generally did not think it would be that bad. Wrong. You cannot call down to have your car pulled out (at least no one told me you could do that, they indicated you had to come down to get your car) and the first morning, it took a good 15 â€“ 20 minutes for them to get my car because they had a conference going on and were getting a lot of cars pulling in. In addition, I had to get on 93 North after pulling out of the lot (far left of the four lane Atlantic Ave), which is hard to do at 8:25 AM in downtown Boston. Then, upon my return, the entire front driveway was packed with valet cars and cabs. In order to get off Atlantic Ave, I had to pull into the valet garage myself and wait in a line for about 15 minutes for them to take my keys and send me to room. In sum, the parking, like the driving in Boston, was a real hassle. Both evenings, I left the car in the garage, and took the T or cabs. Much better. In sum, the hotel is fantastic. Leave your car elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Grey-Hat
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here on business for four nights. Check in was fast and efficient as was the check out. I had an eleventh floor room, the view wasn't anything special but it was quiet. The room was very spacious with two double beds, flat screen, mini-bar, Internet, desk, safe, iron etc. The finish in the room was to a good standard, the hotel was completed end of 2006. The bathroom was also very nice with seperate walk in shower, bath, large sink area, bathrobes etc. The main bar area (Rum-Ba) was always quite busy at night with a good atmosphere. They also have a small sushi bar in a separate location in the hotel but always busy. The main restaurant (only had breakfast) seemed reasonable and I understand it is 24*7. Didn't use the leisure facilities but walked past and it looked good. I had no complaints about the hotel and would certainly stay there again. As always it depends what you want and how much you want to pay!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Property!”
Reviews.Author: Mousy
Reviews.Content: My teenage daughter and I stayed here while visiting my niece. I got a package deal from Priceline for 3 nights and airfare from DC for $700 - which came out to be about $140 a night. We loved the staff. They were quite friendly. The rooms were very clean and nicely decorated. The bathrooms were very nice and large! The only problem was the shower had no hot water the 2nd two mornings we were there - the first was barely tolerable but I was able to use it - the other two I used the hand held shower in the bath tub and the way it is designed - not to be a shower - the water ran down the back edge onto the floor and luckily didn't make it quite to the carpet in the main part of the room. Other than that one small issue - this place was amazing! They gave us a corner room - plenty of light in the morning - which was nice! We ate dinner one night at the Miel restaurant at the hotel. That was delicious! I had lobster raviolie - was great! Only a couple blocks to a 7-11 for whatever you might need and a really good cafe was a couple blocks down as well - Rudi's - a Panera Bread was across the street from the cafe also - which was a nice Panera - with a fireplace. Quincy Market nearby and the T was only about 2 blocks away. I would defniitely stay here again and recommend it to others!

Reviews.Title: “One of best hotels I've stayed in”
Reviews.Author: ktco2002
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel. Only open a few months when I stayed there. I believe it opened late 2006. Great looking from the outside and in. Comfy beds and nice bathrooms. Lots of extras- stand up shower plus a separate bathtub and a scale in the bathroom. Nice mood lighting on the wall of the room. The only thing that wasn't great was the view from my room. It was on the side of the building and overlooked another building. Other rooms would have better views- either of the city or water. Walking along the water is very nice too. Not far from Fanuiel Hall area either. Check out the giant lobsters at the wholesale store a few blocks away. Biggest lobsters I've ever seen.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: DrewKnightWV
Reviews.Content: I recently had the opportunity to stay at the Intercontinental while in Boston overnight on business. The Intercontinental was one of several high-end hotels on my company's "preferred" list, but it was the only one I had not previously stayed at, and it was close to the site of my meetings. The Intercontinental is a new property, built (oddly enough) around the ugly Central Artery Tunnel discharge stacks. Its lovely location right on the harbor is hard to beat, and the hotel manages a very pleasant balance between modern chic and real luxury, without going over the top in either direction. The public spaces are spare but attractive, with discrete sitting areas along the main corridor and what looked like a very attractive bar, Rhumba (which is well-reviewed by friends, but I didn't have time to check it out). My room was very nicely appointed, with simply lined dark-wood furnishings, an opulent and very comfortable bathroom, and a wide-screen LCD TV (though the actual cable signal is analog and rather disappointing). As several other reviewers have noted, I was surprised to find two double beds instead of the King I thought I reserved through Orbitz, but since they also "dumped" my no-smoking preference, I suspect Orbitz, not the hotel might have been to blame. About the bed: I guess I have been spoiled by too many nights in Marriott properties in the last year, but this sucker was on the hard side, and the sheets and pillows were a step down from even your run-of-the-mill Courtyard (where they have really got the plush-bed religion). In spite of the location (by the harbor, on the Central Artery, close to the fire station), the room was hushed and comfortable all night long. Overall, I found the Intercontinental Boston to be an extremely pleasant hotel in a sensational location, for a competitive price. I would recommend it heartily to those traveling on business and wanting to be close to the Financial or Seaport districts, or for leisure travelers willing to spend a little more for a very nice room.

Reviews.Title: “Great harbor area hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pretzellogix
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have now stayed at this Intercontinental several times. We really like the classy room decor, the location near long wharf and Quincy Market, and the great bars/restaurants right on the premises. The spa/work out area are amazing, and we make a point of working out at least twice during each stay. The views are neat, and the equipment is top notch. The steam room is an added bonus. We have had drinks/food at RhumBa, Sushi-Teq, and Miel, as well as room service. On all occasions the food was great and the drinks were amazing. An added bonus are the champagne parties they throw in the lobby on the first Saturday night of every month. The rooms are comfy, and well designed. The bathrooms are truly spacious and well made. The only problem we could fathom is the "divider" between the bathroom and bedroom. Shy types may have an issue with this. I agree with the other reviews that the valet car pick-up is poorly designed, and that going down to the parking lot should not be a part of the experience. The cars should be brought to the front of the hotel like everywhere else. Aside from that, and occasionally surly staff, this hotel is great! We will definitely keep staying here, at least until the Mandarin Oriental opens in July.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: newy0rkcitygirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights this Easter weekend and loved it. Lobby was chic, front desk staff inviting. They had a great "champagne & rum" bar teeming with nightlife, reminiscent of a trendy Manhattan lounge. There was a great pool and workout area with all the accommodations of an athletic club and then some. You can jog on the treadmills while overlooking the streets of Boston. The rooms were large and accommodating, they definitely have the best bathroom I've seen in any hotel! My only complaint of the room was the lack of a coffee maker (an absolute necessity for all caffeine addicts in search of a morning 'pick me up'...! ). They offer free coffee in the lobby, however, only available between the hours of 5am and 7am.....what!! I sure wasn't getting up that early.... But other than that this hotel was a GREAT. Location is key and they get 5 stars for that. There are many restaurants/shopping within walking distance, the red line subway system, and tourist attractions as the back of the hotel overlooks the Boston harbor, right where the Boston Tea Party took place. Another tip is that when your arrive, they offer to valet your car to a parking garage which will cost you about $40 a night. Bypass this tempting offer and make a right at the first corner after the hotel, there are parking lots for about $11 right over the bridge. I will definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who is visiting Boston and wants to be treated right.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Travel_cush
Reviews.Content: As our first time in Boston we just guessed at where to stay, we were extremely happy with the Intercontinental hotel. The room was very large and the bathroom was wonderful, both shower and tub were perfect. Everything was super clean and the stay was more than comfortable. The staff were very helpful with directions and it is only a 5 minute walk to the red line. I would recommend this hotel to pretty much anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the InterContinental”
Reviews.Author: Shelbs97
Reviews.Content: Eight of us girls stayed here for the night while in Boston for a Bachelorette Party. We booked two rooms on Hotwire and got a great price. Upon arriving, our vehicles were valet parked and we proceeded to the front desk for check in. We requested smoking rooms b/c some of us smoke and the woman at the front desk said there was only one floor of smoking rooms and they would happily put us there. In fact, she said that because we were willing to have both rooms on that floor, that she would upgrade one of the rooms to a suite at no charge! (I think they have a hard time filling the smoking rooms maybe. Regardless, we were happy w/ the free upgrade.) The lobby area was nice and open and very clean. The two rooms weren't as close together as we would have liked, BUT, that was okay, because we all hung out in the suite anyway. The suite was a HUGE living room with nice decor, flat screen TV, which led to a door that opened to a small entry way to the bedroom. To the left was a spectaculor bathroom. I agree with the other reviews when they say how great the bathroom is. To the right was a large walk in closet. Straight ahead was a good size bedroom with a king bed. The only thing that I didn't like about the bedroom was the sliders above the bed that opened into the bathroom and you could hear everything in the bathroom. I wouldn't have cared if I was with my boyfriend, but with a group of girls staying, in the middle of the night every single time the toilet flushed it would wake you up. We did have a few drinks at the Rumba Bar. I thought the atmosphere was nice but also thought the drinks were overpriced. I agree with the previous post that said that getting your car back from valet at the end of your stay isn't set up very well. It's not a classy set up at all, compared to the rest of the hotel. Overall, I'd stay here again if we could get a good price on Hotwire. I didn't think the regular room (not the suite) would be worth over $400 a night. Especially since this location isn't as great as being over in Copley Square.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel Sushi-teq a hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: lovetravel713
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was Beautiful! I went for a weekend trip and wished i could stay longer. Our room was on a high floor with a nice view. The bed was very comfortable. The staff was very accomodating. The restaurant sushi-teq was delicious. I never though the combo of sushi and margaritas would taste so good. The blood orage-strawberry was my fave! And the eel avacado melts in your mouth. I hope to return soon!

Reviews.Title: “Best Bathroom Ever”
Reviews.Author: shawnandlala
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our anniversary. The room was tastfully decorated and had one of the best bathrooms I have ever seen. One issue we did not like was the impression of valet parking which it's not, you did have valet parking upon arrival but at checkout you were instructed to proceed through the hotel to an elevator which took you the basement garage were you presented your ticket to an attendent in a parking booth. They were very unorganized and took approx 5 min to retrieve our car while standing with all of our luggage in the parking garage, Not exactly my idea of valet parking. The lounge was nice although trying to get the waitresses attention was difficult and it was not even busy. Overall the hotel was very nice and in close walking distance to the North End and Fanueil Hall.

Reviews.Title: “Just shy of greatness”
Reviews.Author: danwer930
Reviews.Content: I got a great rate through Hotwire at this major new hotel during the middle of winter, aka the "Low Season", of $129/night. Even the full rate was only $245, which for a hotel in this category in a city as popular as Boston is pretty reasonable. Overall I recommend the hotel, but let me review some of the pros and cons. PROS: 1) ROOM. We were booked into a standard king room. While the actual usable space of the room was a bit smaller and boxier than I expected, it was certainly comfortably sized, and the bathroom is enormous (see number 2). Design-wise, there were a few cheap-feeling fixtures, but overall the Intercontinental has succeeded in creating a room that is distinctly modern but not cold or sterile-feeling like a lot of other newer hotels. Wood furniture and colorful walls help keep it homey. Lighting was both excellent and innovative (all kinds of bright and dim mood-type lighting options around the bed and work areas, plus lots of recessed lighting in the entrance hallway). Workdesk was spacious with easy outlets (although I was expecting something like an aeron chair, and instead it was a more basic deskchair). Flatscreen was like every other flatscreen and worked well, with a massive selection of cable channels. 2) BATHROOM. This is really the best part of the room and maybe the entire hotel. They really went out of their way on these. Absolutely massive, with beautiful lighting and tilework, spacious glass shower and separate bathtub, fixtures, bath amenities, etc. And of course the fun little extra that everyone mentions - two small sliding doors open up between the bathroom and bedroom area. I wish my home bathroom was a fraction as nice as this! If you're someone who relishes your time in the shower in the morning, this is undoubtedly the Boston hotel for you. 3)BAR. I'm used to hotel bars being either really bland or overly pompous. The hotel's signature bar, RumBa, is easily accessed right off the lobby, which immediately creates a welcoming, easygoing but classy vibe for one and all. This was reflected in the clientele, which was made up of every kind of person imaginable, young and old, casual and more formal. Also they have genuinely created a cool concept that would be worth visiting all by itself - a bar with an emphasis on dozens of rare rums and champagnes (far more rums than champagnes though). Pricey but not as bad as you might think for such rarities! Service was speedy even on a very busy Saturday night, and despite the crowds, it was easy enough to find a seat, relax and have a conversation without screaming. This is one of the best hotel bars I've ever seen. Also, honorable mentions for the hallways, which are beautifully decorated and inviting, and the elevators, which were huge and always available to us within seconds. CONS: 1) LOCATION. Boston is such a small city that there's really no such thing as "bad location". However the Intercontinental is located in the new Waterfront district, an area that only really came into existence as a result of the tunneling of I-93 in the "big dig" which was completed a few years ago. So what you have in this area is a lot of construction and new office buildings. The area is definitely lacking in the cozy New England-type charm that you get in most other areas of the center city. It's also on the edge of the downtown core, so it's a fair 10-15 minute walk to Fanueil Hall, and areas such as Newbury Street and Beacon Hill are really more of a cab or T-ride away. On the plus side, the lovely South Station is really close, so the T, Amtrak, etc. are within very easy reach. Still, you won't feel the real cobblestone-and-colonial charm of Boston in the immediate vicinity of this hotel, nor will you find the hotel to be "right next door" to anything special. 2) LOBBY. There are a number of good elements to the lobby - cool music, little nooks with bookshelves, the above-mentioned bar - but overall, it just doesn't hang together well and doesn't give a great first impression. It feels overly minimalist, and somewhat like the entrance to an office building (which is exactly what it looks like on the outside). I know this isn't a big deal for most people, but it was still disappointing for a hotel of this stature. 3) ROOM NOISE. The large exterior windows of our room were definitely double-glazed and quiet, but we could hear noise from adjacent rooms, even from the room upstairs! This was surprising given how new this hotel is and the insulation options they must've had available during construction. If you're a light sleeper, you should definitely take this into consideration. Overall, if you're looking for a thoroughly contemporary hotel, luxurious and modern rooms, and don't mind walking to, rather than being immersed in, the Boston you've seen and read about, the Intercontinental is an excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “Classy new Boston landmark”
Reviews.Author: Kines
Reviews.Content: I had a lovely stay at the Intercontinental in January. It's a classy new hotel with stunning architecture when viewed from the waterfront, and is a great landmark for Boston. Inside the foyer is huge, restaurant/bars areas tastefully designed and staff were attentive. The rooms are as spacious as I've ever stayed in and the sliding partition between the bathroom and bedroom areas a nice touch. It's possible to watch TV converse with somene while relaxing in the bath for example. Having a separate bath and shower is a also big plus for me. The hotel is close to the Italian areas in North Boston so there are lots of little restaurants etc that have more character that I've seen in other areas of the city.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL PET FRIENDLY HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Calvin_Anna
Reviews.Content: My husband and I love Boston so for valentines day we decided to come here for the week end and bring two of our dogs. Well this was an absolutelly wonderful place for all of us. the hotel is pet friendly, and i mean everyone was loving our dogs from front desk agents to room service servers. They even have a place in the back where you can walk the dogs. Upon check in we were upgraded to a junior suit which was great, the room is impecable, huge and comfortable. The bathroom is one of the best ones i have ever seen and you can see straight to the room. We ordered room service when we got in, that was 1am at night and the service was fast and curtious. We had the most delicious foccacia with procutto and brie.... trust me when i say DELICIOUS. all the other times we ordered breakfast and the service again was wonderful. we both work for hotels and thought this place absolutelly exceeded our expectations. the only downside was the parking garage, during check out time it easily takes you at least 30 min to get your car. other then that this place is 10 our of 10.

Reviews.Title: “Bad first impression”
Reviews.Author: familyfebruary08
Reviews.Content: We are going to stay at this hotel this weekend with our baby. We've just called the customer service to ask if there is any way to warm our baby food in the hotel (e.g., microwave, etc). The answer was a plain NO and THERE IS NO WAY TO WARM YOUR BABY FOODS HERE, and they don't seem to even care that our baby won't be able to get warm food during our stay, and it's below freezing out.... We are not impressed by this kind of impersonal, indifferent attitudes towards their guests.

Reviews.Title: “Did not want to leave”
Reviews.Author: tmarcone
Reviews.Content: Being a business traveler it takes a lot to wow me in a hotel - the Intercontinental Boston did just that. It is brand new with all of the bells and whistles you do not see in most aged hotels. Rooms were state of the art with flat screen TV's, large bathroom with galss enclosed shower as well as stand alone tub, headboard reading lights and other state of the art amenities. The Rumba lobby bar had some atmosphere and grat cocktails. There is also a sushi/tequilla bar (strange combo) that I did not visit. The staff was A+ and helpful with the exception of one cocktail waitress (but we all have bad days don't we?). Fitness center was 100% new and very impressive - better than some helath clubs I have been to. Only complaint was that it is located across from Boston Fire 13 so you will get blaring sirens in the middle of the night.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, a few minor "ehs"”
Reviews.Author: Belasaria
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Intercontinental as part of a conference in Boston and had a fantastic rate ($189/night). Upon arriving, the bell staf was exceptionally helpful with my luggage and directing me to the registration desk. My registration took longer than usual, mainly because I was having credit card issues. The hotel is within walking distance of the Seaport World Trade Center; they are building the area up so it's not the desolate destination it used to be. I didn't venture out too much to see what restaurants were in walking distance because it was very cold outside. The room was outstanding. Spacious, modern and very clean. The bathroom was enormous for a hotel in Boston, including a deep tub, glass-enclosed shower, and plenty of counter space. What was most appealing was the opening between the bathroom and the sleeping area. There were opaque doors that could be slid closed for privacy and the opening was above the king sized bed, but it opened up the room so nicely! Granted, I was solo for this trip so it being open wasn't an issue. The work area was outstanding. A large desk that had plenty of outlets was a relief since I was there on business and had to setup my printer and laptop, etc. However the $14.95/day for internet access was frustratingly outrageous. Housekeeping was very good and I didn't have trouble with them knocking at odd times. Room service was good, always giving me a time when they were going to arrive. Within the hotel, there is a sushi bar, a rum bar, and a bistro restaurant that is open 24 hours. The sushi bar is nice but very expensive, the regular bar is very loud and usually packed, and the restaurant was surprisingly empty. However, the food at the restaurant was outstanding as well as the service; the prices were high as well. I also had a business meeting there that I planned with their staff. The food was outstanding, the meeting room great, and the staff really worked hard to make this small, simple meeting go well. The reason this hotel doesn't rate a full five stars: * 14.95/night for internet is outrageous. * there was no guest services book in my room but it did have a room service menu. I had no idea where the business center or the gym were or their hours. I had to ask a few times. Finding the business center was a bit tricky since the signs weren't all that helpful. It's a small thing, sure, but not having that info handy was annoying. * the business center. Wow. This is NOT run by the Intercontinental, instead contracted out. The fees they charge for delivery boxes was the highest I've had to pay -- $85 for four boxes. Yes, one of them was heavy but it had rollers! The staff ranged from helpful to belligerent. The hours for the center were NOT posted outside the door. I tried to drop off packages on a Sunday morning because I had been told they were open at 8 a.m. Wrong. They opened at 10 a.m. I managed to flag down a person who worked for the Intercontinental to help me but the person didn't seem all that interested in assisting a hotel guest. Still, I would definitely stay here again if I were attending a conference at the Seaport.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mrbigjerk
Reviews.Content: Overcoming a rocky start due to a reservation mix-up, the Intercontinental Boston won us over with their professional, courteous staff, and a clean, well maintained, comfortable property. Our "Harbor View" room was exceptionally clean, modern and visually interesting. The room featured a nice flat screen television, high quality bedding, a nice work area, your typical over priced "mini-bar" and unique features like special "accent" lighting alongside the bed. The furnishings and carpeting looked new, and the in room artwork gave the room some personality. Hallway and adjoining room noise were minimal, despite the fact our room was next to the ice machine. While technically you could see the Boston Harbor from the window if you contorted and leaned properly, charging extra money for such a limited view seemed gouging. Likewise, the $14.95 a day for in room wi-fi internet seemed a bit steep as well. One interesting feature of the room was the separation between the sleeping area and bathroom. In this case, the two areas were separated by a half wall behind the bed, which featured two sliding frosted glass/wood panels. While it gave the room a modern feel, I would guess that persons with bathroom privacy issues may be uncomfortable. The bathroom itself was ultra clean and large, featuring a deep tub and a glass shower enclosure. I especially appreciated the fact the shower head was over 6 ft. high, with nice water pressure! Complimentary bath products and plush robes were also provided. The hotel lobby provided ample seating areas, and the hotel offers an array of dining/drinking options. We did not visit the pool/spa area, but we were told by other guests it was nice, but not fancy. Hotel staff were pleasant and helpful, even calling our room the first night to inquire if we needed anything to make our stay more enjoyable. While not the most centrally located hotel for Historic Boston, the "South Station - T" stop is a short three minute walk away. From there you can access most attractions within the city in a matter of minutes, including taking the "Silver Line" back to Logan Airport. My wife and I bought $9 all day passes for the "T", easily figured out the route system and which trains to take, and quickly became "T" pros. All in all, I would certainly stay at the Intercontinental Boston again! It's clean, comfortable, safe and quiet...with a efficient, knowledgable staff intent on making your stay enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Great overnight stay!”
Reviews.Author: MEM2986
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on a Saturday overnight to celebrate a birthday. We booked the hotel using priority points, so we paid nothing for a top floor room overlooking the city. That may have factored into how much I loved it! We had a great time, and the hotel was perfect. The staff were very friendly and helpful. My husband mentioned it was my birthday and room service delivered a slice of chocolate cake with "Happy Birthday" written on the plate in chocolate, within a half-hour of check-in - on behalf of the hotel. A sweet touch. The room was large, included two walls with windows overlooking the city, which was actually prettier than the harbor view I thought. The bathroom was large and 4 piece, a deep tub separate from the glass enclosed shower. You couldn't see the flat screen from the tub though (but if you could, I probably would have wasted too much time in there!). The gym was great - all new equipment, plenty of room, and the treadmills all faced a wall of glass overlooking the city. The gym also provided plenty of amenities - bottled water, towels, toiletries and disposable razors. The hotel bar was very cool - leather couches and chairs, fireside - drinks were pricey and the late night crowd was the "beautiful people" - but it was fun for us to people-watch for a drink or two. The location is easy walking to Quincy Market. We met friends for drinks there and then walked to the North End for an amazing dinner at La Summa on Fleet Street. Overall, our one night stay was perfect for a night away from the kids. If you can get a deal like we did - even better!

Reviews.Title: “best stay in Boston so far”
Reviews.Author: doorstomanual
Reviews.Content: I stay in Boston regularly for business (generally for one night at a time) and have stayed at a range of the city's hotels over time, including in the main business area and on the water - and the Inter set new levels for me. I was upgraded to a harbour view room, which helped, but every impression was positive, from the front desk staff to the room fittings and layout to room service and check out. It felt like a four seasons, although the large lobby was slightly impersonal (but still very well handled, for such a large space). Check-in/check-out was polite and efficient and there was no issue with adding to bags in store or changing in the gym prior to heading off to the airport. Rooms have been laid out with a lot of thought and attention to detail, especially for fittings and lighting + bathrooms are great + sliding window to bathroom helps add space. Only negative for me was the overly soft water, but I live in a hard water area, so maybe I notice it more. Room service timely and high quality. With the dig now over, access by foot from the main downtown business and/or shopping area is easy, despite the waterfront location. Can't comment on the restaurants/bars this time. Overall, a great addition to Boston's hotels and I look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great gym”
Reviews.Author: AndrewW2
Reviews.Content: Best thing about the hotel are the rooms and most certainly the gym and spa area. The rooms are very large and generously furnished. The oversized bathrooms are very nice and well equipped. My bathroom was also spotless and had a great shower and tub area. The TV is a nice flat screen and the views of the city were quite nice. A previous review mentioned the fire station and despite being on the 9th floor, I hardly notice when the fire trucks were dispatched which must have only been twice (that I heard) over my one week stay. The gym is fantastic and probably one of the best gyms I have ever used in a hotel. There are a good choice of cardio machines, including about 5 treadmills and 5 cross trainers. The gym apparently offers classes as well which are included in the free admission for hotel guests. There are also a good variety of free weights and weight machines. The staff were very helpful and showed me the nice steam room and relaxation area where the treatment rooms for the spas are located. Free water, towels, headphones and fruit were also available. Best of all it is 24 hours. I didn't try the pool but it looked great. The restaurant was OK but not entirely 5 stars or what you'd expect from a hotel of this calibur. Portions were very American (ie quite good) but nothing seemed particularly special. Suprisingly there was only a very meagre breakfast buffet of fruits, pastries and cereals. Perhaps there is not enough demand (the hotel didn't seem to busy) so maybe this was seasonal? Otherwise, the service in the restaurant was good. Hotel staff seemed friendly but it was frustrating that it seemed that there was never more than one person at the reception desk meaning that one always had to wait. Otherwise the hotel staff were good. Wifi access was excellent and a reasonable charge of 40$ for one whole week. Wifi coverage was excellent, including seamless from lobby, restaurant to room. I just had the overall feeling that the hotel nickel and dimed you at most chances. There seemed to be additional fees on everything such as a delivery charge and then tax and then gratuity on room service. Then, no reminder or notice that gratuity was already included once food is delivered. I had some packages from Amazon delivered to the hotel and before ordering them and after receiving them, no one told me that there was any fees for this. In the end, I got stuck with a 46$ bill which was a big surprise. That was pretty lousy. At check-out, my colleague was checking out one day earlier and they insisted on charging him for an extra night stay. This is after our entire bill for three people came well over $5000. It took the Duty Manager to come and remove this charge. Poor discretion or empowerment of the front desk staff. Otherwise a good hotel but I would consider another one of the large chains closer to the shopping areas, including Newbury Street for my next stay in Boston. Andrew Wong

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Downtown Hotel”
Reviews.Author: letsbookitandgo
Reviews.Content: LOCATION We stayed at the InterContinental Boston for 4 days over the Thanksgiving Day Weekend with our 2 children, 6 & 7 yrs old and had a wonderful time. We picked this hotel because of the great offer through TravelZoo ($169/nite) and it's location to the Children's Museum, New England Aquarium, Fanueil Hall, and the downtown shops on Washington Street. Everything was within walking distance. Plus it's a brand new hotel! ROOM We had a harborview room that was absolutely beautiful and the only tiny complaint I had about the room was that it didn't have a mini coffee maker. (You can get a cup of coffee for $2.00 from the hotel restaurant, Miel, or go off site to the nearby Starbucks, across from South Street Station.) BREAKFAST/LUNCH/DINNER If you are traveling with kids, you may want to go to Finagle A Bagel or Panera Bread for breakfast rather than the hotel restaurant (Miel) in the lobby because it is a little pricey. For lunch or dinner, we would definitely recommend the Legal Seafoods Restaurant across from the New England Aquarium, 10-15 minute walk from hotel. Call ahead for reservations. There's also a 7-Eleven (I think that's the name of it) a few blocks from hotel if you are looking to buy snacks for the kids and/or for yourself. POOL The hotel has a very nice indoor pool on the 2nd floor that the kids loved and the big glass windows give you a nice view of the city buildings. Remember to bring flip flops since the pool floor can get very wet. The pool is next to the spa/fitness room. PARKING Parking at the hotel was expensive but we knew that it would be - $39/day. We parked at the hotel for the first nite and then moved the car to a nearby outdoor parking lot that was only $10/day (24 hr period). If you take a right out of the hotel, then an immediate right at the next traffic light, you will see an outdoor parking lot on your left. Easy walk back to hotel. Overall, our experience at this hotel was great and we would definitely stay there again. Hope this review was helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: timmycanfly
Reviews.Content: This is a brand new Intercontinent property that is right downtown on the water. Rooms are immaculate with a kooky passthrough that aloughs you to see into the huge mable / travertine bathrooms if you choose. Internet was $40/week. Parking was $38 per night so we parked at a T station $3.50 per 24 hours and took the train in. There are no coffee makers in the rooms as mentioned by others. I don't get it, but it's the way it is. From Logan Airport you simply jump on the silver T line and take it to South Station. The hotel is a block away, VERY easy and convienent. Faneuil Hall is a about a 10 min walk and boston common can reached with a 2 minute ride on the T Walk across the bridge and eat at the Barking Crab...you may have to line up but it will be well worth the wait. Awesome food at reasonable prices and a funky atmosphere. We liked it so much we went back again. I'll deffinately stay here again! -tcf

Reviews.Title: “Frequent the IC Boston”
Reviews.Author: cramerproduction
Reviews.Content: Great hotel Have stayed many times. The staff is hit or miss, it really all depends who is working that day. Stay away from Mieal past 10pm, the food realy gets horrid. Best bet is suchi-tech for a margarita mohito. Club lounge is a must. Great hot snacks at night , with awsome wine selection.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tturner
Reviews.Content: The Intercontinental Hotel in Boston is a brand new hotel that is exactly what you would expect in an Intercontinental Hotel. It was fabulous! It is conveniently located near the waterfront and Fanueil Hall, as well as other Boston landmarks. The lobby is impressive and the RumBa Bar is a happening spot in the evening! We had both breakfast and lunch at their restaurant Miel and it was very good both times. We also had room service which was prompt and the staff was friendly and helpful. The fitness center was a delight with new equipment and you could do both cardio and strength training with everything you need for a decent on the road workout. The bed was comfortable and the pillows were so-so. We had a typical city view with a partial view of the harbor. The bathroom was exceptional with an awesome shower and separate tub. Overall, we were very happy at the Intercontinental and would highly recommend it to travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Crisp and clean”
Reviews.Author: Ezis
Reviews.Content: Although some of our group said hotel misses soul I found it excellent. New and well equipped it has spacious and well planned rooms. There are separate shower and bathtube. Shower cabine is very nice an comfortable. Location of hotel on seafront is conveniente and walking distance to many atractions. Only dissatifaction was visit to pool. It's 1.2 m deep and rather intended for children (actually lot of them here). Changing cabins are away thru the fitness.

Reviews.Title: “Wasn't as Great as I expected....”
Reviews.Author: Capeshmitty
Reviews.Content: check in was long and I expected it because it was a sold out weekend but the desk clerk wasn't so courteous about it. Okay she had a bad day.... Poor appetizer selections at the bar, overpriced drinks BIG time. A basic glass of wine was $14, wow! My room was nice, overlooking fire dept but the room was hot and stuffy and sleeping with the window open was a no go since sirens go off across street. Very noisy neighborhood in general. No hairdryer in room. called concierege to bring one. My hair was dry; still no dryer so I left. By the time I returned to my room at midnight it was there BUT it was broken so next day had to go out with wet hair again. Breakfast, food and service in the Miel restaurant was SLOW! I had to get up and ask a waiter if we could order. The buffet looked so bad my husband put his plate down and ordered from the menu. Long lines at check out too. Again, not what I expected from the newest IHG hotel in Boston. Facility looked nice but there are some serious management issues here that still need work. That's my 2 cents.

Reviews.Title: “Great well equipped hotel”
Reviews.Author: visitorxyz
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a weekend visiting Boston. Hotel is new, clean, well cared for and efficient. Our king room was huge, well equipped and bright, the bathroom was well done too. The gym was great with many weight machines and good cardio equiptment. The pool was very clean and well kept. I ordered room service a couple of times and it was excellent. We didnt eat at the sushi restaurant but friends who did said it was very good. Hotel is located only an 8 minute cab from Bostons Logan Airport and is a quick $10 cab ride from all the shopping/bars/restaurants. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a city break”
Reviews.Author: LisaC22
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fairly new and therefore has very modern furnishings inside. The bedroom was spacious and had everything you could have wanted, including a flat screen TV. The bathroom was very luxurious with a bath and separate shower. However the toilet paper was a bit nasty for a 5 star hotel. The first night we arrive late and decided to eat in their bar called Rumba. The choice of food is limited but the burger was delicious! The waitresses are a little fake, I asked for a diet coke and got an ice tea. I would imagine they are more attentive to the big spenders in the bar. We booked this city break from Last Minute and paid extra for a room with river view however upon arrival were placed in a room facing into the financial district. We asked to be moved and showed them a copy of the reservation from Last Minute but they said there was nothing they could do all rooms were fully booked. So instead we had a view of the fire station. Only 1 night we could hear the sirens going. Just a word of warning they may try to charge you for mini bar items you haven't had. There is a lovely place called Scali diner where you can go and eat breakfast cheaply. It's a 5 min walk from the hotel. Turn left out of the hotel onto the main street and cross the first juction you come to, it will be straight ahead. There is also a 7 eleven near by. Turn right out of the hotel and walk for 10 mins. This is also how you get to Quincy Market just walk a bit further until you reach the aquarium and then cross the street into the city. The hotel is also very close to the Barking Crab restaurant. As the hotel is in the financial district there are a lot of sandwich and coffee shops for commuters but this all shuts down on the weekend and it becomes eerily quiet. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay in Boston and only wish I had stayed a few more days. Whilst there you should definitely go to: - Quincy Market, the Aquarium, have a cocktail at the top of Prudential tower, go on a Duck Tour, learn how to take a lobster apart and walk the freedom trail.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic room”
Reviews.Author: TravelBear12
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Intercontinental for a long weekend, Oct. 19 - 22, and loved it. We commented how it was one of the nicest hotel rooms we've stayed in. (Though we generally don't stay in luxury hotels -- we just happen to get a decent rate, $170/nt, through Priceline.) The room seemed newly decorated and spotless. We liked the layout -- there's a sliding window between the bathroom and the bedroom so, like others have mentioned, you can watch the flat-screen TV from the bathtub. A few small quibbles: One of the outlets in the bathroom didn't work and I couldn't figure out how to work the landline phone.. We didn't eat at the hotel, but we did try out the main bar two of the nights. Drinks are pricey, but service was friendly. And it was pretty quiet and easy to find a seat at the bar both nights. While not the most convenient hotel in Boston, we were able to walk just about everywhere in the city we wanted to go in about 15 - 20 minutes. We'd definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with InterContinental”
Reviews.Author: washingtonian202
Reviews.Content: After reading many of the reviews on TripAdvisor about this hotel, I truly looked forward to my visit that occured this past weekend. In all honesty, this hotel is new and clean. My room was spacious and had the "basic" amenities that you'd expect. Although a small flat screen TV with poor reception seemed out of place. In my opinion, though, the most important commodity that a hotel can offer is customer service. The InterContinental falls short in this area. The service during my stay was inconsistant and seemed contribed. When I arrived on Friday night, the key to my room did not work. I returned to the Front Desk and waited in line to ask for a new key. The lady that I dealt with was short tempered and seemed inconvenienced to help me although she finally gave me a key that worked. Later that evening, I met friends in their bar "Rhumba". The place was busy and the service was exceptionally slow. When we were finally served, our order was incorrect and the food that we did get was luke warm. We brought this fact to our server and she begrudgingly reordered our food and after some time delivered it. The following morning I was awoken at 5:30AM because the maid did not turn off the alarm clock from the previous occupant of my room. That inconjunction with the loud noises from the room next door at 6:00AM made for an early Saturday morning. When I spoke with the Front Desk, I was told (pleasantly) that I should have checked the alarm before retiring. Based on my personal experience, and the price that I payed, I would say that the InterContinental is closer to a *** star hotel and not the ***** star hotel as it portrays itself to be.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay at InterContinental-Boston”
Reviews.Author: dmhickey
Reviews.Content: Great long weekend stay in Boston for a wedding. Central location close to Northend, Downtown, Markets, MTA Red Line Stop at South Station and surprisingly short walk to Boston Commons. Very helpful staff. Arrived on red-eye flight from West Coast and staff stored bags and had a room for us by 11:00 AM. Honored Government Per Diem rate on busy weekend in Boston and still got corner room. Room faced street which other reviews complain about as loud. These fussy business travelers must not stay in the hotels I usually do because the soundproofing was very good with little street noise for a large city. Bathroom and TV were 5 stars. Lobby bar lively and hip. No hot tub in spa though. Also, room service breakfast was disappointing for price. Hotel should consider more affordable breakfast buffet for business travelers. If you can get a discounted rate, this is a great hotel and location for a romantic weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Unseasoned Travellers Will Love This Intercontinental Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: cspencer60605
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 3 night stay at this Intercontinental. First, the good points: - Nice locale - close to the Financial District. - New hotel - large room, clean. - Modern design - like a typical Westin or Marriot. Not so good points: - Staff is horrible!! - registration was a disaster. Arrived at 3pm, room was not ready till 6pm. Can live with that, but not the rude welcome that I received nor the empty promise from the registration guy of a cell phone call when my room was ready! When I returned to check in at 6pm, I had to wait 10 minutes while they sorted out some problem with my room. - Room service was outrageously priced for what it was!! - Have no problem paying top dollar for quality, Dryed out scrambled eggs, soggy toast and service with a grimace doesn't constitute quality. Unfortunately, their bar was only a slight notch above that let down. - Soundproof the windows!! my room faced what seemed to be Boston's main firehouse. Sirens at all hours of the night - get the picture?? Previously I stayed at the Intercontinental hotel in Montreal and the experience was close to the same! Lousy service, mediocre food options. Long story short, travel to Boston often on business, there are many great hotels to choose from... this ones a dud!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!!”
Reviews.Author: pmonachina
Reviews.Content: When I booked with Hotwire, I knew that this was a brand new hotel in a location in Boston that was a little unfamiliar to me. It turned out to be close to everything-the North End, Quincy Market and the Common. The subway (South Station)is a block away which made it very convenient as we were traveling by the "T" only. The hotel was luxurious and the room spacious and beautiful. The bathroom was large and elegant. The staff was professional and very helpful. The one downside is that we would not have been able to stay there if I had booked with the hotel directly because the rooms are quite expensive. Overall, it was a pleasant stay in a great area overlooking Boston Harbor.

Reviews.Title: “property awesome, details still need work”
Reviews.Author: aurolingus
Reviews.Content: Overall this is a great new hotel but some of the staff needs instruction. The maid BARGED INTO MY ROOM AT 8:30 A.M. on a Saturday morning WITHOUT knocking, just walked right in, assuming for some unknown reason that no one was there since my husband had left the room at 8 to go to a meeting. I, however, was STILL TRYING TO SLEEP. I cannot imagine in what parallel universe someone would assume that no one was in the room because one person had left it. She didnt even look at the bed when she came in, just headed straight for the windows to open the curtains. I said EXCUSE ME I'm trying to sleep here! She apologized and left, but it took me awhile to get back to sleep. Absolutely no excuse whatsoever for that to have happened. However, one of the concierges by the name of Rob Fournier, made up for the maid's nitwitedness. He could not have been nicer or more accommodating, fielding stupid tourist questions with aplomb and taking extra care to explain the route to the Capital Grille and that to get back to the hotel, the route was different because of the one-way streets. With just an address to go by, we never would have found the restaurant had he not detailed it to a T on a map. Very nice fellow. Room was great, bed very comfortable with soft sheets and a down comforter. Bathroom awesome, toiletries top notch. Beware the bottle of Evian water by the bedside - it is NOT included in the room price, as it is a part of the mini-bar at $7 I believe. There was a basket of fruit awaiting me but as I was not sure if it was equipped with the same sensors that everything in the mini-bar was, I didnt touch it. I assume it was gratis because it was not mentioned on the mini-bar pricing sheet. Breakfast was lovely but kinda pricey but the price was pretty much in line with this sort of property. Breakfast service uneven - I hadnt made up my mind what I wanted the first time the waiter came around, and he ignored me for a full 15 minutes after I had decided what I wanted and put my menu down. The restaurant in the morning gets full sun and it was warm and inviting. We were there on the first night of the Red Sox playoff games against Cleveland and in the evening before game time, taxis were scarce. We ended up driving to the restaurant after being given the great directions by Rob. We had a room on the 10th floor (non-harbor side) which was very quiet in terms of noise from within. I have seen many complaints on Tripadvisor about the Fire Dept being loud at night - a $50 white noise machine from Hammacher-Schlemmer and some foam earplugs makes all that go away. However, it would be very nice for a property of this magnitude (4 or 5 stars) to provide these amenities for their guests on the non-harbor side of the building - a small investment on their part that would go a long way toward customer satisfaction overall. They wouldnt even have to necessarily put them in every room - just have them available for free or for a very nominal charge - it would be a very welcome amenity. All in all, however, a nice stay. I would definitely return but I'd book thru priceline first.

Reviews.Title: “good conference facilities and food”
Reviews.Author: Ikura
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference in the hotel. Convenient location a few blocks from the central South Station subway stop. My room was very quiet. Conference facilities were excellent; many of the rooms had beautiful harbor views. Food was top-notch. Only complaint was the TV's picture was distorted and blurry, due to it being fit to a wide screen. The hotel had locked the picture controls, so I couldn't make it a normal-sized, non-distorted display.

Reviews.Title: “intercontintental Boston just OUTSTANDING.”
Reviews.Author: tc1942
Reviews.Content: I took my family to Boston to celebrate two special birthdays,we picked the intercontinental with Virgin Atlantic airways.It was a wise choice in every way.The size of the bedroom,and the bathroom were very large.The waterfront is a good location as its close to the tube underground,and convenient for walking to the centre.The restaurant was good and not overly expensive by Boston prices.The staff were excellent,and all very helpfull.I would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: ICE-Zugfahrer
Reviews.Content: New, spacious hotel on Atlantic Avenue about 200 yards from South Station. Rooms were large and well laid-out; the bathroom alone was bigger than the room in many other hotels I've stayed at. I got a Hotwire deal otherwise it would have been unaffordable! Only downside: there's a French-Provencale restaurant and room service menu of Boston specialities, but no in-house coffee shop or lighter dining, which makes the place more like a very upmarket 3-star hotel than the 5-star it aspires to be.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptionally good hotel”
Reviews.Author: monkeydevil
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a night at the Intercontinental Hotel in Boston and it was a fabulous choice! First of all, everybody who works there from the valet parking staff to the desk staff to the concierge is friendly, helpful and courteous. They go out of their way to make sure their guests have a pleasant stay and are tremendous resources for local info; places to eat, things to do, how to get around the city etc. The hotel is spotless and has a great location overlooking Boston Harbor. Our room was impressive with a super comfortable King sized bed with luxury linens, a down comforter and soft, fluffy pillows. There are so many comfort touches...each side of the bed has focused beam, adjustable neck reading lights that come out of the wall, the wall of windows has block-out drapes, there are plenty of lamps all around the room, there is a flat screen TV, a huge wall mirror and a granite shelf just inside the door (perfect for putting things down as you come in or out), The closet has a pair of solid, substantial doors that close with a magnetic catch and a light goes on inside it whenever it is opened. The bathroom is beautiful with a granite topped vanity, a lighted, adjustable makeup mirror, marble floor and walls and a glass enclosed marble shower with both a showerhead and a handheld shower. The water pressure is excellent and there is plenty of hot water. There is a deep soaking tub and above it is a set of sliding panels that open to the bedroom. The bed is on the other side and I was able to watch TV from the tub in the evening and while brushing my teeth the next morning. All the furniture and wood trim throughout is high quality: dark and solid and reminded me of a sophisticated blend of Arts and Crafts/Contemporary with a touch of Asian influence. There are shoji style panels above the bed with built-in soft nightlights. There was even a chaise at the foot of the bed. Of course there are all the techno-necessities for business travelers. What was particularly striking was the quiet; we never heard any noise from the hall or from other rooms. The carpeting is thick and the walls must be very solid. This is a wonderful choice for a romantic getaway right down to the robes, soft plush towels and deliciously scented bath products. We would stay here again in a heartbeat and will highly recommend it to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Travelers be warned”
Reviews.Author: WTF001
Reviews.Content: I recently spent 5 days in Boston and decided to stay at the Intercontinental due to it being highly recommended by several people. I booked two months ahead with the hotel and had all the appropriate reservation numbers and stay times. Upon arrival the hotel stated that they were charging me for a night that I had not reserved or been there for, despite having a faxed copy of my reservation times. The front desk person not only ignored my complaints, but called the manager over who proceeded to raise his voice and imply that I was in the wrong. Additionally, after a call to the credit card company I discovered they had already charged me for the night not reserved. Needless to say, I was not happy, but decided to go ahead and try the hotel out since the charge for the night in question has been removed by the credit card company. Deciding to stay was a mistake as the bathroom was dilapidated and unclean with most things being broken in the room itself. Also, getting the hotel room cleaned every day required a call to the front desk as the cleaning service had not cleaned the rooms by 3:00 PM. Upon checking out, I brought up all of these issues with a manager and was scolded for complaining and not showing up on the dates that were reserved. The one positive point of the hotel is the concierge service, which makes excellent restaurant recommendations. In conclusion, travelers are warned to check their reservation times and credit cards carefully if considering this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: carrollkvn
Reviews.Content: Just stayed for two nights over labor day weekend. Booked hotel through priceline and got a $125 a night rate which was excellent compared to other properties. Great room, huge bathroom with both tub and shower. Staff were professional and friendly and enjoyed our stay. We found location to be fine, only a short walk to most attractions and close to the subway. Gym and pool were incredible.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jad7721
Reviews.Content: From the moment you arrive from Logan, a short 8 minute drive, although with airport fees, the fare ends up being about $22, you are greeted by a wonderful staff in a hotel that meets all expectations. There is nothing bad about this hotel. Great rooms, comfortable beds, large bathrooms, even in the standard rooms, and a nice gym.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Daoda
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel. Beds were super comfortable, room was large and very stylish, location is great, staff friendly. French brasserie restaurant on site was excellent, if expensive. Really can't think of anything to complain about.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience”
Reviews.Author: bighoov36
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at the Intercontinental Hotel for 2 nights to celebrate our anniversary and to see Boston for the very first time. The service was phenomenal, from the bell hops who greeted us at the door to the concierge who offered us advice on things to do and see in Boston. What surprised me the most is that I was able to get this luxury hotel through priceline at a significantly reduced price and the folks at the hotel still provided us with a King size bed and a very early check in (9:30AM). The rooms are very modern and the bathroom is second to none. The location is great as well. On the water and just down the street from the T. In addition the Old Town Trolley is just a 5 minute walk and it is a great way to see Boston. The only downside that I can come up with are the prices at their bar. It cost us $18.50 for a martini and a bottle of beer. Outside of that, we could not have had a better two days. I would definitley stay there again if I am back in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Caroline91
Reviews.Content: Advertised as a 5 star hotel but it isn't - it's a solid 4 star. For example there were no slippers in the room, only one robe for two people (a second was requested but taken away by the cleaning staff the next day), the rooms were cleaned well enough but not really left looking finished, no evening turn down, etc. In addition, some of the staff on the front desk seemed very disinterested and couldn't always answer basic questions about the hotel and we had to call our own taxi one evening as there was no one out front. On the plus side, the gym, pool and spa are all nice and there was no problem getting spa appointments. The rooms were big, although not very well sound proofed and a little too warm even though we put the air condititioning on maximun, but to be fair it was 30+ outside so maybe there was a lot of pressure on the system.
