The location was good and for what we paid it was not bad value so if you get a good deal this hotel is worth visiting. But if you want 5 star luxuary it's not the place!

Reviews.Title: “Great room with hotwire price!!”
Reviews.Author: coronaman1978
Reviews.Content: Myself and 3 friends recently stayed here for an evening. Valet me us out front and took the car to park. Check in was smooth and the room was good size. I booked this trip on Hotwire so it was only 170.00 a night and for downtown Boston I was impressed. I do not know if it is a 5 star because I never really felt that wow this place is exceptional but that being said its for sure a 4 star. The bathrooms are gigantic. A tub that is seperate from a large ( room for 2 ) stand up glass shower. The staff seemed friendly what limited contact we had with them. The only down side of the stay was the fire alarm at 4:15 am which I guess unless they pulled it intentially there is nothing they can do about that . I would stay here again for sure and would recommend going through Hotwire to get a room. Hope this helped some of you!!!

Reviews.Title: “Run, don't walk, away from the InterContinental Boston”
Reviews.Author: chickles
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the InterContinental Hotel in Boston from 8/19/2007 to 8/23/2007 for a conference. My reservations were made for the dates of the conference (8/19/2007 to 8/23/2007) by a travel agent working through my particular conference. When I arrived on 8/19 and tried to check in, the front desk staff said that their records showed I should have checked in on the day before and that they were going to charge me for a whole additional night (which isn't exactly pocket change!). I showed them my reservation, which had the dates of my stay 8/19/2007 to 8/23/2007. I tried to cancel my reservations there and they insisted that I would have to pay for the night before we came anyway. To add additional pressure, they said they would give away my room if I didn't check in immediately. Because I wouldn't be able to find a hotel room in that general during the conference, I ended up having to stay at this hotel. I asked for the manager, and he insisted that despite what the our reservation paper said, I had to pay for the additional night because it was their policy... even though my paper said otherwise. He was very rude and did not offer an apology. On 8/23/2007, while checking out, I tried to talk to the manager again about the reservations being messed up. He told us there was nothing he could do about the mistake they made on my reservation. Then he told me that he "remembered" that my reservation different check in date than was actually on my confirmation sheet; that it was my fault because I was stupid and couldn't read our confirmation paper. Staying at the hotel turned out to be a mistake because this hotel did not live up to it's four star potential. One design flaw with the hotel there is a panel of frosted glass over the top of the bed, which opens up to show a panorama the toilet and shower. This was annoying for two reasons: 1. a small piece of glass does not provide the same privacy that a wall would if you are using the bathroom, and 2. if someone uses the bathroom at night, the whole bedroom is lit up. The list of the following reasons are the problems we had with our room. 1. A family with a young child was staying in the room next to us. We could hear the family's conversations clearly, as well as the child's screaming fits through the adjoining door (please see the picture). 2. The pipes under our sink in the bathroom leaked all over the floor making it slippery (please see the picture). 3. There was hair in the bathtub when we checked in (it was not our hair). 4. The tv had very bad reception (please see the picture). 5. The handle was falling off the bathroom door, making it difficult to get out of the bathroom. 6. The alarm clock wasn't sufficiently loud and was easy to sleep through. Overall because of the problems of with our room and with the rude management, I would NOT recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “4.5*”
Reviews.Author: VincentChase
Reviews.Content: The Intercontinental Boston is classed as a 4.5* hotel and a 4.5* hotel it is. Better than a 4* but not as good as a 5*. Essentially all the positive reviews stems from the fact that it is new, modern, spacious, well located and cheap if booked through priceline or hotwiere. The negative side is that the reception staff are not very good, you do not have staff waiting on you hand and foot as you would in a 5* hotel and the room lacks the minute touches of elegance, like slippers or a laundry bag. That said for $130 a night, it is a bagain! The pool and gym are very well designed and it really made my trip to Boston. The beds are very nice too.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Everything a First Class Hotel Should Be”
Reviews.Author: TexTraveler1
Reviews.Content: On a business trip in Boston's Financial Center I found the Intercontinental to be excellent. The meticulously-clean and spacious rooms, clever layout and amenities, splendid views and superb business location made it a perfect choice. The only negative was the absence of a hotel directory identifying the hotel amenities - the fitness center and other facilities. When I asked the concierge about a directory, he advised that it was on one of the television channels. During my stay the television channel was off the air although there was a general Boston tourist channel and a hotel events channel, but no directory on any channel. As a result I was unable to identify or use many of the amenities at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome bed, Great Doorman, Dont touch the mini fridge!”
Reviews.Author: BackpackingTexan
Reviews.Content: I stayed here after driving all day from Virginia during my move to New Hampshire. I had my bed strapped on top of my truck and although my car wouldn't fit in the garage, the bellmen unloaded it and found a place to store it overnight. (The manager on duty, a smaller woman who talked very quietly and who I could barely understand, was not helpful and very adamant that my car would not fit, but 2 bellmen actually made it happen against the wishes of an annoyed manager). When we checked in they had bumped us up to a junior suite with a great view of the harbor. The room was spotless and the bathroom was huge with a great shower and a nice size tub. Everything looked brand new and I thought we may have been the first people to stay in that suite, because it was so clean and tidy. The bed was amazing and the sheets and pillows were perfectly soft. The only problem was that the 30 inch flat screen LCD TV had a grainy picture. This seems to be more common in the new larger hotels when the cable is split too many times between the rooms and the signal is degraded. However, if you stay at this hotel don't waste your time watching TV. The North End is just a few blocks away and there is a great walk along the harbor to the aquarium and other attractions just outside the hotel. When we checked out, the hotel had charged us $100 for a bunch of drinks we didn't drink out of the mini-fridge. Apparently there is an automatic sensor on each individual drink if you pick it up or even move it. The front desk rectified the problem immediately, but I am assuming this is a common problem and that this system won't work because that really set me off when I heard that touching the bottle automatically charges your room. (You can't even tell what some of the bottles are unless you pick them up or move them around). Don't let the hotel charge you for this, and if for some reason they do, go back to the room and take whatever they charged you for. When I was leaving the manager on duty, a really helpful 40 something man, got a bellman and personally loaded my bed back onto my truck. Night manager and mini bar aside, this hotel was one of the best I have stayed at. The decor, while appearing cheap Vegas/trendy simplistic, was actually very functional and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice time”
Reviews.Author: tlovetotravel
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice time at the Intercontinental. We were there mid-week and did the tourist thing. We walked the Freedom Trail, took the ferry back to Long Wharf and were happy to discover we were only 3 blocks from the hotel. The hotel was very clean with modern touches. Our room was very nice (on the 5th floor, back side). My only real complaint was the bathroom. It was definitely beautiful but it had sliding windows that opened above the bed. When these were closed the person on the toilet could see the person sitting on the bed through the 1-2 inch gap at the bottom. Overall, we were very pleased with our stay - the parking is pricy but what you would expect in a city. I did notice the lack of a bellman. I'm not sure if they were busy? Anyway, we had a very nice visit and I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A gem!”
Reviews.Author: HZM
Reviews.Content: I booked 2 rooms at the Intercontinental, Boston in July 07 for my husband and I and for my parents. From check-in to check-out, the stay could not have been better. All the staff we met with were professional, accommodating and friendly, from the reception desk to the spa. I had booked a harbour-view room for my parents and it was perfect. Very spacious with two queen beds, with the whole back wall floor to ceiling windows overlooking the river, across to the children's museum. My husband's and my room was slightly smaller with a king sized bed, chaise longue, and separate desk area. Even though we did not request a view with our room, we had a partial river view which was lovely. The bathrooms were amazing. In our room, we had a sliding partition between the bathroom to the bedroom so we could chat to each other while we are taking a bath! The bathroom in my parent's room did not have this feature, which was fine for them. The bathrooms had separate walk-in showers which was great too. Plush robes. Nice toiletries. Their turn-down service included filling our ice bucket and leaving a small chocolate for us, which I thought was a nice touch. We checked out the spa in the morning before check-out. The gym is well equipped and even has a yoga/pilates area. There is fruit and bottled water available and most of the machines have individual TVs built in which you can watch as you work-out. The pool was lovely - very calming and a good enough size for laps. The best part of the spa is the ecalyptus steam bath in the locker rooms. Heaven! Treatments are available in the spa too, although we didn't partake of any. Prior to our visit, I was slightly worried that the location may not be so good, but I was wrong. The whole area is being re-developed and the back of the hotel (overlooking the river) has a nice walkway along the river's edge. The Boston Tea Party is normally docked there, however it was not there at the time of our visit. The hotel is a mere 10 minutes walk from Quincy Market and about 3 minutes walk (across the bridge) to the bustling Barking Crab, which is a fun place to spend an evening. 24-hour valet parking was $39. Not cheap, but convenient. I only have one minor gripe about the whole stay. Coffee is available, mid-week, in the hotel lobby before 7am. My mother is an early riser. She went down around 6ish, got a coffee and enjoyed that outside in the early morning sun. My father went down around 6:45am, and the coffee was finished. All in all, our stay at the Intercontinental Boston was perfect. I will highly recommend it to my friends for any future stays in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ONTHEGOMississippi
Reviews.Content: Our family of 6 stayed at the Intercontinental Hotel for 1 night. I had reservations for 2 rooms. My family had to take 2 cabs from the airport to the hotel. The second cab arrived 30 minutes and $30 cheaper tha the one I was riding in. After my scenic trip of downtown Boston, my cabbie finally delivered me to my destination. I told him I was only paying the fare that my husband had paid his driver and I didn't appreciate his dishonesty . I had told him 3 times during the ride the hotel where I was staying. The cabbie became very irrate with me and got out of his taxi and begin to yell at me. The bellman at the hotel stood between me and the cabbie and took care of the situation and finally told him to leave. Very nice guy. When I checked in I had been upgraded to a larger/nicer room with a harbor view. The rooms were very nice especially the bed and pillows. Normally I don't sleep well in hotels, but this night I slept like a baby. Fruit, a box of chocolates, and water was delivered promptly after check-in ( I am a member of the ambassador level). I had contacted the concierge 1 week upon arrival to secure Red Sox tickets via e-mail. He promptly responded and found tickets immediately for our family. They were waiting for us at check-in - great seats I might add. Two of my children used the pool and loved it. I liked the fact that the pool was shallow. I worked out in the fitness facility and would work out in all hotels I stay in if they were like the Intercontinental Hotel. I watched t.v. on my treadmill as I ran and bottled water was available. We ate breakfast in the restaurant on Sunday morning. Big mistake and very pricey. Our tab for 6 (including 2 children was $212.00). Service was not friendly or prompt nor was the food that good. Plus an 18% gratuity was added. Wish we could have stayed longer. Rooms were spacious. bathrooms luxurious and spacious, and staff (except for dining) friendly and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: TakeMeOut
Reviews.Content: Booked at $120 a night for a Saturday night stay via Priceline. More than worth it! The lobby and rooms were beautiful and well-appointed. The deluxe bath had a big shower and very nice tub. Our view was of a wall, but there was enough sunlight: the room was not dark at all. The spa and work out rooms were great, with nice views to distract you. The back esplanade along the water was so pretty and peacful, easy walk to the Children's Museum, Boston Convention Center and South Station. Food looked expensive, drinks definitely were. Wish there was more of a driveway to park our car as we were checking in, but valet was nice enough to let our car sit. We parked at the Post Office Square parking lot for $9 a day! It was only two blocks away, and very safe. Staff was very courteous, both on the phone and in person. Excellent overall. Our friends were impressed. Definitely recommend if you can get it on Priceline.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel at Priceline Rates!”
Reviews.Author: Velvalee
Reviews.Content: We got a last-minute deal on priceline.com for $100/night at this hotel for July 9 & 10. I was a little concerned about some of the reviews I read about the hotel: poor service, the fire station across the street, and priceline guests getting bad rooms. Well, I'm happy to say that the service we received was fantastic, especially from David, the concierge, who could not have been more helpful. Everyone we dealt with was courteous and friendly and professional. They gave us the double room we requested, as I was traveling with my father for a family reunion. Our room was gorgeous--the marble bath, glass shower, and deep tub were beautiful, and we really enjoyed the flat screen tv and fine linens on the beds. There was ample room and storage for both of us, and everything was brand new. Our room was on the west side of the building, so our view was basically of the old warehouse next door being remodeled. However, we never heard any construction noise or noise from the fire department or any other guests. The fitness center was unbelievable for a hotel--it was better than the gym I go to at home! We did not eat at the hotel, but the public areas were very well done, and a lot of people seemed to be enjoying the rum bar. I had also read that this hotel is not in a convenient location, but I can't imagine who would think that! It is a block and a half from the T (South Station), and less than a 10-minute walk to the Aquarium (where all the tour trolleys start out), Quincy Market and Little Italy. And the walk to the aquarium and Little Italy takes you along the waterfront--it's a very safe, attractive area, even after dark. We walked over to Little Italy every night for fantastic Italian food, cannolis, and cappucinos! David, the concierge, recommended several places for us to try and they were all fantastic. From the aquarium, we took a $29 trolley tour that took us all over the city in about 2 hours and included a free harbor tour afterwards! I can't recommend this hotel highly enough--especially for the price we paid. We stayed at a Holiday Inn in Portland Maine on this same trip that didn't come close to the 3* accomodations it promised, yet we paid $153/night...but that's New England in July for you. So our stay at the Intercontinental in Boston was the highlight of our trip. You will really enjoy this hotel--we would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay at great price”
Reviews.Author: CTraveler2007
Reviews.Content: Just spent a Friday night at the InterContinental Boston for $100 which we got the rate through Priceline.com. We arrived early and had no problem getting an early check-in of 1PM. Room was clean and ready to go. If fact, we stayed until 2PM the next day because we are a member of the hotel chain's Priority Club. Parking was a bit pricey at $39 dollars. Checked all nearby parking lots and prices were similar. Could have had $24 weekend rate at parking lot ( Post Office Garage) 3 blocks away if we had decided to waited on parking the car until 4PM. Location was fine...10 minute walk to Quincy Market or the North End. Hotel service for the entire visit was excellent. Spa and gym areas were great. Only disappointment was the "thin" hallway doors that let all hallway noises in the room. Annoying! Overall, I first class experience for a bargain price.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place for a Chick Trip for Women of Color”
Reviews.Author: ivorianqueen
Reviews.Content: I am a single, woman of color, in my late 40's, who has been wanting to visit Boston since being of grade-school age. My friend and I got an unbelievable 3 night-four day rate on this hotel which included airfare, for less than what some have shared that they have paid for a two night stay in this hotel!! I made a decision to spend more time out of my room than in it, but know that this hotel is perfect for those who are looking for a relaxing weekend as well!! The Positives: 1. The hotel's location is great, but only if you are able to do the kind of walking that's associated with big cities like New York and D.C. 2. We were able to catch a bus from the airport to the hotel for the equivalent of two dollars each. A cab would have been a total of $20 for the two of us. We decided to buy a transit pass good for a week which cost $15; a day pass was $9.00. The transit station is a five-ten minute walk from the hotel. My suitcase weighed almost 50 pounds; yet I was able to make it!! 3. The security in this hotel is unbelievable!!! The hotel security were men in suits who "patroled" the lobby area, opened doors for us, and greeted us whenever we encountered them in the lobby on our way in and out of the hotel. I felt safe as a single woman in this hotel. 4. While I am not a fan of sushi, the Sushi/Tequila bar plays salsa music which I love. It has a high-tech look and feel and I was able to get an impromptu salsa lesson from one of the wait staff after the bar had cleared one evening. 5. If you are one who enjoys socializing, make sure you speak to Wayne in the Rum/Champagne Bar and Charles in the Miel Restaurant. They are delightful!! 6. The bathroom was outstanding. It was all marble, oversized, with a glass-encased shower and a separate, long and deep bathtub. It reminded me of those bathrooms one sees in those upscale decorating magazines. Bring your bubble bath, shower gel, exfoliate, and candles!!! 7. The beds were comfortable. 8. We were in room 604, with two double beds. NO VIEW!!! but there were no sirens as mentioned by a fellow reviewer, it was VERY, VERY, QUIET!! 9. The hotel has this little nook in the lobby that contains a Scrabble board and a couple of Monopoly games. I like playing board games so having access to these was a treat! 10. The hotel's Business Center has a limited selection of office supplies available for sale in case you forget something. I did not check the prices. 11. Elevators are fast. 12. We had a probelm connecting to the internet. The front desk was called, the tech crew was there in five minutes and resolved the problem in five more. 13. Walked to the Barking Crab. This place is as causal as a picnic table in a local park but the food was decent. You can't go wrong with the crab legs. 14. There is an iron and ironing board in the room. I prefer to iron with steam. I had a difficult time getting the water into the iron. The Negatives 1. I do not like French food which is the featured food for the hotel's main dining room. It is expensive for a working woman like me. When I say expensive I am talking double-digit prices for appetizers and salads. 2. If you are sharing the room with others you need to know that everything you do in the bathroom can be heard by those outside the bathroom. Bad Singing, Cell Phone Conversations, etc. 3. Another reviewer mentioned that the glasses in the bathroom were not restocked daily. I had this experience too, additionally, we had to call housekeeping for washclothes. NO BIG DEAL JUST A MINOR INCONVENIENCE TO ME. 4. Business Center internet five dollars per 15 minutes. In-room internet 15 dollars a day. You do the math. A laptop was left in the room each day of our stay. No problems. 5. If you are a breakfast person and a bargain traveler you are going to have to leave the hotel and walk across the street to a side street next to the fire department. There is a restaurant named VIGA there that serves a $3.50 breakfast special, but I didn't have time to try it. 6. Be very careful in the bathroom if the marble floor gets wet. I almost fell. USE THE CLOTH BATHMAT OR YOU'RE GOING DOWN!!! 7. We were going to order a roll-away bed to accomodate another friend who decided to spend the night. I think it was going to cost $30-45 per night. 8. Although I'm not a drinking woman I did review the drink menus in both the Sushi/Tequila Bar and the Rum/Champagne Bar. WOW!! I think the drink prices are high; many were double-digit prices in sitandard-sized bar glasses. There was even one drink on the menu that was made with 24-carat gold!!! If you are looking for the ultimate in a glass, this could be the bar for you!! Other Notes 1. Many of the hotel staff are from cities around the world. If you start a conversation they will gladly interact with you. I like this!! 2. I did not eat in the hotel, nor did I go to the pool or spa, or use the bell men, so I can't comment. 3. I was dissapointed with the different bowls of chowder that I had at several different restaurants during my stay in the Boston area. They were too thick and had no flavor. I recommend a small mom and pop restaurant chain called Kelly's Restaurant. There is a location at the end of the blue line at Revere Beach. It is not close but if you can get there this restaurant had the best chowder and other delights from the sea ( lobster rolls, scallops, fried clams, and even roast beef sandwiches) at reasonable prices. Nothing in the restaurant is over $20!!! They are on the web. 4. Many people recommend dining at Legal Seafood. Try Legal, Try Kelly's, then you decide.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, not a single problem”
Reviews.Author: Arbitrage
Reviews.Content: When I stay at a hotel I'm looking for cleanliness, condition of the furnishings in the room, service, value, location and amenities, in that order. I think the hotel is fairly new, or at least it looked it. Not one single thing was dirty, or showed signs of age in my room. The bathroom was spotless. The hallways/lobby were completely clean. I was greeted while getting out of the cab, and the front desk staff was totally efficient and polite. Had no interactions that weren't pleasant. I dont know about value though, its an expensive hotel and thats a hard thing to judge. I think its definitely at least as good as anything else that expensive. The bathroom was massive. Tub and separate shower. The room was large, even by city hotel standards. Flat screen tv and then the usual. Lively restaurant and bar in the lobby. Room service was available 24 hours a day. The hotel is located in the financial district. Its not really a touristy area, however, Faneuil Hall is < 10 minute walk, and we walked to Boston Common. The only thing to watch out for is that if you get a room on either side of the building, you're going to have no view. There are buildings on either side which complete block the view. Ask for a room in the front, or rear of the hotel, with a view. Didnt affect us, we were only in the room to sleep. I would completely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “overrated”
Reviews.Author: lenymari
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel July 3rd and 4th, had a reservation for a Harbor view room (paid extra!), well, the view we had was just a little bit of water and the corner of the hotel - nothing spectacular. We had breakfast at the hotel restaurant - service was very poor. The waiter was not available after taking the order. My husband ordered the top quartet part of the menu - which among other things had a choice of toast or variety of pastries - we were never offered any pastries. I don't know what the big deal is of giving us a pastry (we paid $24 for that order) Room was nice and clean, bed was very comfortable (though robes that are described somewhere as luxuary - are not of such great quality). Overall stay at the hotel - average.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LouisB
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. I have read other reviews that did not like the location. Location was great in my opinion. 20 minute walk to thearter district , Chinatown, Boston Common and Little Italy. 10 minute walk to Quincy and to catch cruises. Less than 5 minutes to South Station. The staff was very friendly and the view is great. I plan to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: cr8zymike
Reviews.Content: My wife and I concluded our east cost trip with a stay in Boston @ the Intercontinental Boston. We loved the room with a king size bed, ample space and a wonderful bathroom. The atmosphere was very relaxing and was very quiet as we did not hear any of our neighbour with the exception of the odd firetruck pulling one night. The gym was fantastic! Brand new equipment with a self-contained tv on the treadmills and the elliptical machine. The only complaint that i have is not the hotel but of the area itself. In the evening, there isn't much in terms of food or even "activity". We would have preferred staying in the Copley Square area where there is more life and more restaurants that are opened later in the evening. Other than that...the location of the hotel is very convenient to the subway but we didn't use the subway at all during our stay. We walked through the "tourist" sites all on one day going from Fanueil Square (10 min away from hotel) all the way to Copley Square and Newburry Street and back to the hotel. We enjoyed our stay and i'll definitely go back for the hotel but will need to think about the area as one of the decision makers for next time.

Reviews.Title: “Brand new luxury hotel that lives up to expectations from Intercontinental”
Reviews.Author: CdnWT
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure to stay at the brand new Intercontinental Boston at the end of June. The reviews were mostly positive so I wasn't too too worried about what to expect. And so should you. This is a very good hotel with an excellent location, especially for business. I've travelled and stayed much more often lately in 3 to 5 star rated hotels of all kinds; a Marriott, some Hyatts, Westin, Radisson and now I got to try this Intercontinental. As much as I'd be close to giving this hotel a 5/5, I'll give it a 4 as it was lacking just a few little things to really be an "excellent" (per TripAdvisor ratings) hotel. But it definately was "above average". A lot has already been said in other reviews so I'll try to be quick. STAFF: Most staff were nice although lacking the charm and friendliness of smaller hotels. They were very polite and mostly helpful. That is exactly what I suppose, you can expect from Intercontinental. Check-in was fast, I was advised even how much they would freeze on my card and the gentleman confirmed I wanted 2 beds non-smoking. The room was far from the elevator and depsite facing the Boston Fire Dept. , as some mentionned I believe, I never heard a sirene. ROOM: Excellent with dark new furniture, blackout drapes and plasma TV. Bathroom was huge with a great stand up all marble shower and a separate deep soaking tub. A modern hotel meant an amazingly quiet AC and automatic light sensors for when you get in the room. Cleanliness was alright, the work desk was covered with a glass for protection and was full of finger and hand prints that were there when we got the room and which were never cleaned during our stay. Glasses were not changed depsite having been clearly used the night before. The tub's hot water pressure, already weak the first night, died the second night and at one point was spraying brown water with residues. Same with the sink. Somewhere, it seemed someone flushed the pipes. Maintenance was sent up but never came back to tell If it could be fixed or not. Front desk did not ask If we wanted a room switch which I would have refused anyways but they perhaps should have asked when I did mention it to the desk. Mattress, as mentionned right in the previous reviews, could have been much better, especially for an Intercontinental. Both Marriotts and H yatts have much better bedding. Cheap Serta pillowtop. Two goose pillows. I like soft but you might not. POOL/SPA: Already said, clean, relaxing with music. Amazingly huge and clean gym. Nice attendants. PARKING: At 39$, it's a rip off, especially on week-end. Just about everything around is cheaper If you don't mind a little walk. Overall, the hotel was very good. It lost the 5th point on cleanliness, bedding quality and dealing with problems. Otherwise, everything about the hotel was 5 star. Don't worry, book it, and have fun!

Reviews.Title: “surprisingly good for a chain hotel”
Reviews.Author: mikebevans
Reviews.Content: Newly refurbished the Interconti sits on the water - fabulous for beakfast al fresco. Though it's in the financial district, it's not far to walk to Fanueil Hall etc. Bedroom was fabulous; quiet a/c; nice bath with sliding wall to see through the bedroom. Great service. Great bed and everything worked. Bar very shrill - they could do with some sof furnsihings to reduce noise level. but there's a great sexy red room off the bar if you want more peace. Restaurant: two beakfasts both excellent and dinner one night also good. Waiter even left the bottle for me to finish when I wa shaving by the glass. Don't tell the management.

Reviews.Title: “Great Priceline Win!”
Reviews.Author: msruckus
Reviews.Content: Won this hotel at the very last minute on Priceline and didn't have a chance to find out anything about it. I was pleasantly surprised by a gorgeous new hotel well located in the Finacial District. The lobby was modern, beautiful, clean and busy in a good way, making you feel like a part of something exciting. The bar in the lobby and the restaurant were very good. The room was spacious and well appointed. The beds were okay, not ultra comfortable. Also, the pillows were disappointing - not enough of them and too soft. The bathroom was great - huge with a big tub and separate shower. There was a plasma screen tv in the room, but the cheap kind with only a mediocre picture. There was not free internet in the room; in fact it was $15/day. In a brand new hotel, this in inexcusable. Also, parking is a steep $39/day, but the valets were helpful and always available. Room service was prompt, polite and tasty. My favorite part of the hotel, however, was the spa and fitness area. The fitness area featured brand new equiptment with individual television screens. The weight machines were very smooth and easy to use. The pool was serene and clean. The spa was small but lovely. My sister and I had truly great facials there. We would stay at this hotel again, any time, even at three times the price.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at the Intercontinental, loved the harbor view.”
Reviews.Author: huitzi
Reviews.Content: We have visited Boston several times and in the past always stayed near the Boston Common. We decided to try something different this time and went with the Intercontinental. As others have mentioned, South Station and the Silver Line are just minutes from the hotel, so you can get anywhere you want to go from there. Also, a few more blocks in the other direction is the Aquarium and that Subway stop also. BTW, I highly recommend checking out the Aquarium, it was beautiful and fascinating. Check-in was accomplished in minutes and they didn't even bat an eye that we were early, even though the hotel was booked solid for the weekend. I really appreciated that, and I was thrilled when I saw our harbor view room, the windows are floor to ceiling so as to take advantage of the lovely vista. I liked everything about the room and I felt it was extremely well thought out and executed. It was very spacious, lots of storage, very nice lighting, big flat screen TV, quite comfortable and relaxing. And the bathroom was great also, huge, with a separate, deep soaking tub and a terrific shower with awesome water pressure and a handheld shower head as well as the overhead one. And the bath products! I am really picky about them and always bring my own organic stuff but the J. Floris products were just fantastic- very luxurious and natural, they are even stamped with a "use by" date. The body lotion was especially nice. The bed and bedding were wonderful also. We enjoyed the bar and the restaurant and were not disappointed in the quality of the food and drinks. Of course you never expect bargain prices but you do hope to at least get your money's worth and we felt we did. Especially when we had breakfast on the outside terrace, overlooking the water. All in all, definitely a five star experience and we will happily return.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the intercontinental”
Reviews.Author: cutedisney
Reviews.Content: We loved our king bed room with a harbour view! They upgraded us for free to a harbour view without even asking! The rooms are nicely furnished with all new amenities. Remember not to take out and even look at the mini bar since it will automatically charge your room! We had a travelzoo discount and a good weekend getaway. Also walking distance to the T and the bus station, Loved it loved it loved it! one negative is that there are no restaurants around but you can just walk to the marketplace so no big deal. Hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: trippin_it_up
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Intercontinental for 5 nights in May while attending a conference. It is convenient to financial district, the Boston Convention Center, and the South Street train station is within a couple hundred yards, so it is easy to hop on the T and get any where in the city. The hotel is nicely decorated inside and out. The rooms are classy with a 37" LCD TV, work area, and a great marble bathroom with a soaking tub and separate shower. The hotel restaurant was OK, but overpriced, but there are many great places to eat in Boston and many within a mile of the hotel. The workout room was great with many cybex weight machines, treadmills, and ellipticals. I will definitely stay here again.
